loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Sreymao is 34 years old and the mother of three schoolchildren. Nowadays, she makes a living selling grocery items. Involved in this business for two years, she earns about 40,000 KHR per day.

Leading a group of two, Sreymao is making her first loan request with Kiva partner VisionFund. With the goal of improving her living conditions, she will spend her portion to build a decent latrine.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia has been operating her grocery store and billiard pool business for many years. She also owns and manages a transportation service, earning well for her family. Alicia used the income from her previous loan to buy additional grocery items for her store and supplies needed in her billiard pool business. She successfully repaid her loan. 

Alicia is requesting a new loan, amounting to PHP 50,000. She will utilize the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She will also use her loan to improve her sales and increase revenue in her other businesses to improve the general living conditions of her family. Alicia appears here in a photo with her tricycle unit.

She hopes for her business to grow bigger, and she dreams of providing a house to each of her children. Alicia meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit and to bolster her other businesses.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a hardworking woman. She is married and she supports nine children. Monicah is a farmer. She enjoys her business and has done it for the last 35 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 28,000.

Monicah has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES. 40,000, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting, and to pay laborers. She successfully repaid her previous loan.She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children as well as improve her living standards.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a dairy farmer as well as become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 42 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Elena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.en:
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN/SÉGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 16ème prêt solidaire. Kadia, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 Kg de riz, 50 Kg de farine de blé, 50 Kg de maïs, 20 Kg de fonio, 20Litres d’huile et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 42 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: SEYNABOU est  une jeune femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation d’accessoires pour téléphones portables. Elle est célibataire qui n’a pas d’enfants. Elle a une expérience de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle détient un magasin dans le marché. Elle sollicite ce prêt de ce montant pour acheter des accessoires de téléphones portables. Elle aide sa mère dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses soeurs. SEYNABOU commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 21h. Elle voudrait renforcer son magasin et diversifier ses produits. Avec l’aide de l’institution augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Seynabou is a young woman who is building up a business buying and selling accessories for portable telephones. She is single and has no children. She has five years' experience in this business and has a shop in the market. She is requesting this loan to buy accessories for portable telephones. She helps her mom out with the daily outgoings and her sisters' schooling costs. Seynabou begins her day at eight o'clock in the morning and finishes at nine in the evening. She would like to build up her shop and diversify her products. With the help of the institution, she would like to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy telephone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 37-year-old married Palestinian Refugee father of one child.  He lives and works  in a Palestinian refugee camp.
Abdullah has owned a grocery shop since January 2014.  He used to work as a house painter, but due to the hard social and financial situations, he turned to a daily income business to make sure he can cover his family’s daily living needs.
Today, Abdullah is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special offer products that will attract customers’ attention and increase his income. 
This loan will help Abdullah increase his income, which will improve his social and financial situations, and help him build a better future for his child.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special offer products that will attract customers’ attention and increase his income

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23 year old university student majoring in micro-finance, and he is in his fourth year. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with his family, which consists of six siblings and his parents. 

Mohammad also works in the evenings at a clothes store as a salesman. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his master's degree so that he will find a good job in his field of study. But he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tinna

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Tinna.  She is married, and has two children aged 3 and 6. In 2012, Tinna established her cosmetics and hairdressing salon business. She began her business because she has to take care of herself and her family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month.

Tinna is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. She needs a loan in order to purchase more stock for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to better enhance her living standard, earning and profit margins. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. 

In the future, Tinna plans to educate her two children up to university and buy a plot of land to build. This business has helped her in raising her children.  She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will save enough for her retirement age. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad Kaleem

texts.en: Mohammad has a wholesale business of fruits where he sells fruits to retailers for reselling. He is 29 years old. He lives in Karachi with his family, and has two children. He is very hard-working. He has more than 10 years of experience in this business. Now that he is married with two children, their expenses have been increasing. Therefore, to increase his earnings he wants to purchase more. This way he will be able to save some money for the future.  Therefore, he has requested for a loan to help him buy fruits and vegetables in bulk for reselling purposes. He is enthusiastic about his business and wants to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.en:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KONDA, un des villages de la commune de TENE cercle de TOMINIAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’ arachide  avec  Gadana,  femme assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à TENE, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 42 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, tools and seeds.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 56-year-old man who is married to Agnes, and together they are blessed with five children. Harrison earns additional income from farming to support his family, and he has been a farmer for ten years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Harrison was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, and he is now servicing his first loan of KES 7899, with which he intends to buy a solar lamp.

He looks forward to starting a livestock rearing business and to selling to his customers, and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aissatou Commandant 's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Aissatou(debout à l’extrême droite), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles âgés de 05 à 20 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits plus particulièrement  la banane, elle vend aussi de l’arachide grillée. Elle achète sa marchandise auprès des producteurs ou intermédiaires en gros et demi gros pour la revente au détail au marché communal.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 10 cartons de 25 kg de bananes  pour la revente au détail.

Elle désire avec les bénéfices appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires et sanitaires surtout pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of highly committed women who have further developed, since the creation of their banc villageois on 25th November 2003, several revenue-generating activities which mostly focus on small-scale retail. The solid relationships maintained by their group members are based on solidarity and communal aide. 

Aissatou (the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to five children, three boys and two girls, who are aged between 5 and 20 years old. She earns a living by selling fruit, bananas in particular, but she also sells toasted peanuts. She gets her supplies in bulk and half-bulk from producers and intermediaries, which she then resells at the local market.

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing at least 10 25-kg boxes of bananas which she will then resell.

With these profits, she hopes to support her husband with paying for their children's school and medical fees.

loans.use: to purchase at least  boxes of bananas  which she will then resell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 52 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Aida has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Wentenda Grand Groupe

texts.fr:
Mme MARIE est responsable du groupe WENTEEDA GRAND GROUPE. Mariée, elle est mère de neuf (09) enfants. Le plus âgé a plus de 40 ans et le moins âgé à 20 ans. Une personne va à l’école et elle a six (06) personnes en charge.
Elle fait de l’élevage et du jardinage depuis sept (07) ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter du deux (02) porcins pour engrosser et revendre, une (01) planche d’oignon, une (01) planche de tomate et un (01) sac d’ engrais pour son jardin.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarité et le besoin de la famille. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et étendre ses bénéfices sur ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
Marie is the representative of the 'Wenteeda Grand Groupe'.  She is married and has nine children.  The eldest is over 40 years old and the youngest is 20 years old.  One of her children attends school and she is responsible for a total of six people.  She has been raising livestock and growing vegetables for seven years now.  

Marie buys her supplies locally and will use her loan to buy two pigs to fatten up for resale, a quantity of onion seed, a quantity of tomato seed and a sack of fertilizer for her garden.  Her profits will be used to pay school fees and provide for the needs of her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and use her profits to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to fatten up for resale and a quantity of onion seed, a quantity of tomato seed and a sack of fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Liberman

texts.en: Liberman enters this year in the Academy of Maritime Nusantara in the program of Management and Harbor Administration. He comes from a small village on the island of Nias, North Sumatra, Indonesia. Liberman is the fourth of five children. His father works as an ordinary farmer and his income is very limited and  only sufficient for the needs of their daily meals. His father hopes Liberman will get an education for his future and to help his brothers. Due to his father's expectations, Liberman applied for a loan to Kiva, to pay for his education until completion. He wants to quickly complete college and become a professional employee in a harbor. Liberman is hoping for the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Kankélétigui sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des chaussures en plastic, du fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 pièces d’habits. Elles s’approvisionnent en habits à Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à Daoudabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Awa compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kankélétigui group are married women who all live in monogamous households in Daoudabougou, a district of Bamako. They average 39 years of age and five children each, and they know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship and through their income-generating activities. Among other things, they sell plastic shoes, precooked fonio and millet flour. 

In order to build their inventory, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 2nd group loan cycle.

Mrs. Awa (sitting at the far left in the group photo) is a successful reseller of clothing. She will use her loan to buy 200 pieces of clothing. She buys her merchandise in Bamako, and she retails it in Daoudabougou as an itinerant vendor or on order, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Awa expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which she will use to provide for her children’s healthcare. 

Her goal is to bolster her activity through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Mekar Asih group received a new loan of the same size as their prior loan. As one of the groups that receives the most loans from MUK, the purpose of the group is to be self-sufficient in terms of venture capital. Their goal is to be able to manage the business well and continue with their own capital. The group still needs a new loan for their businesses because they have a strong will to become successful pig breeders. The loan will be used to improve their businesses by purchasing superior piglets or a sow. 

Ni Ketut used her loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. Her husband helps her in the business by finding traditional feed such as banana leaves everyday from his garden. With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen. One member is not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Fatou Ibou 's Group

texts.en:
Ce groupe de 20 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 20 septembre  2010. Il regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même village et ceux des alentours.

Fatou assise à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère e 5 enfants. Elle va acheter des semences pour développer son activité principale d'agriculture. Et en outre elle va acheter  des mangues, du savon en poudre et achète de la farine, du sucre, du lait, des œufs, de l'huile et arômes pour faire des beignets pour l'activité secondaire qui constitue son petit commerce.
Avec les bénéfices, elle  compte acheter des chèvres, assurer les frais scolaires de ses enfants améliorer aussi l'alimentation de la famille.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fruit and powdered soap

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: J. Claude

texts.en: J. Claude is 46 years old. He is married, and has 5 children between 12 and 26 years old, all of whom go to school. He has a studio and has been working in a business for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cameras for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more cameras to make more photos for sale.

loans.name: Sunset Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the Head Teacher of Sunset Junior School Kulumba, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kawempe-Kulumba in Kampala with 420 students. Sunset Junior School Kulumba has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra Filtration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra Filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sunset Junior School Kulumba will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Vinane Group

texts.en:
Farida, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with three children who are still at school. She has been running a charcoal business since 2004. She works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Farida's first loan from Tujijnge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman. 

Farida will share this loan with her loan group, Vinane, which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
Mechill is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Mechill has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mechill has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 57, is a hard-working father of two who practices small-scale mixed-farming in Boochi Chache village, which is near Kisii town in the western part of Kenya. Boochi Chache is a primary banana and sugar cane growing area where John owns a 1-acre piece of land. Since 1999, John has derived his income from eggs, bananas, other food crops and personal business.
John also keeps a dairy cow that produces milk for subsistence consumption. Today, he is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. The milk from the additional cow will be sold to generate income. During the business appraisal process, the borrower stated, "Farming is enjoyable as it gives me income for the family. My biggest challenge is that I lack funds to grow it." 
John became a member of a group by the name Gitono in order to access loans from Juhudi Kilimo. He tried getting funds from other financial institutions, especially banks, but he wound up frustrated. He appreciates organizations like Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo because they give a chance to low-income earners.
John is going to put the income from this investment into his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Esther is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Esther has a dried fish and frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish and frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Esther has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 25-year-old man with one young child and one dependent. He deals in farming of bananas and also earns from maize production. He faces a challenge of limited capital but hopes to buy produce and to educate his children. He needs a loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 30, is married and has two children aged five and two years. The elder child goes to school.

For the past two years Beatrice has sold clothes. She is applying for a 458,337 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her child and buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida, is a 32-year-old married woman, who lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives rickshaw in Lahore city, which is very populated area. A few days ago, he was in a road accident.  He was looking for the passenger by standing beside the road, and a speedy car collided with the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fractures, but the rickshaw's body was seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy new rickshaw's body, but he is short some of the amount. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy the body for his auto rickshaw. Sajida is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Teclar

texts.en:
Teclar is a businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She runs a poultry project at her homestead; she produces turkeys. Teclar volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school in her spare time.

With the Kiva loan, Teclar would like to purchase a large amount of turkeys and turkey food. She will also build a larger fowl run. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase turkeys and turkey food

loans.name: Gnilane Diouf's Group

texts.en:
These two women are part of a local financial club, created on September 10th, 2010. It gathers members of their village and other neighboring villages.

Ndeye, on the right, is the group's chairperson. She is 42, married and the mother of 3 kids. With the loan, she will buy one cow and several sheep for her farming activity. She will also buy soap for the small business she runs alongside her farming activity. 

The profit will help Ndeye pay for household expenditures and will also be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and soap for her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Flora is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Flora has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Richard, a 36-year-old energetic, honest and humble man who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area that favors farming because of the good climatic conditions experienced in that region. Richard never got a chance to advance his education level and thus never got formal employment, but that did not discourage him in life or dampen his spirit to succeed. He started farming and has been doing farming for the past 15 years. Through the 15 years in farming he has been able to take care of his needs, and always provide for his family’s needs through giving them a modest home that is built of wood, and food to eat. 

Richard is a very hardworking man, and through his hard work he has been able to multitask. That is why he does poultry farming, tea farming, crop farming and a personal business to make ends meet. Richard is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase farm implements and also to buy additional poultry. Because of the increase in egg consumption in his area, Richard wants to capitalize on that and wants to increase his poultry. Through the increased poultry he will be able to reap more profits, and he will be able to meet the demand and be able to improve his living conditions and standards. Farm implements will assist to boost the production levels and to surpass the levels that he is currently producing. 

Richard is very sure that he will reap more profits and be able to impact society positively through employing people to work in his farm and also assuring his family of a more stable and secure future. Having gone through the repayment schedule Richard is very sure of repaying the loan on time, and asking for another one once he completes the repayment. Richard hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy farm implements and additional poultry.

loans.name: Neni

texts.en:
Neni is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one 12-year-old daughter. Her husband is a pedicab driver. 
 
She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation makes her and her family have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a house wife blessed with 8 children. She requires a loan so that she can purchase sewing material for her husband who is an embroiderer by profession. The survival of her family depends on the meager earnings of her husband. The loan would be used to buy new and improved sewing tools, resulting in more efficient craftmanship. Similarly, the consequential earnings would help Ruksana to educate her children and simultaneously broaden the business of her husband.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Monca And Friends Group

texts.en:
Anthony is a member of the Monca and Friends Group. He is 64 years old. He is married with 5 children who are living on their own. Anthony lives with his wife in the Egyirkrom in Asebu District in the Central Region of Ghana.

Anthony has been a farmer for the past 50 years. He started his farming to cater for himself while in school but dropped out on the way. He grows limes, oranges and coconuts on 10 acres of land. Anthony is now growing old and finds the maintenance of his farm difficult as it is physically demanding. He needs to hire labourers to weed and harvest the crops. In spite of the physical challenges of his business, Anthony is determined to maximize his output and expand his farm as much as possible.

He is now applying for a loan of GHS 2,000 to help cover the labour cost of weeding and harvesting. The loan will help Anthony to increase his income. He will be able earn his living from the income. He thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous financial support.

loans.use: to hire labourers to weed the farm and harvest the crops.

loans.name: Agness' Group

texts.en:
Agness' Group is comprised of two hardworking women. Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past six months, Agness has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Agness has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food to be sold in the restaurant, and will help Agness to generate greater profits and help out with paying her child's school fees. Agness hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Agness is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock for more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Muinah

texts.en:
Muinah is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband. She has two sons. Her husband is an itinerant fruit vendor. She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for her family. She will  build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

This sanitation makes her and her family have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Heda

texts.en:
Heda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell. 

Heda has been in this business for 22 years and earns more income from raising pigs.

Heda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear like blouses, shorts, and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is aged 37, living with her five children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a mobile shop for the last five years. He wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Naheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her son will be able to purchase relevant items for his business purposes earning more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more accessories for her son's mobile shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been involved in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old and married with two children.

Lucia earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

Lucia has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lucia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is an entrepreneur who used to sell kerosene to rural households. Now he has been given the chance to shift his business from fossil to renewable energies. He wants to open a solar shop that sells small and medium sized solar home systems that could easily replace the kerosene lamps. He wants to give out the units on credit so that his customers can finance them through their savings that they will have by using solar energy. Therefore he needs a loan of $5000 to help him get started.

loans.use: to build up his own solar system business

loans.name: Resurrection Group

texts.en:
Sithembile is a member of the Resurrection group.  She and her friend are a hardworking pair.

Sithembile is married, 37 years old, and blessed with four children, and one of them is doing a degree at the University of Zimbabwe. Sithembile produces and sells dishwashing and toilet cleaning detergents, hair shampoo, and also rears poultry with the help from her husband. She has been running this business for seven years now, and supplies her local market that is fast growing. Her major challenge is inadequate working capital as she is not able to restock in large quantities and hence, cannot benefit from the advantages of economies of scale. Her current profit levels barely meet her family’s needs. 

A Kiva loan will help Sithembile to improve her enterprise through purchasing her products in large quantities and extending her fowl run to accommodate up to 300 birds. It is Sithembile’s hope to grow the business and create employment in her community as well as being financially stable.

loans.use: to expand their poultry business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alma has been in this business for five years.

In the future Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which rears chicken. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry, and it will help Jackline to generate greater profits and increase her income. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 48 and married with 10 children between the ages of 3 and 23, of which three go to school. He has been selling wood furniture and construction material for the past 20 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more wood in order to make finished goods such as chairs, tables and construction material. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make chairs and tables for sale.

loans.name: Amuli

texts.en:
Amuli is 49 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Amuli has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce like rice. 

To help expand his business, Amuli has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Amuli to generate greater profits and add more stock. Amuli hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Amuli is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program.  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amuli who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more produce

loans.name: Harvest Group

texts.en:
Naume is a married mother of three children. She is in the Harvest Group.  Her husband is self-employed, working as a welder. Naume runs a tuck-shop in a newly built area called Dzivarasekwa Extension, a high density suburb in Harare.

She started her business 4 years ago, selling rice and sugar in small quantities. Most of her profits were reinvested in the business. As her working capital grew, her business developed from a small roadside stall to a small groceries shop that she now rents. She is strategically positioned to supply her neighborhood, with breakfast groceries mostly, as the local shopping centre is a few kilometers away. 

She is looking forward to stocking a variety of groceries so as to meet demand from the people in her area. Her business needs a capital injection of $300 to improve her stocking quantities and variety.

loans.use: to increase their stock of goods for resale.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo, is aged 43, married and has five children. He has managed an electronics repair shop for almost twenty years and earns a net income of PHP 15,000 monthly. His net income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds for his business he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase electronic television parts for his business. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase electronic television parts for his business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente, no tiene hijos dependientes, Julia vive con sus padres en el Caserío Yapana; Julia realiza las labores de destilación de aguardiente aprovechando las extensiones de caña que posee. Su Caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Callacyuc, provinica y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Julia está dedicada a la destilación de aguardiente, hace más de 15 años, ella requiere el presente crédito para realizar los pagos de peones en los deshierbos de caña, cuyo producto lo utiliza para la destilación de aguardiente; y también para realizar la implementación de sus equipos de destilación, par aumentar y mejorar su productividad, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá tener mayores ingresos porque podrá vender su producto a un mejor precio; mejorando sus ganancias y por consecuente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia, age 46, is in a relationship and has no dependent children.  Julia lives with her parents in the Yapana settlement.  Julia works distilling liquor, taking advantage of the sugarcane fields that she has.  Her settlement is located in the Callacyuc district in the Cajamarca province and region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Julia has been distilling liquor for over 15 years.  She needs the loan to pay the workers to weed the sugarcane.  She uses their product for the liquor distillation.  She will also use the loan for her distillation equipment.  She will do this to increase and improve her productivity.  In the short term this will allow her to have greater income because she will be able to sell her product at a better price.  She will be improving her earnings and, consequently, she will be improving her quality of  life.

loans.use: to implement distilling equipment and to pay workers.

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en: Potoae is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Potoae needs a loan to buy soft drinks, pies, foam cups, pies, donuts, a new boiler and some plastic chairs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Potoae has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, pies, foam cups, pies, donuts, a new boiler and some plastic chairs.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.en:
“My name is Rubén I have 36 years old and I work as an electrician and an occasional mason. My wife is Agustina, she is 37 years old and we have been married for 14 years. She is a homeowner and supports the familiar income through the sale of fresh fruit and snacks. We are parents of 4 kids: Daniel (13), Carlos (9) and the twin sisters Abigail (8) and Sarai (8). We are a happy family and we live in Oaxaca, Mexico.

Daniel goes to middle school and he enjoys doing different activities related to my work because one day he wants to be like me: an electrician and a mason.  His brother Carlos goes to the elementary school and in his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends. My two little princesses go to the same school as Carlos and when Abigail and Sarai arrive at home they play with their dolls.
We are a very united family and we enjoy spend time together. We have time for work as wells as we have time to spend with the family.

One of my biggest dreams is to give my family a real house, a house made with good material. I do not want the same problems:  leaky roof, extreme heat and extreme cold.  I would like to offer a good environment and proper rooms for my wife and my children.

Other dream is to help Agustina to open a local cafeteria because we need extra income. Our children are growing and their needs are bigger because we encourage them to keep studying. For me and their mother this is the best way to assure a better future. If our children study, they won’t experience all what my wife and I experienced when we were younger and no studies. Life can be very hard and we do not want a hard life for our children”.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 56 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells Elei (a method of printing fabric) materials to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. 

Sina joined South Pacific Business Development in 2011 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, carved wooden designs and rubber designs. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, carved wooden designs and rubber designs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 58 años de edad, se dedica al comercio y a la ganadería desde hace 20 años, vive con su esposo y junto a él han trabajado y le han dado buena educación a sus hijos.
Doña Martha tiene casa propia y vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una Planta Solar y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida, espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda y le permita tener una mejorar calidad de vida y a su vez está muy contenta porque estaría contribuyendo a cuidar el medio ambiente.
Su sueño es tener su hogar iluminado.

Trojes, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Martha, age 58, has been working in commerce and with livestock for 20 years.  She lives with her husband.  They have worked together, and they have given their children a good education.

Martha has her own house, and she lives in the Trojes al Oriente community in Honduras.

She is requesting the loan to buy a solar panel.  This will improve their living conditions.  She expects that this investment will be a big help.  It will allow her to have a better quality of life.  At the same time, she is very happy because she will be contributing to taking care of the atmosphere.

Her dream is to have her house illuminated.

Trojes, Honduras – August, 2014.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 59 and is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a driver and has six children.  Four are married and two are still in the Elementary Level.  She manages her household and attends to her vegetable stand business.  Her earnings from her store help a lot in meeting their daily living expense needs and in sending her children to school. 

Zosima buys fresh vegetables like eggplant, bitter gourd, ginger and many others.  She is also a Jeepney Operator. In the  Philippines Jeepneys are a common  means of transportation. Very few people own a vehicle.  The common people usually ride a jeep from their homes to market, church, friend’s homes and to different destinations. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

Zosima is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to maintain her jeep and purchase more varieties of fruit and vegetable to sell. 

In the future, Zosima hopes to give buy another Jeepney to grow her business. She wants her two remaining children to get to College. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business and for maintenace of her jeepney.

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en:
Say is a 41-year-old father of two children living in a rural village of the Borseth district, Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for almost 23 years. The current business earns him about 25,000KHR per day. 
This is the first microloan for Say with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Say, who is the leader, will use his portion to build a latrine for his family. He hopes this will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to build a latrine for his family

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is now 60 years old and chose to be single. She lives in a rural community managing a small retail store. She aims to make her business profitable in order to sustain her necessities and save some for future emergencies. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more stocks of rice, grocery items, fruits and vegetables to sell. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rice, grocery items, fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: M. Irfan

texts.en:
M. Irfan is 32 and lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice. His land has no canal system for watering, but rice needs a lot of water to survive. So he has to arrange another source for his crop irrigation. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by a tube well system. For this purpose he has to bear some additional cost. Therefore M. Irfan has requested a loan from KIVA’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To set up an irrigation system for his rice field

loans.name: Thoern

texts.en:
Thoern, 58, is the mother of two dependent children. She is originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Rice farming, cassava growing and pig raising are the main sources of her family’s income. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 29 years. 

This is Thoern's third loan with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy a solar panel for use in her family home. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for use in her family home.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Allah Ditta

texts.en:
Allah Ditta is 27 and living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of one child. He is a farmer by profession and cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice. His land has proven beneficial for rice crop cultivation. That is the reason he has been cultivating rice there for the last eight years continuously. Now he is in need of using some agro chemicals for a better crop. For this purpose, he has to bear some additional expense but he does not have enough cash on hand to cope with this demand. Therefore, Allah Ditta has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy agro chemicals for his rice crop

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters. Her husband has been running a metal shop for many years and he is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different types of tools and accessories for his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above merchandise for his business. . Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of this merchandise and will help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of tools and accessories for her husband's metal shop business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 45-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for many years and is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shehnaz's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of commodities for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 40 years old and a responsible mother of two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own painting business for many years. Shazia's husband needs to purchase different types of painting merchandise such as paint brushes and white wash accessories for his business. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase this merchandises. To fulfill the needs of her husband, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will help him to fulfill his family's needs

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy painting brushes and other accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Mrs. Xuyen is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and husbandry. With more than 20 years experience and support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa, 49 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Husbandry is the main income source of her family. Additional, she is also a hired laborer and earn about 100,000 VND/day. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Fareeda is 35 years old and a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own painting business for many years. Fareeda's husband needs to purchase different types of painting merchandise such as paint brushes and white wash accessories for his business. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the needs of her husband, Fareeda has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will help him to fulfill his family's needs.  Fareeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy painting accessories for her husband's painting business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Mrs. Minh is 41 years old, married and has two children, two of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed &education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry and hired labour.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Anh  is a hardworking woman, 27 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and salary. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is 51 years old, married and has a baby. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family members, especially her kid. Her income is mainly from her small business. With more than 20 years experience and support from her husband, her income enables her to repay the loan monthly as requested.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su pareja e hijos en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro.  Con el fin de obtener ingresos hace dos años decidió  tener su propio negocio de  compra y venta de pescado, ofrece pescado tilapia roja y pescado liso. Las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante.  Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras el que invertirá en la compra de mas pescado para aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old. She has 2 children and lives with her partner and children in the city of Santa Rosa, in the department of Yoro. Two years ago, with the desire to make money, she decided to open her own business by buying and selling fish. She offers red tilapia, and other fish. Maria makes the sales as a street vendor.

She has requested a loan for 8,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy more fish to increase her sales and her profits, to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aabida

texts.en:
Aabida is the responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Aabida's husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi.

Therefore, Aabida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Aabida's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and thus provide better transportation to earn a profitable income. Aabida  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Aabida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses for her husband's taxi repairs

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 28 años de edad, su estado civil es madre soltera, reside en caserío Piedra Herrada, es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia junto a su familia y pequeña hija de 2 años de edad. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y sus moradores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Ana María es a la crianza y venta de carne de cerdo y aves de corral actividad que realiza hace más de 3 años cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, y clientela fija en la zona, además de las buenas referencias personales, crediticias y laborales.

El destino del crédito será para la compra de animales de engorde (patos, pavos, chanchos, entre otros) y posterior venta al menudeo. Ya que le generará mayores ganancias, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 28 years old and is a single mother. She lives in the village Piedra Herrada. She grew up in the area, and lives in her own home with her family and 2-year-old daughter. Life in the community is laid back, and the residents work in agriculture and cattle raising as well as trade. The village is located in the district of Buenos Aires, Morropon province, in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

Ana Maria earns a living by raising and pigs and barnyard birds and selling their meat. She has been doing this for more than 3 years and has business experience and regular customers in the area. Beyond this she has good personal, credit, and work references.

The loan will be used to buy animals to raise (ducks, turkeys, pigs and others) and then sell them. She will then generate more revenues and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise (ducks, turkeys, pigs and others).

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. Shamim is providing sewing services to earn the income to manage the household. 

Shamim needs a new sewing machine for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a new sewing machine. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase a sewing machine and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Baudilio Antonio

texts.es:
Baudilio es un hombre de 27 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo, él estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato y por motivos no esperados no siguio sus estudios, su esposa trabaja haciendo pasteles por las tardes, con {el viven sus abuelos paternos los cuales lo criaron desde muy pequeño.

La actividad que desempeña Baudilio es vendedor de una comercial, viaja en bus hacia la capital, para trabajar el horario de su trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materiales electricos como alambre de cobre, toma corrientes, conectores, focos, lamparas, caja termica, etc.  dichos materiales seran utilizados para que en su hogar no falte la energia electrica.

En el futuro quisiera terminar sus estudios y obtener una carrera profesional y darle lo mejor a su hijo con estudios universitarios y quiere seguir trabajando con la institucion, porque es una manera facil de salir adelante y por eso {el esta muy agradecido.
texts.en: Baudilio is 27 years old. He is married and has a son. He studied up through the first year of college and for unexpected reasons did not continue his studies. His wife works making cakes in the afternoons. His paternal grandparents, who raised him since he was very young, live with him. Baudilio is a commercial vendor. He travels by bus to the capital to work at his job from 8 am to 4 pm. The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for purchasing electrical supplies such as copper wire, outlets, connectors, bulbs, lamps, a thermal box, etc. These materials will be used so that his home does not lack electricity. In the future he would like to finish his studies and obtain a professional career. He wants to give his son the best with his university education. He wants to continue working for the institution because it's an easy way to get ahead, and for this he is very grateful.

loans.use: buy electrical materials such as copper wire, outlets, connectors, bulbs, lamps, a thermal box, etc. so his home does not lack electricity.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto Antonio  tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa, es padre de un hijo y su actividad es la caficultura y la agricultura, cuenta con más de 2 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica.
Don Rigoberto Antonio está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono ya que no cuenta con los recursos para comprar los mismos, lo que le permitirá abonar  sus cultivos y asi tener mejor producción y mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos.
Don Rigoberto Antonio está muy agradecido con el apoyo que  le ha brindado la institución ya que será la segunda vez que optaría a un préstamo con Prisma.   

Trojes, Honduras -  Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Señor Rigoberto Antonio is 31 years old. He lives with his wife. He is the father of a son, and his business is growing coffee and agriculture. He has worked in this type of economic activity for more than two years.

Don Rigoberto Antonio is applying for a loan to buy compost, since he doesn't have the resources to buy it. This will allow him to fertilize his crops and thus have better production and improve his income and cover the family expenses and obligations.

Don Rigoberto Antonio is very grateful for the help that the institution has offered him, since this will be the second time that he has opted for a loan with Prisma.

Trojes, Honduras -  September 2014

loans.use: to buy compost for his crops

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат успешно погасила кредит по линии Кива, она благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Кредит был использован по назначению, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Карамат есть 2 дойные коровы и 2 теленка, 3 козы и 1 овца, также на собственном земельном наделе Карамат выращивает картофель, морковь, помидоры, также есть большой сад. Каждую неделю Карамат торгует на местном рынке сельхоз продукцией и молочной продукцией. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Карамат увеличился до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Карамат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров, а также на закупку сена и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Карамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en:
Karamat repaid her previous Kiva loan without any problem, and she is very grateful to all the people who financially supported her.  She used her previous loan as she had intended, and she now owns two dairy cows, two calves, three goats and one sheep.  She also grows potatoes, carrots, and tomatoes on her allotted piece of land, and she has a nice garden. 

Every week, Karamat goes to the market to sell her produce and dairy products.  Her monthly income has increased to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the "Bai Tushum" bank and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy two additional cows, as well as some feed and hay for her livestock.  Karamat is planning to reinvest her earnings from this loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy two cows, as well as some feed and hay for her livestock.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Brillante Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ BRILLANTE
Doña Maria Luisa es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 29 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus 6 hijos menores de edad ella se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel y a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero, gracias al apoyo de el y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que entre todos  se ayudan para salir adelante.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de tejidos a sus clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante para los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Duo Luz Brilliante (Shining Light Duo)

Doña Maria Luisa is originally from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 29 years old. In her care are her six minor children. She buys and sells bay leaves and makes traditional weavings by hand. 

Her husband works as a day laborer. Thanks to his support and that of their children, she continues forward with her business, since they all help each other to get ahead.

She dreams of expanding her business more, to offer other styles of weavings to her customers in order to obtain better earnings and thus send her children to a better school for a better future, since education is now very important for young people.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making and selling traditional weavings.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат успешно погасила предыдущий кредит по линии Кива, она очень благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Кредит был использован по назначению. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гульзат есть 3 коровы и 3 теленка. Также Гульзат работает в школе учителем младших классов. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, она хочет купить машину для своей семьи, а также помочь сыну в строительстве дома.
texts.en: Gulzat repaid her previous Kiva loan without any problem, and she is very grateful to all the lenders who supported her financially.  She used her previous loan as intended and she now owns three cows and three calves.  Gulzat also works as a teacher in an elementary school.  Every month, she brings home a total income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to the "Bai Tushum" bank and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a few head of sheep for fattening and resale.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her farming business.  She would also like to buy a car for her family and to help her son to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase of few head of sheep far fattening  and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
Victor Raul, vive con madre y y padrasto. Vive en casa familiar. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales, laborales y familiares pues se dice que su familia es muy unida. Además vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Victor Raul se dedica al transporte de mototaxi en el distrito de Cayaltí. Desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para el mantenimiento y arreglo de mototaxi, esto le permitirá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo asi como también le va permitir dar una buena imagen al prestar servicio a sus clientes, por lo tanto le permitirá generar mayor ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor Raul lives with his mother and stepfather. He lives in the family home. He has good personal, work, and family references, since it is said that his family is very united. Furthermore, he lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture, and livestock raising, located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Victor Raul has worked in mototaxi transportation in the district of Cayaltí for more than three years, approximately. The purpose of the loan is for the maintenance and repair of his mototaxi. This will allow him to insure the correct functioning of his means of work, as well as allowing him to present a good image when he serves his customers. Thus it will allow him to generate better income and better earnings, and in the end improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзод родился в 1993 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он целеустремленный и позитивный молодой человек. Шерзод в средней школе учился отлично и всегда мечтал поступить в университет. В этом году его мечта сбылась, и он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет, до этого он окончил техникум своего района. Шерзод является активным студентом 1 курса. Он имеет хорошую репутацию среди своих однокурсников. Его отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Его мать работает бухгалтером в государственном учреждении. Шерзод запрашивает займ  для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sherzod was born in 1993. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a focused and positive young man.  When he was in secondary school, he was an excellent student who always dreamed of entering the university.  This year his dream has come true, and he enrolled at the Tajik State University after graduating from the local technical school.  Sherzod is an active first-year student, and he is well liked by his peers.  His father is a migrant worker and he is currently in Russia.  His mother works as an accountant in a public institution.  Sherzod is taking a loan to pay for his university tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Mutiara Group

texts.en:
The Mutiara group paid off their loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeeded in maintaining their pigs. Ni Nengah, as the head, was responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintained two fattening pigs and sold out. After deducting the cost of feed and the price of piglets, she earned a satisfactory profit. She’s very happy for that and she hopes that with the next loan, she will get more profit to improve her business.

The Mutiara group is located in the middle part of Bali and most of them are doing farming. All the husbands of the members work as farmers and, as Balinese women, they supplement their husbands' income by raising pigs at home. After successfully paying off the first loan, they proceeded to the next period with the purpose of improving their businesses. 

Ni Nyoman is one of Mutiara’s members. Beside being a pig breeder, she has a small kiosk business that sells various kinds of fast food. Her husband already passed away and now she lives alone. All she does now is support her children who live in Denpasar for college. With the loan, she bought three local piglets for pig barbeque that are sold every two months and she bought some merchandise for her kiosk. From the results of this effort, she plans to build a better place for her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy three local piglets and merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en: Solinuu is a 37-year-old unmarried woman with five children. She makes and sells meat and chicken pies in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Solinuu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, yeast, large pots, salt, pepper and boneless chicken. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Solinuu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, large pots, salt, pepper and boneless chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flower seeds, a pitchfork, a tiller, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a crowbar and gloves

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират всегда стремиться к новшеству. Она мать 5 детей. Махфират замужем и ее муж является трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Махфират имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе своего района учителем уже более 23 года. Махфират является повторным клиентом ИМОН. Она 3 цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Ее сын поступил на первый курс в университет. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahfirat has always strived for innovation. She is the mother of five children and married; her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Mahfirat has a higher education in pedagogy and has been working as a high school teacher in her region for more than 23 years. She is a repeat client of IMON and has had three cycles of loans. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to pay tuition for her son, who has enrolled in first-year university. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Dúo Margarita De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Margarita de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Vilma Hermelinda quien se dedica  a la confección de pantalones de tela y camisas desde hace dos años.
