Al lado de su  padre quien  le ha enseñado el trabajo de confección y al lado de su esposo quien la apoya incondicionalmente está  muy  contenta  por este negocio que han emprendido. Tiene varios pedidos de pantalones y camisas y las maquinas  que tiene no les es suficiente por tal motivo ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar otra máquina para el negocio y así cada día  crecer y no quedarles mal a sus clientes ya que su sueño es ser una gran confeccionista en el pueblo.
texts.en:
Dúo Margarita de San Pedro (The Margarita Duo of San Pedro)

Señora Vilma Hermelinda is the one in charge of this group. She has been making pants and shirts from fabric for two years. At the side of her father, who taught her the trade of making clothing, and at the side of her husband, who supports her unconditionally, she is very happy about this business that they have launched. She has a number of orders for pants and shirts, and the machines that she has are not sufficient for them. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to be able to buy another machine for her business and thus grow every day and not let her customers down, since her dream is to be a great seamstress in the town.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make clothing.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират родилась в 1977 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Махфират занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает лук и морковь. Махфират выращивает морковь на 1 га земли и лук на 1.75 га земли. Она работает в этой сфере более чем 4 лет. Ее муж Хайрулло помогает ей введению бизнеса. Он продает полученный урожай на местном рынке. Махфират планирует сделать осенний посев и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки семена, минерального удобрения и оплата за услуги трактора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mahfirat was born in 1977. She is married and raising one child. She works in agriculture, growing mainly onions (on 1.75 hectares of land) and carrots (on one hectare), a business she has had for more than four years. Her husband Hairullo helps her with the business by selling the harvest at the local market. Mahfirat plans to do a fall planting and therefore is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor services. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay for tractor service

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулнары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством, около 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гулнары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1,25 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Также у Гулнары в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход от реализации сельскохозяйственной экологически чистой продукции оптовым покупателям составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Гулнара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Гулнара намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит построить большой дом.
texts.en: Gulnara is 38 and married with four children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started about 20 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, purposefulness and persistence, she now has 1.25 hectares of land where she grows watermelon and cotton, as well as three cows and 30 sheep. Her monthly income from sales of organic produce to wholesale buyers is about 25,000 somoni. Gulnara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 somoni to buy three cows. She intends to expand her business in order to improve her family's financial situation and allow them to build a big house.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to be more profitable and build a house for her family

loans.name: Sodikin

texts.en:
Commerce Management and Harbor Administration is the study program chosen by Sodikin. Currently he is registered as a student at the Maritime Academy Nusantara. As his goal, he is eager to work in a shipping company or in a port in Indonesia. 

Sodikin's parents are very supportive and eager to help Sodikin complete his education. Sodikin's father works as a farm laborer, and his income is uncertain because of erratic weather. If the weather is bad, the harvest could fail. There is only enough money is to meet daily needs. Two of his brothers also require fees for their school; there is the need to look for other work.

Sodikin is hoping to take a Student Loan from Kiva, In order to ease the burden on his parents. Sodikin is grateful to lenders throughout the world, although they are not personally known to him.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra Guadalupe de 63 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante cuarenta años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. 

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It is a very hot day and the main market of Sololá is full of people who come and go, some buying and others selling.  Hope dances between two groups.  Among these groups can be found Guadalupe, who is 63 years old.  She makes an enormous effort to sustain her family.  She has four children who are all students in the local school.  She is an entrepreneurial woman with great dreams in life.

She works buying and selling vegetables.  She chose this business because it generates income for her family.  She has been working in this field for 40 years and she learned it from her mother.  She likes to participate in this business because through it she can improve the living conditions of her family and also her community. 

She will use her loan to buy vegetables and fertilizers in order to improve her crops and to obtain good harvests and better sales in the market in her community.  Her aspiration is to grow her business and build houses for her children so that they can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Verra

texts.en: Verra is 24 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Verra needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, crops, gloves and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Verra will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, crops, gloves and a tiller

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a mother of one son and one daughter who are at school. She was born in the early 1970s and is married. For 10 years now, she has had several food businesses including a mamalishe serving breakfast, lunch, juices and a snack called kachori. Mwanaisha sells also cereal (beans), which she buys upcountry. She operates her business from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her 11th loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Betania Group's two members. They will hold each other responsible for paying back the loan. Mwanaisha paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She used the loans to improve mostly her mamalishe cooking store. She also bought sacks of cereal (beans), which she sold out. She received a profit, which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. Mwanaisha dreams of improving her mamalishe business to a nice restaurant.

She will use her portion of the loan to buy food cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Efendi

texts.en:
Efendi cames from a small village in the eastern region of the island of Java; precisely, a village on the outskirts of the city Ngrimbi Jombang. Efendi is the only child in his family. His parents have great expectations for Efendi and for his future. 

Due to the living conditions of his parents, Efendi moved out, alone, and left his parents to study Management of Commerce and Harbour Administration at the Akademi Maritim Nusantara, in the city of Cilacap. His parents hope that Efendi can learn diligently and quickly and complete college. All efforts were made by Efendi's parents in order to help him, although his parents only work as laborers in the fields of others. Their income is uncertain, because of weather conditions that are less than friendly to farm workers. Efendi is very upset with the living conditions of his parents. He is determined to quickly complete his studies. 

He hopes, with a loan from Kiva investors, he can help overcome these difficulties. Efendi hopes to quickly get a job in a shipping company.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su  hogar y es padre de dos hijos su actividad es la caficultura y agricultura y también se dedica al transporte ya que cuenta con sus vehículos en el cual hace fletes.
Don Esteban vive en una  aldea de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras se dedica al cultivo de malanga, cuenta con más de 30 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica.
Don Esteban nos está solicitando el crédito para la compra de abono ya que no cuenta con los recursos para comprar los mismos, lo que le permitirá abonar  sus cultivos y asi tener mejor producción y mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros contraídos.
Don Esteban está muy agradecido con el apoyo que  le ha brindado la institución ya que será la segunda vez que optaría aun crédito.


 Trojes, Honduras - Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Esteban is 66 years old. He lives with his wife in their home and he is the father of two children. He grows coffee and other things for a living and he also works in transport since he has vehicles that he uses to transport cargo.

Esteban lives in a small village in the municipality of Trojes, in the eastern part of Honduras. He grows eddoes. He has been doing this type of work for more than 30 years.

Esteban is requesting a loan from us in order to buy compost, since he does not have the resources to buy some. This will allow him to fertilize his crops and thereby have better production and improve his earnings in order to cover his household expenses and financial commitments.

Esteban is very grateful for the support that the institution has offered to him since this will be the second time he has applied for a loan.


 Trojes, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy compost for his business

loans.name: Valy

texts.ru: Вали родился 1992 году. В 1999 году поступил в школу и в 2010 году успешно окончил. Он поступил 4 года назад в Таджикский Государственный Университет факультет менеджмента. Данное время перешел на 4 курс. Он очень способный молодой человек. Вали увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Valy was born in 1992.  He started going to school in 1999 and successfully graduated in 2010.  Four years ago, he enrolled at the Tajik State University (School of Management).  He is now a fourth-year student and a very capable young man.  Valy loves sports and he reads foreign literature during his spare time.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  He is taking a loan to pay for his university tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es: La señora Ana vive en Cochabamba provincia chapare, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, económicamente es independiente,  se dedica a la actividad de comercio, venta de ropa y productos cosméticos, compra por mayor de la ciudad de La Paz o de las mayoristas que traen de esa ciudad, los productos cosméticos los recibe de diferentes empresas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado en una feria de la ciudad de Cochabamba y Colomi, actualmente la señora requiere un crédito para la compra de mercadería ya que le falto dinero porque lo que tenía ahorrado lo invirtió en sus estudios. De esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en: Ana lives in Cochabamba, in the province of Chapare. She is 25 years old and single. She is financially independent. She makes a living from selling clothes and cosmetic products. She buys the clothes wholesale from the city of La Paz or from the wholesalers who bring their products from that city. She receives the cosmetic products from different companies. She has a market for selling her products at a fair in the cities of Cochabamba and Colomi. Ana currently needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise; she does not have the money to buy it because she invested what she had saved in her studies. In his way, she will be able to improve her standard of living for her family’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dúo Los Gemelos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS GEMELOS
Ana Lucrecia  de 20 años tiene  una hija, empezó su negocio  con Q.300.00 invirtiendo en costuras y gracias a Dios a hido creciendo en su negocio de costuras agradece  a su esposo y a su suegra por el apoyo , su mayor anhelo es poner un local grande  para tener mas mercadería y así poder tener mejores ganancia en un futuro, agradece y le pide mucho a dios para que todo le salga cada día  mejor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para costurar.
texts.en:
DUO The Twins:   Ana Lucrecia, 20 years old, has a daughter.  Ana began her business with 300 Quetzales (less than $40) investing in sewing materials, and thanks be to God, her business has been growing. She is grateful to her husband and her mother- in- law for their help. 

Ana's big dream is to have a large shop in order to have more merchandise and thus be able to have more earnings in the future.  She is grateful and asks God's help so that everything will get better each day.  She is asking for this loan to buy fabric in order to sew.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to sew items to sell

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша умелая и способная женщина, проживающая в столице, в городе Душанбе. Ей 32 года. Она замужем, ее муж трудовой мигрант. У Бунафши двое сыновей  и им по 8 и 6 лет. Бунафша у себя дома занимается швейным делом, чтобы помогать мужу обеспечивать семью. Эту деятельность она начала полтора года назад. Бунафша берет заказ на шитье женских платьев национальных фасонов и выполняет каждый свой заказ на должном уровне. Сейчас причиной запроса кредита является покупка новой швейной машинки. Дело в том, что Бунафша хочет обновить свою машинку, так как она уже ломается часто и это причиняет ей много неудобств. Благодаря кредиту Бунафша сможет и дальше успешно продвигать свое дело.
texts.en: Bunafsha is a skillful and capable woman who lives in Dushanbe, the capital city of Tajikistan.  She is 32 years old and married to a migrant worker.  She has two sons, ages 8 and 6.  In order to help her husband provide for the family, she works as a seamstress, from home.  She started this activity a year-and-a-half ago.  Bunafsha works on orders and sews traditional Tajik dresses for women.  She does a good job on each order she receives.  The reason why she is taking a loan is that she needs to buy a new sewing machine.  She is hoping to get a new machine, as her current machine often breaks down, which is always an inconvenience.  Thanks to this loan, Bunafsha will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and develop her business.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son started his own business of selling welding material, three years ago. He works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Ameer is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, welding rods, etc., so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Ameer hopes that the loan will be helpful for her son's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her son's welding shop.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат целеустремленная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Саёхат живет с мамой. Она раньше занималась скотоводством. Теперь она занимается шитьем и продажей мужских халатов «чапан». Она этим занимается уже более 5 лет. Саёхат постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом привлечь больше покупателей. Саёхат запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки тканей, чтобы шить «чапан» и продавать на местном рынке. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sayohat is an ambitious, 26-year-old woman.  She is divorced, with no children, and she currently lives with her mom.  She used to be involved in animal husbandry.  Nowadays, she sews and sells traditional men's coats called "chapan".  She has been involved in this activity for more than five years and is gradually developing her business.  She wants to increase her working capital, which will allow her to attract more customers.  She is taking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy fabrics to sew some "chapan" and sell them at the local market.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy some fabrics to sew traditional men's coats called ‘chapan’.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Doña Judith tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son profesionales y conviven con su propia familia. Ella logro brindarles un correcto estilo de vida tanto económica, educativa, de salud y social, esto gracias a su actividad como comerciante en gran parte ya que el padre de sus dos primeros hijos no fue responsable con ellos, el segundo esposo que tuvo es el padre de los otros dos hijos, aunque si es un padre responsable ella siempre está acostumbrada a colaborar económicamente en el hogar. Aparte de vender la ropa, perfumes, reloj y productos de catálogo doña Judith es asesora de viajes en una agencia, es por eso que cuando tiene un espacio en los viajes ella aprovecha para traer su mercadería desde México, Panamá y New York. Se comprueba que la mercadería que en realidad distribuye es de marca original y calidad. Por tal motivo su clientela es fiel hasta el día de hoy.

Ella inicia con el comercio desde que tiene 16 años de edad cuando debía vender unas blusas para poder pagar los gastos del colegio y colaborar en el hogar de su madre con los gastos básicos. Actualmente cuenta con amplia cartera de clientes, por tal razón necesita este crédito ya que en Octubre espera estar viajando para traer la mercadería que le están solicitando.

Demuestra ser una mujer luchadora, con gran conocimiento en el comercio ya que hasta el momento se mantiene y logara ampliar sus ventas en todo el país. Su clientela es muy puntual en los pagos, ya que en su mayoría son muy responsables y abonan cada quincena. Gracias al comercio ella por sus propios medios desde el año 2002 tiene carro propio, en el 2010 lo cambio por uno más moderno y actualmente es su gran herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Judith is 52 years old, mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are now professionals and live with their own family. Her achievements provide a correct model of both economic, educational, health and social life.  This is thanks to her activity as a wholesaler in part because the father of her first two children was not responsible with them. The second husband is the father of the two other children. Even if he is a responsible parent, she is always used to helping financially at home. Apart from selling clothes, perfumes, watches and catalog products, Judith works at a travel agency. And this is why she has a way to bring your goods from Mexico, Panama and New York. She is able to distributes merchandise of original brand and quality. As such, her clientele is faithful to this day.

She started in business when she was 16 years old when she had to sell some blouses to pay college expenses and work at home with her mother to cover living expenses. Currently, she has an extensive customer base.  For that reason, she needs this loan because she expects to be traveling in October to bring the merchandise that is requested.

She has proved to be a fighter, with great knowledge in trading and so far remains successful and expand sales. Her clientele is very punctual with payments, mostly because they are very responsible and pay every fortnight. Thanks to the business, she has been on her own since 2002, has her own car, and in 2010 she exchanged it for a more modern one and it is currently a great tool for her work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en:
Suega is a 29-year-old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Suega needs a loan to buy Chinese candy, sugar, a cooler, a small chest freezer, foam cups and a large spoon. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Suega has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy Chinese candy, sugar, a cooler, a small chest freezer, foam cups and a large spoon

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut was the head of the Sari Pertami group, which was responsible for the loan of 21,600,000 IDR they succeeded in paying on time. As a mother of three children, she has to work hard every day to support the family's needs. Her sow give birth to 10 piglets, and she sold all of them. All the profit went to pay her children's fee in university.

Now Ni Ketut and the Sari Pertami group continue to have a loan from MUK, still with 13 members and 21.600.000 IDR loan size. Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages. She’s prepared for the piglets. She has plans to sell all of her piglets to other breeders. Ni Ketut has a dream to watch her children succeed in education and in life. It’s all that will make her very happy.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages

loans.name: Balemaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Balemaya sont  mariés équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, Tubercules, habits et quinquélibas. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Oumou (assise devant sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bananes plantains. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de bananes plantains. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. 
Madame Oumou   compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé et les frais de scolarisation des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Balemaya is composed of four women, who are equally distributed among monogamous and polygamous marriages. The women average 40 years of age and six children each, all living in Bamako-Coura, a district in Bamako. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell tubers, clothing, and kinkeliba [Combretum micranthum].

Concerned about building their inventory, the group members decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Oumou (sitting in front in the photo) is a major vendor of plantains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of of plantains. She gets her supplies in Médine and makes her sales, cash or credit, to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Oumou plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure the children’s healthcare and schooling costs. Her goal is to increase her business volume through this Soro Yiriwaso partnership.

loans.use: to purchase plantains

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet Metrine. Metrine is a lovely Luhya lady from Bungoma, Kenya. She is hardworking and determined to make it in life. Her refusal to take the traditional subservient role of a wife has seen her start various farm enterprises that have made her less dependent on her husband when it comes to household expenses. She started with a cereal business that provided her with enough income for her family's upkeep and still managed to save to get into the business where her heart was really in: dairy farming.
 
Metrine is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. From the cereal business, she was able to save enough money and purchased a dairy cow. The cow produces milk for her family's consumption and income. However, she still has a few steps to upgrade her dairy farm and make the cow more productive. 

With your money, she will put up a cowshed that will significantly enhance dairy management. The cowshed will open way for the zero-grazing model. The model will increase milk production, which in turn will increase her income. 

The money she will make from the investment will be plowed back to fuel growth of her business.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive location, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a big boutique shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín  tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, el primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y a sus tres últimos hijos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad, los hijos de Martín se ha convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarles un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 10 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de panadero en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como block y hierro para la construcción de su vivienda y  es para  la realización de su más grande sueño en la construcción de una vivienda para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Martín es poder vender sus productos en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el y sus hijos realizan, he dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.
texts.en:
Martin is 36 years old, married and has four children.  The first child has his own family and the last three children are excellent students in the school in the community.  Martin's children have become the reason for the struggle of working every day to provide a better future and a better life.

For 10 years, he has been working with a lot of effort and dedication as a baker in his home located in the community.  He also had a second job as a farmer in his community.

The purposes for which he wishes to make a loan is to purchase construction materials such as block and iron for the construction of his home and to carry out his biggest dream to build a house to have conditions for comfortable lives.

One of the greatest aspirations of Martin is to be able to sell his products in his community to make people aware of the work the children are doing and to give his children the education to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Djiguissigui Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Djiguissigui est constitué de cinq  femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila en commune  du Mandé cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente d’habits, de la pâte d’arachide et de céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Diaka (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 20m de bazins. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Kanadjiguila  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Diaka compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The group Djiguissigui is composed of five women, all married and living in monogamous households. The women average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. They know one another through their tontines in the neighborhood and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce, such as selling clothing, peanut butter, and grains. 

Concerned about increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Diaka (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 meters of damask fabrics. She gets her supplies in Bamako. Her sales are made in cash to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Diaka plans on making an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet the sundry needs of her children. The rest will be invested in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Nieta sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-Coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, pommes de terre, bananes plantains, yams et habits. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Aminata (première assise de la droite vers la gauche) a une bonne réputation dans la vente de tubercules (pommes de terre, ignames et patates douces). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent en pommes de terre à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Aminata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Nieta is composed of four women, who are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 48 years of age and five children each, all living in Bamako-Coura, a district in Bamako. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell potatoes, plantains, yams, and clothing. 

Concerned about building their inventory, the group members decided to turn toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (sitting first from the right in the photo) has a good reputation selling tubers (potatoes, yams, and sweet potatoes). She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of of potatoes. She gets her supplies in Médine. By going door to door and sometimes by special order, her sales are made, cash or credit, to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure the children’s healthcare and schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Flamboyant Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Flamboyant ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques de toutes sortes, d’habits, de la restauration et de l’arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la  droite  vers la gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse d’ustensiles plastiques de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 80 pièces d’ustensiles plastiques de toutes sortes en gros au grand à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à et en ambulant à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Korotoumou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous households, the five members of the group Flamboyant average 37 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce involving plastic utensils of all sorts, clothing, and peanuts; and they work in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Korotoumou (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a vendor of all sorts of plasticware. She intends to use her loan to purchase 80 pieces of plastic utensils wholesale at the big market in Bamako. By hawking, her sales are made retail and in cash to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Korotoumou plans on making an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to invest in her business and to meet the sundry needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils of all sorts

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells stationery and sweaters. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. Monica will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of stationery. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery.

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en: The woman raising her hand in the photo is Rael,a member of Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is sixty-five years old, married, and blessed with eight children. Rael does dairy and vegetable farming. After receiving Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and financial management, she gained skills on how to manage her business effectively. This enabled her to identify another business opportunity and she opened a cafe in the local shopping center to supplement her income. She is borrowing a loan to expand her cafe by buying more items such as sufurias, kettles,and cutlery. She hopes this will lead to better, consistent service. Rael looks forward to more income and ensuring food security in her household. She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy items such as sufurias, kettles, and cutlery for her cafe.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be self-driven. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for selling and she also grows tea for selling. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a favorable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital and price fluctuations. Caroline will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to be more productive within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gnongonlame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gnongonlamè est uniquement  composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila  commune du Mandé  dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits,. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kiatou  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de qualités supérieures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Kiatou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Gnongonlamè is composed just of monogamous women, who average 31 years of age and three children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Kiatou (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling clothing of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of the best quality. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 pieces of Wax ‘pagne’ clothing wholesale in Bamako. By hawking, her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Kiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to invest in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Kobake Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kobakè  est uniquement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, ignames, arachides et ustensiles plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Farima (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La  revente  s’effectue en détails à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Farima espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The group Kobakè is composed just of monogamous women, who average 33 years of age and three children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing, yams, peanuts, and plasticware.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Farima (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling clothing of clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 pieces of Wax ‘pagne’ clothing wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Ms. Farima hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to invest in her business. Her goal is to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to have much more money.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a typewriting business where she does typewriting. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another typewriting machine. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another typewriting machine

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Irene, a member of the Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is twenty-three years old, married, and blessed with one child. Irene is a dairy and poultry farmer.

After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013, she received training on enterprise development and decided to start a clothe selling business. She is borrowing a loan to open a mini boutique since she has realized that there is demand for clothes. She hopes her income will increase to ensure food security in her household. Irene appreciates Kiva for the support and she has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 17 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be time conscious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. Mary will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be goal oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be self driven. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell and also does tea farming. Her business is located in a favorable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have at least 10 dairy cows. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells wood carvings. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity and insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of wood carvings. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wood carvings

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Salma is a member of Hefseba Group, which comprises six people. She has been in this group for one loan cycle. After having paid back her previous credit well, she turned back for her second request to grow her poultry business, as she recommends that she needs to run two batches. As one gets out, the second is close to being ready to sell.

Salma is in her early forties, married and has got five children, all of whom are schooling. She has been supporting her family by running a poultry business, 300 chicks per batch. She runs two batches differed in two weeks. Salma starts working at 5:00 am until 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly return. She believes that if she raises more chicks, her monthly income will improve.

With her second loan requested via Tujijenge Tanzania, Salma will buy 300 chicks for her poultry business. She used her previous cycle to buy chicken feed which seems to inflate (rise in price) frequently. Buying more stock reduced the price rising effect and it was easier to manage her chicks. She earned a profit which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. Salma dreams that one day she will build a house for her family and manage an incubator machine special for chick production.

She will share this loan with her loan group and will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a female Kiva borrower who describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Salud

texts.en:
This is Maria Salud, 40, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to George, a real estate agent, and has two children who are still in elementary level.  She manages her household and has a Mobile Phone business to augment their income.

Maria Salud operates an Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. She buys electronic cellular phone loads in huge amounts then retails them for whatever amount the customer is buying. Profit is generated depending on the network's dealership policy. She may buy 3,000 PHP worth of load for 2,500 PHP, where she will earn a 500 PHP profit.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy electronic loads from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Maria Salud dreams of sending her children to the best school possible to ensure a better future for them. She only wishes for them to live a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for Mobile Loads for her Electronic Loading Station.

loans.name: Siak San

texts.en:
Meet San. San and his four family members live in Sukabumi, a city that is located about 106 km from Jakarta. San is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, phones accessories, and mobile phone airtime to his customers. 

San was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. San believes that using technology will make his business run more easily. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide more mobile services to his community on the weekends by selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business in the future. San is pictured in the photo standing in his small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is grateful that she was granted a PHP 25,000 loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 13,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles.  She knows that more items in her store will generate more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a reliable source which allows her to sustain her family's basic needs and pay for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Ceferina dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 2 children who describes herself as self-driven. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years, and she hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Meet Yulia. Yulia and her family live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. Yulia is married; she helps her husband run a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited her stall, and she quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. 

Yulia believes that using technology will make the business run more easily. As the business continues to grow, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to provide more mobile services to her community on the weekends by selling mobile phone airtime credits. As extra money will be generated, Yulia plans to seek for more business opportunity - she might want to try providing more service for her community such as bill payment service. 
As she learns from Ruma staff, she hopes that she will be able to improve her business. Yulia is pictured in the photo, standing in front of her small shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with 2 children, who describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large-scale. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic and fertile location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand her farm within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP for her to buy more ready-to-wear products to increase her product inventory. She would also buy personal and home products which she also sells in retail. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosemarie hopes for her business to continue to operate and to have an increase of sales. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear (RTW) products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars, and to pay labourers to build a bathroom and sink in his home.

loans.name: Dúo Cariño Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cariño La señora Elvia Sofia de 47 años de edad es casada,  desde hace 10 años fabrica sueteres, frazadas, gorras y guantes de lana para bebe esta ubicada en San Juan Comalapa, y que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora Elvia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
"Dúo Cariño" group

Elvia Sofía is 47 years old and married. For ten years she has made a living making woolen sweatshirts, blankets and gloves for babies in San Juan Comalapa. With her efforts, Elvia has managed to build and improve her home and, through her business, she has supported her family and helped them to get ahead.

Elvia's dream is to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life through a microloan from FAPE. She wants to use this loan in order to buy threads in order to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothes for babies.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cintya es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada, pero está en proceso de divorcio con su esposo, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son dependientes de sus ingresos, con un grado de instrucción de nivel primario, es muy responsable a nivel laboral, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en distintos rubros pero el que le genera mayores ingresos es el servicio de gastronomía, en ello tiene una experiencia de 13 años, vende en una casa en anticrético frente a un colegio de la zona, por esa razón tiene mucha clientela, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar un carrito donde prepara la comida ya que el que tiene se encuentra deteriorado por el uso diario, de esta forma podrá mejorar la calidad de atención al cliente y la de su familia.
texts.en: Cintya is 41 years old. She is currently married but going through a divorce. She has four children, three of whom depend on her income. Cintya has a primary school education and is very responsible in her work. Since a young age she has worked in different fields but the one that has generated the highest income has been food preparation. Cintya has 13 years experience in this particular field. She sells her meals from a rented house opposite a local school and so has many customers. Cintya is applying for a loan in order to buy a cart to prepare her food. The cart that she has now is not in good enough condition to be used every day. With this loan, Cintya will be able to improve customer service and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a cart for preparing food.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo, a quien apoya moral y económicamente de manera mensual, vive en alquiler en una zona que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y la cual habita por mucho tiempo. Ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para refaccionar un equipo ploter con el que piensa trabajar, para poder imprimir lonas y de esa forma obtener mejores ingresos. Paralelo a esa actividad el señor se dedica por las noches al transporte publico el cual le representa una fuente de ingreso más para cuando no tiene labores que realizar con su primera actividad como estructurista.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is single, has a son who he supports morally and economically on a monthly basis. He rents in an area that has all the basic services and in which he has lived for a long time. Now he needs to request a loan to repair a plotter machine to be able to print on canvas and in this way obtain better income. In parallel with this activity, he works in public transport at night which is another source of income when he doesn't have work in his primary job as a carpenter.

loans.use: to repair a plotter machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, ureas, fungicides and other products for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Alàglöwà Shkàbölö Group

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer indígena de 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos menores de edad, y su compañero, en una pequeña finca en la Alta Talamanca, Reserva Indígena de Costa Rica. La actividad que desarrolla ella y su compañero es la agricultura. Siembra de plátano y en ocasiones cacao. Las ganancias generadas producto de esta actividad son la única fuente de ingresos económicos para esta familia, y con ello pueden hacerle frente necesidades básicas como alimentación, y otros gastos familiares. Con los créditos anteriores ella logro consolidar su emprendimiento, generando un autoempleo, ya que en su comunidad no existen otras fuentes de trabajo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, bolsas y otros insumos para la siembra de su cultivo. Junto a Doña Claudia integran el grupo 3 señoras más van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en: Claudia is 44 years old and an indigenous woman. She lives with her two children and partner, in a small farm in Alta Talamanca, a Costa Rican indigenous reserve. Claudia and her partner work in agriculture. They grow plantains and sometimes cacao. The profits from this work is the family's only source of income and, with them, the family can pay for necessities such as food and other items. Using previous loans, Claudia has been able to stabilise her business and become self-employed as the local community does not have any other sources of work. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-insect chemicals, bags, and supplies for planting her crops. Alongside Claudia, there are three other women in the loan group who will invest in farming work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-insect chemicals, bags, and supplies for planting her crops.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es atenta, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona de Plan 3000 que es un lugar de creciente comercio en todas las áreas.
Gabriela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y su forma de vestir es a la moda. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de temporada, hace más de un año que comenzó su labor y trabaja sola. Al trabajar sola tiene un poco de dificultad para transportar su mercadería pero a la vez dispone de su tiempo y es su propia jefa. Su vida la comparte con sus padres, su hermano y su pareja, todos viven en la misma casa que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz), también se da tiempo para estudiar, aunque el tiempo es escaso. Ella desea tener un puesto de venta fijo y más grande para ofertar de mejor manera sus productos. 
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 23, is a young woman who lives with her partner.  She has no children and her business is selling clothing.  She is attentive, optimistic, happy, committed, generous, kind, responsible and very hard working.  She works in the "Plan 3000" area which is a growing commercial area.

Gabriela has a dark complexion, is of medium height, has long dark hair, her native language is Spanish and she dresses fashionably.  Her business is selling seasonal clothing and she has worked alone for over a year.  Because of working alone it is difficult for her to transport her merchandise, but she is her own boss and schedules her own time.

She shares her life with her parents, brother and partner, and they all live in the same house which has basic utilities such as water and electricity.  She also has a little time to study.  She would like to establish a larger, fixed stall in order to display her products better.  The loan Gabriela is requesting is to buy clothing wholesale and use the profits to help her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale and help her family with the profits.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Diary's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 30 femmes fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 19 novembre 2004. Il est composé par des membres qui vivent une bonne cohésion sociale car habitant le même village. Elles exercent l'embouche comme activité principale.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des moutons et des chèvres, de l'aliment pour la nourriture du bétail.Elle achète et après élevage, elle va les revendre.
Les bénéfices servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille en renforçant l'alimentation, l'habillement et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 30 women is part of the "banc villageois" which was created on the 19th of November, 2004. The group is made up of members who benefit from good social cohesion as they all live in the same village. The members' principal activity is livestock-fattening.

Diary will use her loan to buy sheep and goats, as well as livestock feed. She buys the goats, raises them and then resells them. The profits earned are used to improve her family's living conditions and spent on food, clothing and the children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
-  
Agé de 54 ans  Komla   père  de  4 enfants  résidant  à tokoin. Il a commencé  son activité de tailleur dans  son  atelier. il s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois au  grand marché de lomé  et  revend  par   exposition   dans son  atelier.  Komla  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: 54-year-old Komla is the father of 4 children and lives in Tokoin. He started his tailoring business in his workshop. He gets his supplies twice a month at the Grand Market in Lomé and resells his products by displaying them in his workshop. Komla is requesting a loan so that he can expand his business and satisfy his customers, and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy 23 pieces of cloth.

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe La Joie est composé équitablement de femmes monogames et polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé/cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, d’encens, du bois de chauffe et de la restauration. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails  à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux petits besoins de la famille dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The La Joie group is equally made up of women in monogamous relationships and women in polygamous ones. The women have an average age of 41 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, Mandé commune, Kati Circle, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships. The group members are small retailers of clothing, incense, firewood and prepared food. The members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to restock their inventories and are on their first group loan.

Ami (the woman standing on the left in the picture) has a great reputation as a clothes-seller. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 pieces of wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales in Kanadjiguila to a varied retail clientèle. Thanks to this loan, Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business. Her aim is to be able to fulfill the small needs of her family thanks to her working relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para invertir en: puertas, balcones, lámina y pines para colocar puertas y balcones y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.

loans.name: La   Richesse Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe La Richesse est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures, pagnes wax et céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures (hommes et femmes)  de toutes les qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 paires de chaussures  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’assurer cette bonne  relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The La Richesses group is made up of women in monogamous relationships. The women have an average age of 34 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, Mandé commune, Kati Circle, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships. The group members are small retailers of shoes, wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and cereals. The members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to build up their cash reserves and are on their first group loan.

Oumou (the woman standing second from the right in the picture) has a great reputation as a seller of shoes of mixed quality for men and women. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 pairs of shoes wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales on the streets of Kanadjiguila to a varied retail clientèle. Thanks to this loan, Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business. Her aim is to maintain a good working relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
-   
Mère de 2 enfants, elle  est  âgée de  40 ans. Victoire  réside à tokoin- Nyékonakpoè. elle vend  des pagnes. elle  s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois au  marché du ghana. elle  revend  au grand marché de lomé. Victoire sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: 40-year-old Victoire is the mother of 2 children. She lives in Tokoin-Nyékonakpoè and sells pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She gets her supplies 4 times a month at the market in Ghana. She resells the merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé. Victoire is requesting this loan in order to be able to satisfy her customers and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy 6 pagnes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Jimenez-Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two dependents who are of school age. To earn a living, Teresita has managed an eatery for 10 years, in addition to their family income from a bakery business. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase additional meat, beef, vegetables, spices, seasoning and drinks for her existing eatery business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her eatery business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat, beef, vegetables, spices, seasonings and drinks

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
- 
Amivi âgée de  43 ans est mariée,  mère de  2  enfants  résident à  tokoin- Nyékonakpoè. Elle vend  pagnes baltiques. Elle s'approvisionne 8 fois par mois au   marché du ghana et revend au   grand marché de lomé. Amivi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Amivi is 43 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Tokoin-Nyékonakpoè and sells "Baltic" pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She gets her supplies 8 times a month at the market in Ghana and resells her merchandise at the Lomé Grand Market. Amivi is requesting this loan so that she can expand her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy 7 pieces of "Baltic" pagnes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es: La señora Nicolaza, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y haba como los principales productos en terreno propio con una extensión de 1.2 hectáreas, produce con rotación de cultivos, tiene una experiencia de 14 años en el sector agrícola, además cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno(4 lecheras y 1 yunta) . La señora requiere un crédito para la compra de 1 camión de abono orgánico(gallinaza) y 4 cargas de semilla de papa para la siembra, quiere proveerse de estos insumos agrícolas porque se acerca la época de siembra, de esta forma incrementará su producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorarán su nivel de vida y su situación social.
texts.en: Nicolaza lives and works in Colomi. She is economically independent, hardworking and responsible. She is in agriculture for a living. She plants potatoes and beans as her main products on her own land of an area of 1.2 hectares. She produces with crop rotation. She has 14 years of experience in the agricultural sector. Also she has 5 heads of cattle (4 milk cows and 1 yoke). She needs a loan to buy 1 truck of organic fertilizer (manure) and 4 loads of potato seed. She wants to obtain these agricultural inputs because the planting season is approaching. In this way, she will increase her production and have better sales that will improve her standard of living and social situation.

loans.use: to buy 1 truck of organic fertilizer (manure)and 4 loads of potato seed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 53 years old and a single parent who is bravely raising three children.  

PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store. She gives her best efforts tending her store to get good sales in order to put food on the table for her children. Lourdes is now trying to expand her resources and has also decided to venture into clothing sales. She presented her project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP. She is thankful to PMPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all of her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy more store inventory and clothing to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Dorcas. Born in 1972, Dorcas has grown to be a strong and independent woman who is able to hold her family of six children together and provide for them after her husband passed on. She is a mixed farmer who grows maize and  vegetables for both consumption and sale. She also runs a small business that deals with computer services to feed off the growing technology industry that is slowly but surely penetrating into the way of life of Bokoli villagers. 

Dorcas is seeking a loan to purchase a high-quality dairy cow. The dairy business is very profitable in this area. Most families rely on milk to feed their children and prepare their meals. Ugali is the staple food of people from western Kenya where Bokoli village lies. Ugali is tasteless as it is made from pure maize flour and water. To make this into a mouthwatering delicacy, it has to be accompanied by sour milk and well-cooked vegetables, and meat for those who can afford it. Milk is also an ingredient in the preparation of vegetables. The heavy reliance on milk allows dairy farmers to do well in this region. The milk prices are always high because of the high demand. Little product marketing is required here because milk is milk. 

With your loan, Dorcas will not only reduce the amount of money spent on milk for the family, but also increase her income from the sale of milk. She will use the profits to grow the business and to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
