Kadek, who is the head of the Melati Putih Group, is responsible for the payment to MUK. Kadek sells all of her fattened pigs that she maintains for six months. Her profits are saved for future needs. Kadek is very pleased with the benefits she gets. This is all because of MUK, Kiva, and the lenders. She thanks everyone for the support that she has had. 

The Melati Putih Group continues to have a loan. The loan in this period is still used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Now Kadek has a sow and many piglets. Currently, the price of piglets is very expensive at 500,000 IDR per piglet. She will use her loan to purchase superior feed and renovate the cages. She and the members of the Melati Putih Group hope that their efforts will advance and that they can become independent and not need to borrow anymore.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the pigs' cages

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Né en 1981 à KOULIKORO, AMADOU vit avec  son enfant  dans une  famille nucléaire à KANGARE,   dans la Sous-Préfecture de KANGARE (Région de Sikasso, République du MALI). 
AMADOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de produits alimentaires de première nécessité.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le deuxième  prêt individuel précédent, AMADOU  est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité importante de produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit, en détail et à SELINGUE à une clientèle mixte. 
AMADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et être réinvesti dans les activités d’achat vente de produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Born in 1981 in Koulikoro, Amadou lives with his child in a nuclear family in Kangare, in the sub-prefecture of Kangare (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). Amadou did not get the opportunity to advance in school and became interested in revenue-generating activities very quickly, notably the buying and selling of basic food items. Having properly repaid his second loan, he is now on his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and will use it to buy a large quantity of basic foodstuffs. He gets his supplies from the wholesalers in Bamako and makes his sales for cash or credit in Selingue to a varied retail clientèle. Amadou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and part of which will be reinvested in his business, buying and reselling food products.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Fotemogoba Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de BINTOU  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités activité d’achat vente de condiments : choux, tomate et oignon.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui est la présidente  du groupe et très connue à  N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits alimentaires à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoba group is part of the Siguidia association in N'Tentou. It groups together women who got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships. The women have an average age of 32. They are married and have, on average, 3 children. They have different businesses including the buying and selling of condiments, as done by Bintou who is the first person standing on the left in the photo. The women live in traditional families in N'Tentou, in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been small retailers for several years and run successful businesses, buying and selling condiments like cabbages, tomatoes and onions. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program a year ago in order to be able to satisfy the growing demand of their customers. This is their third group loan.

Bintou, the group leader and well-known in N'Tentou, excels in the selling of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and sells her produce in Ouelessebougou, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Bartola De Los Santos

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Bartola, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Bartola es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o realizando sus recorridos ya que ella donde sea que va lleva su revista en la cual enseña sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 20 años por lo cual ya tiene mucha clientela que siempre le compran.
Este crédito es justamente para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y varios productos más. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The lending group "9 De Octubre" meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial history and artisan crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous straw panama hat.

Bartola lives in this canton. She is 54 years old, and is married with three children who are already grown up and lead their own lives. Her husband is a trader.

Bartola is a woman who strives very hard and who likes working to earn her own income. She works selling Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She works every day, either from home or in the streets, because wherever she goes, she takes her catalogue with her to show the products she sells. She sells on credit and collects the money every weekend. She has worked in this business for more than 20 years, and therefore she has many customers who always buy her products.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and various other products. Bartola has been a member of the lending group from the beginning, and she likes the help with the loans to group offers. It is her dream to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
-   
Demeurant  à  Lomé  dans  le quartier   tokoin,  Adjoavi  est  âgée  de  32 ans.  elle est mariée et n’ a pas d’enfant a charge. Adjoavi vend des   œufs et  s’approvisionne  4 fois par  mois  dans le village   djagblé et  est  ambulante . Adjoavi sollicite un  prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en: 32-year-old Adjoavi lives in Lomé, in the district of Tokoin. She is married and has no children to take care of. Adjoavi sells eggs, gets her supplies four times a month in the village of Djagblé, and resells the eggs on the streets. Adjoavi is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy 31 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements à l’image de SALIMATA  qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’habillements : pagne wax et balle de friperie. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
SALIMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habillements à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
The Lolo group is part of the Siguida association of N'Tentou. It groups together women who got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships. The women have an average age of 35. They are married and have, on average, 4 children. They have different businesses including buying and selling clothes, as done by Salimata who is the first person standing on the left in the photo. The women live in traditional families in N'Tentou, in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been small retailers for several years and run successful clothing businesses, buying and selling items like wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and bales of second-hand clothing. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program a year ago in order to be able to satisfy the growing demand of their customers. This is their third group loan.

Salimata, who is the group leader and well-known in N'Tentou, excels in the selling of clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy a bale of second-hand clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and sells the clothing in Ouelessebougou, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30 000 francs which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Narcisa Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Narcisa es una ama de casa que además de estar atenta de sus hijos también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos  por catálogos y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella siempre y a cada lugar que va lleva su revista la misma que muestra a sus clientes para que escojan lo que deseen luego ella hace los pedidos entrega y cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le permite ayudar a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa  y zapatos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The lending group "9 De Octubre" meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial history and artisan crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous straw panama hat.

Narcisa lives in this canton. She is 34 years old, and is married with three children who are 14, 12, and 6 years old. The two oldest children go to college, and the younger one to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Narcisa is a housewife who, in addition to taking care of the children, works selling clothes and shoes. She sells them by catalogue from door to door. She always carries her catalogue with her wherever she goes, and shows it to her customers so that they can choose what they want. She then takes the orders and delivers, and collects every 8 days because she sells her merchandise on credit.

She has worked in this business for more than five years, and it enables her to help her husband, who does not earn much with his work.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and shoes. Narcisa has been a member of the lending group from the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan. It is her dream to give her children the very best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lourdes Yamileth

texts.es: Lourdes, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara junto con dos de sus hijos. Hace varios años que Lourdes comenzó a vender mercadería nueva y usada de forma ambulante y ha crecido en su negocio y clientela. Ofrece blusas, pantalones para caballeros, sandalias, zapatos, camisas, pantalones cortos y ropa de niños. Necesita surtir el negocio de más ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, y calzado para incrementar su inventario y sus ventas, para eso solicita otro préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras. Este préstamo es el tercer ciclo con la institución y espera obtener más ganancias para sostener a su familia. Sus metas son graduar a sus hijos en la universidad, establecer el negocio en un local y comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 35 years old. She is a single mother with three children, and she lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with two of her children. Many years ago, Lourdes began to sell new and used merchandise in rounds around her town; she has now grown her business and her clientele.

She offers blouses, pants for men, sandals, shoes, t-shirts, shorts, and kids clothing. She needs to stock her business with more clothing, such as pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes in order to increase both her stock and sales. This is why she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras.

She is in her third loan cycle with this company, and she hopes to obtain more money to sustain her family. Her goals are to help her children graduate from university, to establish a business in her area, and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes to increase both her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Carmen Sarai

texts.es: Carmen es una joven de 21 años de edad quien está acompañada y es madre de una hija quien está en el kinder. Gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres ella logro estudiar en la secundaria y graduarse como Perito Mercantil y Contador Público siendo su compañero de hogar apoyo en su negocio lo cual es un centro de vídeo juegos al cual se dedica desde hace 5 años como iniciativa propia. En el establecimiento presta otra clase de servicios como la venta de comida pues es otro ingreso que ayuda a que su familia este mejor al mismo tiempo es difícil y cansado pero se esmera y trabaja muy duro junto a su pareja para ofrecer a su hija un mejor nivel de vida. Su clientela como se puede apreciar en la imagen son los alumnados de los diferentes colegios y escuelas los cuales con mucha confianza llegan para divertirse un rato y divagarse. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitacion pues hubo un espacio que lo permitió y le dio un mejor uso que el que tenía antes de dicha idea. Día a día trata de mejorar su negocio, brindado a sus clientes un buen servicio y una mejor comodidad siendo esta una ocasión por la cual se acerca a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder solicitar financiamiento con el cual pueda mejorar su negocio mediante la compra de un aire acondicionado y do Xbox ya que esto mejoraría su negocio encarecidamente. Como pequeña empresaria sus planes están enfocados en la mejora continua del negocio pues ella tiene mucha fe en lo que hace diariamente y lleva a cabo para salir adelante esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva. Para con su familia ofrecer lo mejor y poder dar a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar para poder salir adelante y ser una mujer preparada en la vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 21 year-old youth who is in a relationship and is a mother of a daughter who is in kindergarten. Thanks to the financial support of her family, she was able to study high school and graduated as an expert merchant and CPA. Being her live-in partner supported her in her business, which is a video game center, she has been doing this as her own initiative for 5 years. In her establishment she also offers other types of services like the sale of food as it is another source of income that helps her family be better. At the same time, it is difficult and tiring to strive and work very hard together with her partner to offer her daughter a higher quality of life. Her customers, as you can see in the photo, are students of different high schools and schools who with much confidence come for fun and entertainment.

Her business is located in her home as it allowed for a better use of the space than before this idea. Day to day she tried to improve her business, providing her customers a good service and improved comfort. It is for this that she is approaching cooperative COMIXMUL to be able to request financing with which she will be able to improve her business with the purchase of an air conditioner and two Xbox's which will improve her business greatly. As a small business, her plans are focused on the continuous improvement of the business. She has much faith in what she does daily and takes charge of her success, hoping to be supported by the different investors on the Kiva platform and to offer her family the best. She wants to be able to give her daughter the opportunity to study and be able to get ahead and be a woman prepared in life.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and 2 Xbox's to improve her video gaming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, and bricks in order to build a bathroom and repair the kitchen in his home.

loans.name: Alexander Enrique

texts.es:
Alexander Enrique tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia; vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Alexander Enrique se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica; hace 20 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; desea realizar arreglos en infraestructura de su taller-local( el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio); esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia a su taller, para poder captar mayores clientes, incrementar sus ventas, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander Enrique is 55 years old. He is married and is raising a son. He lives in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Alexander Enrique has worked as a mechanic for 20 years. His business is located in his residence. He is asking for a loan to invest in fixed assets. He wants to make some repairs on the infrastructure of his locale (located in his residence). This will allow his to keep his tools in better condition and give his workshop a better appearance to attract more customers, increase sales, improve his sales and therefore his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs on the infrastructure of his locale (located in his residence).

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive el señor Luis, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
Don Luis es un joven que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, el con este crédito espera adecuar en su casa un local, él con la ayuda de su mamá  se dedican a la venta ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, actualmente venden puerta a puerta pero quieren tener un local para vender sus productos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos y vitrinas para arreglar el local. Sus sueños es salir adelante en su negocio y su vida.
texts.en:
In the 26 de Septiembre street area of the city of  Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Las Acacias credit group meet every two weeks. 

This is where Luis lives. He is 24, single, and lives in his parents' house. He has been in the credit group since the beginning and he likes it because of the help the loans give him.  

Luis is a young man who likes to work to get ahead. With this loan, he hopes to equip his locale. He and his mother sell all kinds of clothes and shoes. Right now, they sell door to door but they want to have a locale to sell their products. He is going to use the loan to buy clothes, shoes and to equip the locale. His dream is to get ahead in his business and his life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and display cases.

loans.name: Bitolokho

texts.fr: BITY LOKHO est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus. Elle habite dans un quartier non loin du guichet, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est à son 3ème prêt et sollicite ce dernier pour acheter des tissus qu’elle revend à ses clients potentiels. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16h. Pour les charges, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais médicaux de ses enfants. Elle souhaite avoir une grande boutique de prêt à porter pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent, ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Bity Lokho sells fabrics. She lives in a district not far from the UIMCEC branch. She is married and a mother. This is her third loan which she is requesting so that she can buy fabric to resell to her customers. She has over 5 years experience in this line of work. She starts her workday at 9am and finishes it at 4pm. Her expenses include supporting her husband with the daily expenditures and paying for her children's healthcare. She would like to own a large ready-to-wear clothing store so that she could increase her income and build some savings, which would allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos  de 33 años de edad quien vive en Sololá, soltero. Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos.

La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de Carlos pues es la actividad que el realiza y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de fertilizante ya que desde un tiempo ha venido trabajando por ello para poder cultivar la tierra de la mejor manera para que le brinde los frutos de la mejor calidad para poder realizar una buena venta de las mismos para tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old. He is single and lives in Solala. He has made a living working the land as a laborer for many years; it is his only source of economic income.

The land is blessed by Carlos' hands, and he loves to work and take care of the land. It is a dignified post, and he admires the men that have dedicated years and their entire lives to it. The land without the labor of the dedicated farmers to cultivate it does not bear the fruits that sustain the entire generation.

The motive for his loan is to buy fertilizer for a piece of land that he has been working on for quite a long time to grow the best quality fruits. He hopes the fruit willl sell well so he can obtain a good economic income to sustain his family.

His goals are to pay his debts with what he earns, and in the future, he hopes to buy more land for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Rosario Guadalupe

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 19, 13 y 7 años que estudian en universidad, colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico tiene una rectificadora.
Doña Rosario es una mujer que le encanta trabajar, ella le ayuda en la parte contable en la rectificadora de su marido pero en sus ratos libres se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, sobrecamas, edredones entre otras cosas, ella en sociedad con otra persona distribuyen estos productos al por mayor y menor por toda la ciudad y otros cantones de la provincia donde tienen muchos clientes. Lleva más de 10 años con su actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para bien de su familia y el suyo propio.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, sobrecamas, edredones entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles la mejor educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the 26 de Septiembre street area of the city of  Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Acacias credit group meets every two weeks.   
 
This is where Rosario lives. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children aged 19, 13 and 7. They are in college, high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic and has a wheel alignment business. 

Rosario is a woman who loves to work. She helps with the accounting in her husband's alignment business, but in her free time, she is a merchant. She sells sheets, bed spreads, comforters, and more. She is in business with another person and they distribute these products wholesale and retail throughout the whole city and in other cantons in the province where they have a lot of customers. She has done this activity for more than 10 years and she earns her money that way for her family and herself.

This loan is to buy sheets, bed spreads, comforters and more. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because of the help they give her with the loans. Her dream is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bed spreads, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Jessenia Ernestina

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 7  y 6  años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Jessenia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo ganar sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un negocio cerca de su casa en la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, esto lo realiza en las mañanas y parte de la tarde, pero en sus ratos libres también recorre la localidad vendiendo productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días en sus negocios y es algo que le gusta ya que se entretiene y se gana lo suyo, ella lleva un año dedicada a esta actividad. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cosméticos, frutas y legumbres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group “Las Acacias” [The Acacia Trees] meets fortnightly in an area called “26th of September Street”, in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital city of the Manabí province and is also known as “the City of the Royal Tamarinds.”

This is where Jessenia lives. She is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has three children who are 8, 7 and 6 and go to school. Her husband is a businessman. Jessenia is an independent woman who likes to generate her own income to help her family. She works close to home and sells fruits and vegetables. She works in the morning and in the afternoon. During her free time, she visits different areas to sell Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works every day and enjoys doing it because she has something to do and she can make her own money. She has been doing this for a year.

She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics, fruits and vegetables. She has been a member of the group since it started and she likes to be a member because they help her to receive these loans. Her dream is to give her children the best she can give them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zoila Priscila

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hija de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio.
Doña Zoila es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito tanto para ella como para su esposo el cual tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio en la ciudad de Manta lugar en el cual con otra persona realizan diversidad de trabajos a base de pedidos de sus clientes, ella por su parte también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja dos a tres días en sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y su esposo mucho más tiempo con su taller.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, aluminio y vidrio para el esposo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The lending group "9 De Octubre" meets every 15 days in canton Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial history and artisan crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous straw panama hat.

Zoila lives in this canton, she is 31 years old, and is married with a 6-year-old daughter who goes to school. Her husband has an aluminum and glass workshop.

Zoila is a good wife and is taking out this loan for herself, but also for her husband, who has an aluminum and glass workshop in the city of Manta. In his workshop, he and another person make various products their customers have ordered. 

Zoila sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She works three days per week. She sells on credit from door to door and collects every weekend. She has worked for more than five years in this business, and her husband has had his workshop for much longer.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, and aluminum and glass for her husband. Zoila has been a member of the lending group from the beginning, and she likes the help with the loans they provide. It is her dream to give the very best to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, aluminum, and glass.

loans.name: Cecilia Alegria

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es contratista electricista.
Doña Cecilia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta recorriendo la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva  cinco años en este negocio con el cual además de ganarse algo se entretiene ya que pasa sola casi todo el día en casa. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que tiene en todo este tiempo. Sus sueños aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The lending group "9 De Octubre" meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and artisan crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous straw panama hat.

Cecilia lives in this canton. She is 53 years old, and married with 3 grown-up children. One of them still lives at home. Her husband is an electricity contractor. Cecilia is a hard-working woman who likes working in order to help with the household expenses. She works in trade, selling clothes of all kinds. She sells them from door to door in the neighborhood, offers her products, leaves them on credit, and collects every eight days. She has been in this business for five years, and in addition to earning a bit of money, she likes the distraction, because at home she is on her own all day.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, like: trousers, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes. She has been a member of the lending group from the beginning, and she likes the benefits it provides. It is her dream to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Cherif

texts.fr: CHERIF  est un homme qui a comme profession transporteur, il est marié et vie avec sa famille. Il a une expérience de 11ans dans cette activité et voudrait ce montant pour acheter du matériel de pièces détachées venant d’Europe pour réparer une de ses voitures. Il  prie la charge entière des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 9h  pour la terminer à 19h. Avec ce prêt CHERIF  pourra diversifier ses activités pour élargir le nombre de ses employés. De ce fait, il pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté d’abord avant d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. A l’avenir il souhaite aussi construire une maison destinée à la location
texts.en: Cherif is a transport operator. He is married and lives with his family. He has 11 years experience in his line of work and wants the loan in order to be able to buy European spare parts with which to repair one of his cars. He is solely responsible for covering the daily expenditures and his children's education fees. He starts his workday at 9am and finishes at 7pm. Thanks to this loan, Cherif will be able to diversify his activities and employ more workers. This will allow him to increase his revenue and save some money before improving his family's living conditions. In the future, he would also like to build a house for rent.

loans.use: to buy spare parts from Europe with which to repair his broken down car.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
_ - 
Agée de 39 ans  jeanne est  mère  et  mère d’ 4 enfants  résidant  à tokoin. elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant des tissus coupon. elle s'approvisionne  4 fois  par mois grand marché de lomé  et  revend à son  ambulante  et  à la  dans les compagnies d'assurances et banques.  jeanne  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: 39-year-old Jeanne is the mother of 4 children and lives in Tokoin. She started her business activities selling fabric remnants. She gets her supplies 4 times a month from the Grand Market in Lomé and sells them on the street and in insurance companies and banks. Jeanne is requesting a loan in order to grow her business so that she can satisfy her customers and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy 20 metres of fabric remnants.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
BENSO est un groupe de l’association SABABOU de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente des produits cosmétique  à l’image de FATOUMATA  qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la Sous-Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente des produits cosmétique : parfums, crèmes de beauté et fonds de teint.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a neuf ans. Elles sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente des produits de cosmétique. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  30 cartons de parfum et 10 cartons de crèmes de beauté.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  N’TENTOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente des produits cosmétique.
texts.en:
The Benso group is part of the Sababou association of N'Tentou. It groups together women who got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships. The women have an average age of 37. They are married and have, on average, 2 children. They have different businesses including buying and selling cosmetics, as done by Fatoumata who is standing on the right in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in N'Tentou, in the sub-prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been small retailers for several years and are much in demand for their products, including perfumes, beauty creams and foundation creams. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program nine years ago in order to be able to satisfy the growing demand of their customers. This is their eleventh group loan.

Fatoumata, who is the leader of the group and well-known is N'Tentou, excels in selling cosmetic products. She plans to use her loan to buy 30 boxes of perfume and 10 boxes of beauty creams. She gets her supplies in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and sells her products in N'Tentou, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60 000 francs, which will enable her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her cosmetics business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Bun Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Bun Lestari group made their payments. The repayment was presented by the head of the group, Ni Wayan, because most of the members work at their gardens. During that time, all the members could sell their pigs and earn a satisfactory profit. With the extra knowledge from the training they received, now they can manage the pigs well. 

As the head of the group, Ni Wayan is a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase 3 super quality piglets and feed. Entering their fourth loan cycle, most of the members of Bun Lestari group have a sow and local pigs for pig barbeque. The local pigs will sell every 2 months. Ni Wayan sold all her pigs. With the profit she earned, she can save and support her children's education by buying books and other school needs. She's very happy and decided to take a new loan to increase her business. She said thanks to Lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

No Wayan is really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK and Lenders for supporting her bussines and also the group. Now she can support her husband’s income to fullfill their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 super quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Né en 1972 à BOUGOULA, DRAMANE vit avec ses deux enfants et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à BOUGOULA dans la Sous-Préfecture de SANANKOROBA, (Région de Koulikoro République du MALI).
DRAMANE  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales: riz et mil. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de ses clientèles, DRAMANE décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le troisième prêt individuel précédent, il est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 sacs de riz, 10 sacs de mil auprès des paysans producteurs de SAFE KOREN et GNASSANAN. Il  vend essentiellement  au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail, à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
DRAMANE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et de  réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en: Born in 1972 in Bougoula, Dramane lives with his 2 children and his wife in a nuclear family in Bougoula, in the sub-prefecture of Sanankoroba (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). Dramane did not get the opportunity to progress with his education and quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of cereals (rice and millet). Dramane decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his growing customer demand. Having correctly repaid his third individual loan, he is on his 4th, which will be used to buy 10 bags of rice and 10 bags of millet from the farmers of Safe Koren and Gnassanan. He sells mainly for cash, sometimes credit, to both wholesale and retail customers from his house and at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. Dramane hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 francs which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest in his business buying and selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 3  años, el mayor estudia en colegio. El marido es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Mayra para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar  hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde los fines de semana vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, corviches, empanadas, jugos, colas, aguas, entre otras cosas que ella prepara, lleva más de 7  años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátano, pescado, carne, colas, aguas, frutas  y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
On the 26 de Septiembre street in the city of Portoviejo (with the capital of Manabita known as the City of the Real Tamarindos), the members of the Grupo de Crédito Las Acacias meet every 15 days. This is where Mayra lives. She is 34 years old and lives in a domestic partnership, from which she has two children who are 18 and 3. The oldest is in high school. Her husband is a security guard.

Mayra started a business several years ago so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. She has a little store in her house where, on the weekends, she sells fast food such as hamburgers, corviches, empanadas, juice, soda and water, among other things that she prepares. She has had this business for over 7 years and it has given her what she needs to move forward.

She's going to use this loan to buy bananas, fish, meat, soda, water, fruit and other foods to use to prepare her dishes. This is her second cycle with Grupo de Crédito and she is grateful for the help that they are giving her to get ahead. Her dreams are to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bananas, fish, meat, soda, water, fruit and other foods.

loans.name: Rouguiatou

texts.fr: ROUGUIATOU est une femme très brave qui évolue dans la commercialisation des  fruits et légumes. Elle habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet. Elle est veuve et mère de famille qui a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. C’est elle qui gère toutes les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de ses enfants qui sont tjrs à l’école  et leurs frais de scolarité. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir satisfaire d’avantage ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Avec l’aide de l’institution, elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et épargner de l’argent à coté
texts.en: Rouguiatou is a good woman who sells fruit and vegetables. She lives in the district where the UIMCEC branch is located. She is a widow and a mother with over 20 years experience in her line of work. She is solely responsible for covering the daily expenditures and the educational expenses of her children who attend school. She needs this loan so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise and diversify her product range in order to better satisfy her customers. She starts her workday at 9am and finishes it at 6pm. With the help of the institution, she would like to open a grocery store so that she can increase her revenue and improve her family's living conditions, as well as building some savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Waskem

texts.en:
Waskem is 56 years old and single. She was a fruit merchant in the market for over 8 years. She is happy to be a trader because she has sufficient for her daily needs. 

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used for improving access to water and sanitation for her family. She will  build a bathroom, septic tank, and water closet at her home. 

Proper sanitation will improve her, and her family's, health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be self motivated. He operates a farm where he keeps cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a favourable location. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hèlenne

texts.fr:
_ - 
Hèlenne âgée de  46 ans ,elle est mariée et  mère de  2 enfants résident à tokoin. elle vend des  oeufs. elle s'approvisionne 5 fois par mois au  marché de Ségbé et revend dans les   quartiers  environant  de son domicile. Hèlenne sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: 46-year-old Hèlenne is married and the mother of 2 children, and lives in Tokoin. She sells eggs. She gets her supplies 5 times a month from the market in Ségbé and resells them in the districts near her home. She is requesting this loan so that she can grow her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 20 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Munaroh

texts.en:
Munaroh is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one son.  She has had a grocery shop for over 15 years to increase the family income. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to provide a better life.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used for improving access to water and sanitation for her family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and water closet at her home. 

Proper sanitation will improve her, and her family's, health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to mprove access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né en 1984 à BOUGOULA, MOUSSA vit avec ses quinze enfants et ses époux dans une famille traditionnelle à BOUGOULA dans la Sous-Préfecture de SANANKOROBA, (Région de KOULIKORO République du MALI).
MOUSSA  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales ( riz, fonio, mil) de l'arachide et des articles divers de boutique. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le troisième prêt individuel précédent, MOUSSA est à son quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de riz et 5 sacs de mil auprès des paysans producteurs de SAFE KOREN, NIAZANA et BOUGOULA. Il  vend essentiellement  au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail, à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
MOUSSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en: Born in 1884 in Bougoula, Moussa lives with his 15 children and his wives in a traditional family in Bougoula, in the sub-prefecture of Sanankoroba (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). Moussa did not have the opportunity to progress at school and very quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of cereals (rice, fonio, millet), groundnuts and various shop products. Having properly repaid his third individual loan, Moussa is on his 4th loan with Soro Yiriwaso which will be used to buy 5 bags of rice and 5 bags of millet from the farmers of Safe Koren, Niazana and Bougoula. He makes his sales mostly for cash, sometimes credit, wholesale and retail, from his home and at the market, to a clientele composed of men and women. Moussa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75 000 francs which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest in his business buying and selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 42-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a livestock farmer who also grows food crops like banana, tea and sugarcane. He faces challenges of fluctuation of agricultural prices.

He has hopes of increasing his income by expanding his business to new areas and having a good homestead. Issa needs a loan to roof his house.

loans.use: to roof his house.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 42 years old, married and has three schooling children. She owns and manages a small retail store within her community to help her husband in gaining income. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

To bear the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to further improve her business to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, laundry soaps, candies and soft drinks to resell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, laundry soaps, candies and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane settled for a living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is 42 years old and had seven children.

She helps her husband operating their own farm to make a living. She sells their farm produce in town and some portion is used for their consumption.

She became a member of GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She wants to improve their farm as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as industrious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to have more shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as industrious. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand and buy a public service vehicle within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 23 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy beauty products and salon equipment. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and salon equipment.

loans.name: Mukagogo United Group

texts.en:
Robert is a member of Mukagogo United, where each member guarantees the others so as to access credit.

He is age 33 with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time a farmer. He faces challenges of poor roads that hinder transport and customers who delay to pay. Nevertheless, he hopes to expand into a wholesale business. 

Robert needs a loan to pay school fees and buy sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 26 year married Ugandan living in Kagadi.  He has operated a video library since 2009 and also earns from a banana plantation to sustain his needs. Because he is hard working, he desires to grow his business to enable him to increase sales.

Joseph is challenged by load shading and he is asking for a loan to help him to buy more movie DVDs, tapes and CDs for his library.

loans.use: to help him to restock his library

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Marko was born in the late 1970s, is married and has got three children in school. He has been running three different projects: a retail shop, a secondhand clothes selling business and a food cafe.  He has been in his projects for five years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Marko's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling secondhand clothes, opened a food cafe and increased on the retail shop inventory.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees, built his house and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy shop inventory. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop for selling drinks.

Marko will share this loan with his loan group "Kipawa," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Buponelo is in her 30s, married and has got two children who are at school. She supports her family with a business selling handbags and fabrics door to door. She has been in this business for two years now and is able to realize a small monthly profit. Buponelo works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily.

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is her first credit request to be apportioned among Iringa, a three-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Buponelo will invest her portion of the loan to buy handbags and fabrics. Her desire is to grow her business and do better in life.

loans.use: to buy hand bags and fabrics.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the support of the previous loans that helped her to grow her business.

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of 15,000 KES to buy wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Kosmira

texts.ru: Космире 33 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Космиры среднее образование, на протяжении 10 лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 15 овец и 1 лошадь, также есть земельный надел, мерою 1,00 ГА, где она выращивает пшеницу и картофель, реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям. Космира известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек.  Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Космира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита Космира планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также в дальнейшем на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kosmira is 33, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and has been earning extra money for her family through farming for ten years. She has two cows, 15 sheep and a horse, along with a 1.0 hectare plot of land where she plants wheat and potatoes, which she sells wholesale. Kosmira is known as a principled, honest, proper, and trustworthy person. In order to expand her farming business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow. She will use the profits to continue expanding her business and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: To purchase a cow in order to be more profitable and repair her house

loans.name: Anyona

texts.en:
Twenty-five kilometers from the rural town of Kisii, Kenya, you meet Anyona, a father of two who belongs to the smallholder category. The village of Ogembo, where Anyona resides, has largely stayed under-developed with farmers persistently following traditional cultivation practices and mostly preferring to cultivate bananas. 

Anyona has been practicing dairy farming, disrupting the traditional practice of cultivating bananas with an objective to improve his socio-economic status. The prevailing geological conditions of the village make it extremely suitable for dairy farming. The major challenge he faces is lack of funds to push his dairy farming a notch higher. 

He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The additional cow will help in the use of pasture and will increase milk production and availability to produce more byproducts. Through this loan, Anyona will be able to challenge the existing norms and bring better and advanced dairy farming practices to his village, thus becoming a torchbearer for change in his village for others to follow. 

He hopes that he will be able to use your loan investment wisely to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sibabu

texts.en:
Sibabu is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sibabu cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Adia Coumba

texts.fr: ADJA COUMA est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans le quartier qui est en face du Guichet. Elle n’a pas de parente bénéficiaire de crédit dans l’institution. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des rideaux et draps. Elle est  à son 2ème prêt et demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des rideaux et draps. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h et souhaite à l’avenir renforcer ses fonds de roulement. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses marchandises et ensuite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Adja Couma is a married woman and a mother. She lives in an area opposite the UIMCEC branch. She has no relatives benefiting from UIMCEC loans. She sells curtains and sheets. This is her second loan and she is requesting it in order to buy and sell curtains and sheets. She supports her husband with the daily expenditures and the children's education expenses. She has 2 years experience in her line of work. She starts her workday at 8am and ends it at 5pm. In future, she would like to strengthen her working capital which would allow her to increase her revenue, diversify her product range and then improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy curtains and sheets for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables to sell. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Reyes Manuel

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Reyes albañil de 65 años de edad con una familia de 3 hijos los cueles son buenos estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 25 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo el lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida. La segunda actividad que le realiza es la compra y venta de abarrotería en la comunidad donde el vive.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio, y que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sololá is known for being a well populated city with well-built and modern homes, constructed out of sophisticated materials.  The socio-economic development of the area has been a main factor, but the bricklaying labor and qualified builders have also been crucial.  One such worker is Reyes, a bricklayer who is 65 years old and has a family of three children, who are good school students in their community.

Reyes' job is bricklaying.  He has done this activity for 25 years and it has become a very good source of income for him and his family.  He is very dedicated to his job, which he does in the most correct and quick way.  The second job he does is buying and selling groceries in the community where he lives.

The loan that Reyes has asked for will be used to buy bricklaying tools so he can work and do his job better and with more speed.  One of his dreams over time is to become a master worker and teach his children the same trade, and for his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid off 16 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and is a mixed farmer from Bungoma, Kenya. She requested her second loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a brood of hens. She used her first loan to buy a diary cow.  With the second loan, she aspires to keep increasing her income and improving the quality of life her family is leading. 
 
Small-scale farming is a way of life in Africa full of challenges and equally full of huge opportunities. Lilian has set out to venture into poultry farming, which is one of the most profitable industries in Kenya due to the high demand from hotels and restaurants. 

For Lilian, this is a very wonderful opportunity. The poultry business is something that has been breathing within her for some time. The business is easy to establish; chickens are unproblematic to rear on small plots; poultry are well-adapted and more resistant to local pests and diseases; the business is vital for future food security, leading towards self-employment and self-reliance.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
_  -   
Demeurant  à  Lomé  dans  le quartier de  tokoin,  Akou  est  âgée de 46 ans. elle est mariée et  mère    de  2 enfants. Akou  vend  les   produits   alimentaires  et  s’approvisionne  8 fois par  mois  au  grand marché de lomé et  revend à  un  emplacement  qu’elle  à louée  . Akou sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profits
texts.en: Akou is 46 years old and lives in the Tokoin district of Lomé. She is married and the mother of 2 children. Akou sells food products and gets her supplies 8 times a month at the Lomé Grand Market and then resells them from a rented location. Akou is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of spaghetti, 3 boxes of tomatoes and 8 packets of chocolate.

loans.name: Karambi Bakyara Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Yusta is a 55-year-old widowed lady who is living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has 7 children. 

She is a farmer and a retailer.  She started these businesses with the hope of gaining profits and looking after her family well. She faces hardships of weather changes and customers who delay to pay. 

Yusta plans to buy another piece of land for farming. She is acquiring the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Luzviminda requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong is 35 years old and lives with her daughters and husband who is a bricklayer. 

For the past 4 years, Phuong has been running a general store and selling vegetables from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. 

She is the group leader of a 4-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is second from the left wearing a black jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Phuong is requesting a loan to purchase better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products such as food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan requested another loan, which she will use to buy more soft drinks and food to sell at her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Lan also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, soft drinks, snack foods, beverages, detergent soaps and seasonings

loans.name: Danayaso Group

texts.fr:
DANAYASO est un groupe de l’association JIGUIYA de KANGARE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de riz à l’image de DJENEBA  qui est la première personne assise de la  gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la Sous-Préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE, excelle dans la vente de riz. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE,  et vend ses riz à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de riz.
texts.en:
The Danayaso group is part of the Jiguiya association of Kangare. It groups together women who got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships. The women have an average age of 29. They are married and have, on average, 2 children. They have different businesses including buying and selling rice, as done by Djeneba who is the sitting on the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Kangare, in the sub-prefecture of Selingue (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They have been small retailers for several years and are much in demand for their products, like rice. The group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program a year ago in order to be able to satisfy their growing customer demand. This is their fourth group loan.

Djeneba, who is the group leader and well-known in Kangare, excels in the selling of rice. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 bags of rice. She gets her supplies in Selingue and sells the rice in Kangare, for cash or credit, to a mixed retail clientèle. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 70 000 francs which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her rice-selling business.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 48 years old and has two children.  Edelina is married, and both of her children are in school.

Edelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edelina requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Edelina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edelina would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with five children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamisi wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Beatrice owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Beatrice has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business area.
 
With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen would like to take a further loan to buy fabric and materials to make clothes and sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is a 41-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Boseth district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 23 years. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the first microloan for Kunthea with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kunthea will use her portion to build a decent latrine to use in her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to use in her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Tsira is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives in the Oni district with her husband and 4 children. 

Tsira is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a vineyard and a cow. She produces wine and sells it locally at a good price. Tsira milks the cow every day and produces dairy products, which are sold locally. She wants to expand her husbandry business and requested a loan. 

The start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,050 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase an additional cow which will produce more dairy products. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sophatt's Group

texts.en:
Sophatt is aged 39 years and married. He lives with his wife in a rural area located in the Boseth district, Cambodia. He is a farmer who has been farming rice for 21 years. To supplement the income, he also works as a garment worker. The current business earns him about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.
