This is the second loan for Sophatt with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Sophatt is now leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to build a decent latrine for using in his family. He hopes to have a clean latrine to use in his family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for using in his family

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is 30 years old, is not married and has got a boy and girl who are at school. She takes care of her own family by running a genge, and sells second-hand clothes door to door. She has been in her projects since 2005. She is working from 06:00 am to 09:00 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her sixth loan request to be apportioned among TOPI, a seven-member-group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Tatu's previous loans, since repaid, were used to buy genge inventories and second-hand clothes. She earned profit which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. 

She will use her new credit to buy genge inventory for selling. Her desire is to be successfully and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy genge inventory.

loans.name: John Mark

texts.en:
John Mark wants to have a permanent job in the future in line with his courses. He is single, with eight siblings. His father works as a rice mill operator. 

John Mark studied basic seaman at the university. His father earns good enough for their basic needs, so he find ways in order to cope up financially.

John Mark joined Gata Daku MPC, and had borrowed a new loan to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. Time is gold for him, and he doesn't waste his time with unnecessary activities, but he focuses on  his studies in order to gain success.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

She has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

In the future, Solita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Fikira

texts.en:
Fikira operates a poultry selling business. She cited disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in her business. 

Fikira requested a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase chicks and poultry feeds for her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie lives in Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur with her family. It is a commercial town, considering that it is centered with another town far from the city where business establishments are located.

Rosalie is 38 years old and runs a retail store for a living. She started her business  by selling banana cue and with her effort and determination was able to put up a retail store business. She works tirelessly every single day to bring home enough to sustain her household.

With this loan, she wants to invest in purchasing more merchandise, to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With these items, she will be able to increase her sales because many of her customers ask for other goods they need everyday. She is happy that this loan will allow her to improve her sales and provide more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Aracely Edith

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen 4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 10 años  que estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es pintor.
Doña Aracely es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para poder ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y el estudio de sus hijos, trabaja en una casa de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, ella compra arroz en una piladora en Charapoto lugar en el cual le dejan a muy buen precio para luego distribuirlo en su casa ya sea por quintal o por saquillos de diez libras en adelante, ella también los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo con lo cual se gana algo extra que le sirven mucho. Lleva más de 7 años con su actividad la cual le da para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es  para comprar ropa y arroz. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area of Calle 26 de Septiembre in the town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita known as the Dos Reales Tamarindos, the members of the loan group Las Acacias meet every two weeks.

32-year old Sra. Aracely lives here with her partner and their four children aged 18, 16, 12 and 10. They all attend school. Her husband is a painter.

Sra. Aracely is a woman who enjoys working so she can help her husband with household expenses and their children’s education. She works in a nearby house and also has a business selling rice which she buys from an outlet in Charapoto. The prices there are very good. Then she sells the rice from her house either in 100 lb or 10 lb bags. At weekends Aracely also sells all kinds of clothing to earn some extra money which is a great help to them. She’s done this kind of work for more than seven years to help her children get ahead.

She plans to use the loan money to buy clothing and rice. She’s been with her loan group since the beginning and likes it for the help it provides with loans. Her dream is to provide the best of everything for her children.

loans.use: buy clothing and rice

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Elipendo is in her late twenties, single,  and has three children who attend school. She operates a kiosk selling a variety of small items; such as sodas, water, juices, sweets, and biscuits, which she has been doing for six months. She works from 8 AM to 8 PM daily and is able to make a fair profit every day.

Elipendo is a member of a 10-person group. She requested her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to purchase sodas, juices, water, sweets, biscuits, and other items. Her ambition is to expand her business and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, water, sweets, biscuits, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children all under her care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits. For that reason, with the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes and watermelons for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes and watermelons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en: Roldan wants to be a teacher someday to earn a salary. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Education because he has wanted to become a teacher since he was young. It is his desire to help other people. He has 11 siblings and they make a living from their farm. He found many ways to continue studying. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. He is grateful to GDMPC for giving students a chance to continue learning in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 64 and is married. She helped her husband manage their own farm to make a living. They grow rice and sell it in town, earning well for the family. With her income, she was able to sustain their needs. She joined GDMPC and she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer in order to have a greener farm. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer in order to have a greener farm.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert wants to become successful in the future. He studied basic seaman in the university to achieve his ambition. His parents are farmers and he has 9 siblings. Having a big family is not easy. He joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a new loan to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. He believes that being poor is not a hindrance to success but we have to overcome it by obtaining knowledge as a tool for success.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is married with two children. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she has a small cafeteria. She helped her husband working on their farm to make a living. She is a new member of GDMPC and she gains access to microfinance services of the cooperative. She borrowed a new loan to purchase farm organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to have a greener farm as well as a cafeteria in order earn daily income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is single and has a trisikad business in the Philippines.

Magdalena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional trisikad for her business.

Magdalena has been in this business for ten years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trisikad for her business.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is single and has 5 children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetables selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nonila

texts.en:
Nonila is 51 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nonila has a general store business in the Philippines. Nonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

Nonila has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nonila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and blessed with 4 children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariamu cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. In addition, she does a business of tailoring to supplement her income. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.
 
With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has operated a fruit and vegetables selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 25,000. She wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with ten children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Masika operates a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have big water storage in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water to resell.

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.en:
Elizaveta is married and works in agriculture, growing and selling vegetables and greens in both greenhouses and open fields, an occupation she has had for 10 years. She is hardworking and responsible and wants to develop her business.

Elizaveta is requesting a loan of 5,000 griven to buy cover and materials to build a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase cover and materials for the construction of a new greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, certified seeds and to pay the expenses incurred in rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small dried fish, called daga, to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband and children, she lives at their own house. The house has neither electricity nor piped water.

Rehema has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business, and establishing another business, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe appreciates the support of the previous loans. They helped her to support her business and supplement her income. Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000. She will use this loan to buy a blender, passion fruit, avocado, and oranges for her business.

loans.use: to buy a blender and fruit, for her juice business.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: 39-летняя Наталья живет с двумя дочерьми в северном городе Худжанд. Диане 8 лет, а Роксолане 12 лет. Они ученицы средней школы. Наталья воспитывает своих дочерей одна без мужа. В течение 2 лет Наталья работала медсестрой в городской больнице в отделении глазных заболеваний. А последние 8 месяцев она помогала своей подруге в ее торговом бизнесе и приобрела полезный опыт. Теперь Наталья хочет начать собственный торговый бизнес. Она планирует заняться продажей женской одежды. Наталья вместе с подругой арендовала новое помещение под магазин. Чтобы привезти товар ей не хватает 2000 долларов США. Эту сумму она запрашивает в кредит. Начав новый прибыльный бизнес, Наталья хочет тем самым улучшить финансовое положение семьи и обеспечить светлое будущее для образования своих дочерей.
texts.en: 39-year-old Natalya lives with her two daughters in the northern town of Khujand. Diana is 8 years old, and Roksolana is 12 years old. They are both secondary school students. Natalya is raising her daughters alone, without a husband. Natalya has worked as a nurse at an eye disease division of a municipal hospital for two years. She has been helping her friend with her retail business for the past 8 months and obtained a useful experience. Now Natalya wants to start her own retail business. She is planning to sell women's clothing. Natalya and her friend leased a new space for the store. She is short 2000 US dollars to bring in the merchandise. She is requesting this amount as a loan. By starting the new business, Natalya wants to improve her family's financial situation and provide a bright future for educating her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothing in order to start a new business

loans.name: Adjo-

texts.fr:
- 
Agée de 45 ans  Adjo est  mariée et  mère d’ un enfant.elle est   résidant  à tokoin. elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant du boisson local Liha. Elle  s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois  grand marché de   lomé  et  revend  à  un  emplacement dans les  écoles de la place.  Adjo  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Adjo, aged 45, is a married mother of one child and residing in Tokoin. She started her business selling a local drink, Liha. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé, and she makes her sales at a location in local schools. Adjo is requesting a loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bowls of corn, 10 bowls of sugar, and 10 bowls of ‘foourne’

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
-  
célibataire  âgé de  23 ans, Amivi  réside à tokoin. elle vend  des détergents. elle  s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois au  grand marché de lomé. elle  revend  de son domicile et est ambulante. Amivi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit
texts.en: Amivi, aged 23, is unmarried and residing in Tokoin. She sells detergents and gets her supplies four times a month at the big market of Lomé, and she makes her sales at her home and by going door to door. Amivi is requesting a loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of Génis detergent and 2 boxes of 'kingo'

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.ru:
Гуломчон жизнерадостный молодой человек в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат имеет троих детей. Гуломчон со своей женой живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми, он и его жена очень рады растить своих детей. 

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание Гуломчон занимается своим любимым делом. Гуломчон вот уже как несколько лет работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Этот бизнес приносит Гуломчону хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание. А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства.  Поэтому Гуломчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulomjon is a happy young person, who is 29 years old. He is married and has three children. Gulomjon and his wife live happily and try to raise their children to be good people. He and his wife are glad to be raising their children. Gulomjon is involved in his favorite business to have a regular income. Gulomjon has been working as a taxi driver for several years. He has his own car, but it has been serving him for a long time and had to be repaired many times. This is why he is currently planning to purchase a new and improved car for running and expanding his business. This business yields Gulomjon a good income, but it is only enough for living expenses, and he needs money to buy a new car. This is why Gulomjon came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy a car in order to run his business. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a new in order to expand his business

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат  женщина 50 лет ,замужем,имеет троих детей. Шарофат родилась и выросла в сельской местности ,с детства работала на поле и знает ,какой это тяжкий труд. Шарофат в течение 12 лет занимается животноводством. На своем участке земли она ухаживает за крупным рогатым скотом.Ранним утром Шарофат доит своих коров,а ее дочь относит молоко на рынок для продажи.Шарофат хочет,чтобы ее дети могли получить образование и выбрать профессию,которая им по душе.Поэтому ей приходится работать в поте лица. Шарофат хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота и расширить свое стадо.На данный момент Шарофат не имеет нужной суммы,поэтому обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Шарофат заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Sharofat is a 50-year-old married woman with three children. Sharofat was born and grew up in a rural area, worked on a field since childhood and knows how difficult this work is. Sharofat has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years. She takes care of cattle on her land. Sharofat milks her cows early in the morning, and her daughter takes the milk to sell at a market. Sharofat wants her children to obtain an education and choose a profession that they would love. This is why she has to work hard. Sharofat wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand her herd. At the present time, Sharofat does not have the necessary amount of money and came to Arvand for financial support. Sharofat thanks MDO Arvand for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle and livestock feed

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FANTA qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate et oignon. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
FANTA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate et oignon). Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 12.500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a [borrowers’] group belonging to the Benkadi association of Tiele. The group is composed of women who know each other as relatives or neighbors. On the average, they are 50 years old. Married, with three children on the average, they are engaged in various business activites, for example, buying and reselling condiments, which is the case of Fanta. She is the first one seated from left to right in the photo. The group members live in traditional extended families in Tiele, in the subprefecture of Baguineda (Koulikoro Region of Mali).
They have been working as vendors for some years and have a lot of customer demand for condiments: peppers, tomatoes and onions. With the goal of meeting the growing demand, two years ago the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourth solidarity loan.
Fanta, who is the leader of the group and well known in Tiele, excels at selling condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various food condiments (peppers, tomatoes and oninons). She stocks up in Bamako as well as with local wholesalers and sells in Tiele, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 12,500 West African francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and invest the rest in her business as described.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de SELINKEGNY. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de fruits à l’image de NASSOU qui est la deuxième personne  assise   de la gauche vers la droite photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINKEGNY dans la  Préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de fruits : pomme, orange,  et banane. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
NASSOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à SELINKEGNY, excelle dans la vente de fruits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de différents fruits (pomme, orange et banane).  Elle s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes  de SELINGUE, KANGARE et DALABALA. Elle  vend ses fruits à SELINGUE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de fruits.
texts.en:
DANAYA is a group from the Benkadi association from Selinkegny. Its members are women who came together through family and neighbourhood connections. The women are, on average, 30 years old. They are married and have, on average, five children each. They run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of fruit as in the case of Nassou, who is the second person seated in the photograph from left to right.
They live in large traditional families in Selinkegny in Yanfolila district (the Sikasso region of the republic of Mali).

They have been traders for several years and are highly sought after for their trading in fruits, such as apples, oranges and bananas.

With a view to servicing the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program five years ago. They are on their seventh mutual loan.

Nassou, the group leader and very well known in Selinkegny, excels in fruit sales. She plans to use her loan to buy a significant quantity of various fruit (apple, orange and banana). She buys her stock from wholesalers in Selingue, Kangare and Dalabala, and retails her fruit in Selingue, for cash and credit, to both men and women. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA - an amount which will allow her to repay the loan and to invest the rest into her fruit trading business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia, con su conyugue y sus 4 menores hijos de edades 16, 15, 10, 05 de edad, de los cuales los dos primeros cursan secundaria y el otro primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Agapito vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Agapito se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivo de arroz el cual se encuentra en la etapa de almacigo de 10 dias. Ya además se dedica a la venta de frutas de estación como lima, naranja, piña, papaya entre otros, negocio se encuentra ubicado en caserio San Lorenzo – Pomahuaca, cuenta con 8 años dedicandose a este rubro, además se dedica a brindar servicios como transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, ya que cuenta con unidad propia, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningún problema.

El destino del crédito será para ivertir en los gastos de abono y mantenimiento de cultivo de arroz, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Agapito is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse and four children, aged 16, 15, 10 and 5 years old. The oldest two are in Secondary school and the third is in the National College of the district of Pucará. They have electricity and running water. Their district is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Agapito works in agriculture. He has a rice crop which will be ready for transplanting in 10 days. He also works selling fruit in season like limes, oranges, pineapple, papaya amongst others. This business is located in the village of San Lorenzo – Pomahuaca. He has been doing this for 8 years. Also he offers taxi service to passengers on his motorcycle. He has his own unit and this provides additional income that will allow him to pay the loan with no problem.

The loan will be used to invest in the expenses of fertilizer and maintaining his rice crop. He will generate greater income with this and will be able to improve his quality of living. He has no major competition in the area so he can get the best prices.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintain his rice crops.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Bekuö Group

texts.es:
Doris es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Bekuö, un grupo de mujeres indígenas de la Zona de Talamanca, que junto a 3 socias más, invertirán el crédito en actividades agrícolas. 
Ella tiene 37 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ambos estudiantes de secundaria,  pertenece a una familia de agricultores, que como la mayoría de las familias en la Reserva Indígena, trabajan la tierra para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Doris y su esposo siembran plátano, y con eso pueden solventar  los gastos del hogar, y los estudios de sus hijos. Esta es su quinta solicitud de crédito y los anteriores le permitieron mantener sus cosechas, y mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos para competir en un mercado más exigente, y vender su plátano a mejores precios.  El crédito es una nueva oportunidad para invertir en materia prima como; semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas, y cajas para el empaque del producto. 
Doris es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, que sabe que con mucho trabajo y dedicación podrá salir adelante, superarse, y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en el estudio, ya que ellos son su mayor orgullo.
texts.en:
Doris is one of the members of the Mujer Bekuö communal bank, a group of indigenous women from the Talamanca area. She and the 3 other members will invest the loan in agricultural work. She is 37 years old and is married with 2 children, who are both at secondary school. She comes from a family of farmers who, like most of the families in the Native Reserve, work the land to provide for their household.

Doris and her husband grow bananas and by doing this they are able to cover the household costs and their children's schooling. 

This is her fifth loan cycle. The previous loans helped her to maintain her crops and to improve the quality of her harvests in order to compete in an ever more demanding market and sell her bananas at a better price. The loan is a new opportunity to invest in supplies such as seed, fertilizers, insecticides, bags and boxes for packing the produce.

Doris is a very hard-working and responsible woman, who knows that with a lot of work and commitment she will be able to get on in life, improve herself, and keep supporting her children in their education, since they are her main source of pride.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seed, fertilizers, insecticides, bags and boxes for packing the produce.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Фаррух жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Фаррух со своей женой живут душа в душу, и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Его дети также очень любят и уважают своих родителей.

Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Фаррух занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении двух лет он занимается купля продажей сухофруктов и овощей. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Он перевозит на собственной грузовой машине урожай, который получил от своего дехканства в город на рынок для продажи. А также покупает на рынке другого вида овощи и сухофрукты и продаёт их в своём селе. Этот бизнес приносит ему постоянный хороший доход. И сейчас Фаррух хочет расширить свой бизнес, обустроить возле своего дома небольшой прилавок, где его жена будет продавать разнообразные овощи и сухофрукты. Поэтому он хочет взять кредит для закупа большого ассортимента овощей и сухофруктов. Для получения кредита он обратился в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Farrukh is a happy 34-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Farrukh and his wife are soul mates, who try to raise their children to be good people. His children love and respect their parents very much. Farrukh is involved in his own business to earn a living. He has been involved in reselling dried fruits and vegetables for two years. He was previously involved in dekhan farming and then decided to sell his own harvest. He transports the harvest, obtained from his farm, with his own truck to sell at a city market. He also buys other types of vegetables and dried fruits at a market and sells them in his village. This business yields him a good regular income. And now Farrukh wants to expand his business and build a small retail stall near his house, where his wife will sell different vegetables and dried fruits. This is why he wants to obtain a loan to buy a large selection of vegetables and dried fruits. He came to Arvand for the loan and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy a large selection of vegetables and dried fruits

loans.name: Layidou Group

texts.fr:
LAYIDOU est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de SATA qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités  vente dans le restaurant : viande et haricot. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
SATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de haricot et une quantité importante de viande pour leur restaurant.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
LAYIDOU is a group of the association BENKADI de TIELE. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 26 years of age. Married and having two children on average, they have different work, such as in food service, just like SATA, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in TIELE, in Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). They has been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their restaurant serving: meat and beans. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 

SATA, who is the group’s president, is well-known in TIELE. She excels in restaurant sales. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of beans and a significant amount of meat for their restaurant. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Her sales of food are made, cash or credit, to men and women customers in TIELE. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest the rest in her restaurant.

loans.use: to supply her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for her youngest daughter

loans.name: Condormocco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONDORMOCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos,mandarinas,papayas y naranjas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva estas frutas, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Condormocco”, which is located in the District of Echarate in La Convencion Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Francisca. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Francisca works at her business of selling fruit. She sells bananas, tangerines, papayas, and oranges. Francisca has a plot of land where she cultivates these fruits. She also has a stand at the market where she sells the fruit. Francisca works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the fruit. Francisca is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling coffee, selling fruit, managing a grocery store, and selling food.

Francisca is grateful to those who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza, a 42-year-old mother of seven lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She helps her husband manage their own rice farm, their main source of income. Farming is the main activity in their town. She joined Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed for a loan in order to cover weeding maintenance costs. She hopes that in the near future, she will be able expand her farm and to put up a cafeteria business in order to earn daily for the family.

loans.use: to cover weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Manuel albañil de 47 años de edad con una familia de 7 hijos los tres primero ya tienen familias separadas y los cuatro últimos son buenos estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 12 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo el lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida. La segunda actividad que el realiza es la compra y venta de abarrotería en la comunidad donde el vive.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio, y que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Sololá has the characteristic of being well populated with well constructed and modern houses made from very sophisticated materials.Social economic development has been a principal factor but also the labor provided by bricklayers and qualified builders like Manuel. He is 47 years old and has a family of 7 children. The oldest three have their own independent families and the other four are students at local schools.

The work he does is bricklaying. He has been doing this for 12 years and it has become a strong source of income for him and his family. He is very dedicated to his work and he does it in the most proper and quick way. His second economic activity is buying and selling groceries in his community

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase tools for bricklaying so he can do his work and do it faster and with more precision. One of his dreams as time rushes by is to become a master builder and teach his children the same trade so that his children can become professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools.

loans.name: Super Group

texts.fr:
SUPER est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant  à l’image de DJENEBA  qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités,  vente dans le restaurant : viande et haricot.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a 6 mois. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
DJENEBA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  TIELE, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une quantité importante de viande et 1 sac de haricot.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses viandes  à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femme.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 7.500FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité  vente dans le restaurant.
texts.en:
SUPER is a group of the association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 25 years of age. Married and having two children on average, they have different work, such as in food service, just like DJENEBA, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in TIELE, in Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in the restaurant business serving: meat and beans. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six months ago. They are now on their second solidarity loan. 

DJENEBA, who is the group’s president, is well-known in TIELE. She excels in restaurant sales. She intends to use her loan to purchase a significant amount of meat and a sack of beans. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Her sales of food are made retail, cash or credit, to men and women customers in TIELE. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest the rest in the restaurant business.

loans.use: to supply her restaurant

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que integran el grupo llamado Pyahu está en su ciclo número 7mo. Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza por medio de su trabajo que consiste en la venta ambulante, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, productos de mercería y demás.
Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "Pyahu" communal bank is made up of 19 woman and they are in their 7th cycle with the Woman's committee Program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Elimination survey which allows them to understand the situation of each member and work from there to improve themselves.

One of the members is Celia who in the last survey showed a level of two, which is to say a medium level. She has been improving her situation of poverty through her work which is itinerant selling and she is requesting this loan to by a variety of products for resale such as clothing, haberdashery products, etc. She is grateful to everyone for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell like clothing and haberdashery items, etc.

loans.name: Mukeni

texts.en:
Mukeni has been operating a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she runs a tailoring business. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and tailoring thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and tailoring thread for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Don miguel de 52 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, Don miguel se dedica a la venta de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 8 años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sacos de granos básicos así como muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus ventas y poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 52 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. His wife sells clothes and helps with the household expenses.

Don Miguel has been selling basic staples (corn and beans) for eight years. He has many customers because of the good prices and the quality of his products. Miguel is requesting a loan in order to buy more sacks of basic staples, such as those shown in the photograph, so that he can continue his sales. As a result, he and his wife can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is requesting a new loan to buy one more cow and fertilizer for her crops. Be's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Be hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is requesting a new loan to purchase better quality fertilizer for planting. Nam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Nam hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and thereby increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Gioi

texts.en:
Gioi is requesting a new loan to expand his business by buying more water valves and locks from different suppliers to satisfy his customers. 

Gioi's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers, and increasing his sales. 

He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more water valves and locks from different suppliers to satisfy his customers

loans.name: Jenifer Johanna

texts.es:
Los deseos de superación de Jenifer la llevaron a salir adelante y a convertirse en una mujer emprendedora, estableciendo una librería en su casa desde hace cuatro años, luego que sufriera un accidente junto con su esposo, quien este último no pudo seguir con sus actividades cotidianas. Esto la convirtió en una mujer más fuerte para tener el sustento de su familia y de su hijo, quien ahora tiene 9 años de edad y asiste al colegio. 
Jenifer, de 38 años de edad, es un ejemplo a seguir de mujeres emprendedoras, pues también es tutora de inglés, aprovechando sus conocimientos universitarios y así salir adelante. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertir más en su librería, comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, reglas, figuras geométricas, entre otros productos que le permitirán ofrecer variedad en su negocio y obtener más ganancias. En sus planes está mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ampliar el negocio y llegar a colocar un cibercafé.
texts.en:
The desire to improve herself has helped Jenifer get ahead, becoming an enterpreneurial woman.  She founded a stationery shop in her house four years ago, after she and her husband were in an accident.  Her husband has not been able to continue with his daily activities. This has made Jenifer a stronger woman, because of the need to provide for her family, including her son, who is  9 years old and attending school.  

Jenifer, 38 years old, is an example for enterprising women to follow, since she is also an English tutor, taking advantage of her college learning and thus getting ahead.   She is seeking a loan to invest more in her stationery shop, to buy notebooks, pens, markers, rules, geometric figures, among other items which will let her offer variety in her business and have larger earnings.  She plans to improve the condition of her house, broaden the business, and add a cybercafe.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, markers, rules, geometric figures, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, 51 and a mother of two, has been running a general store for over three years to make a living. 

She also has a farm, which is their main source of income. Her store helps her for their daily needs. 

She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

In the future, she wants to expand her business, and she hopes to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de OUMOU qui est la première personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).   
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités, d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, choux, tomate et oignon.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. 
OUMOU, qui  est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate et une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, choux et oignon).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
TIESSIRI is a group of the association BENKADI de TIELE. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 36 years of age. Married and having three children on average, they have different work, such as the buying and selling of condiments, just like OUMOU, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in TIELE, in Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in condiments:  black pepper, cabbage, tomatoes, and onions. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 

OUMOU, who is the group’s president, is well-known in TIELE. She excels in selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 baskets of tomatoes and a significant amount of different types of condiments (black pepper, cabbage, and onions). She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Her sales of condiments are made retail, cash or credit, to men and women customers in TIELE. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,00 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and to invest the rest in the buying and selling of condiments.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as cabbage, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Cam's Group

texts.en:
Cam is 31 years old and lives with her daughter and husband. Her husband works as a painter, in the local community. For the past three years Cam has been a baby-sitter, to earn an income to support her family. Cam is the leader of a six-member borrowing group, the members of which live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the second from the left, wearing a black coat. Each of the other group members is requesting a portion of this loan, to fund an income-generating activity.

Cam is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle, to use for travel to her workplaces. This will reduce her travel time and allow her to get more work, because she will be able to cover greater distances more quickly. She hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Liem

texts.en:
Liem is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, equipment and materials. Liem's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. 

Liem hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, which will enable him to attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, equipment and tools

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Luke, 19 years of age, honest, humble and a very hardworking person. He hails from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Luke is still single and has so much that he wants to achieve before starting a family; that is why he is focused and dreaming of being successful.

Luke never got the chance to go to college because of a lack of fees, but this never killed the zeal that he had for succeeding, and he started farming five years ago on a small plot of farmland that he inherited from his parents. Through hard work he has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming, and has managed to take care of his parents and also take care of his basic needs. Luke grows vegetables, fruits and keeps dairy cows as a source of income. Although Luke has been making profits, he is challenged by timely delivery of products to the market.  This has made his profits go down, because goods reach the market when they are not fresh and hence fetch lower prices. Luke comes from an area that has poor feeder roads and this has been a major problem to him. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 55,000 to buy a motorbike. 

With the motorbike, Luke will be able to transport his farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner, and hence it will fetch higher prices. Vegetables, fruits and milk are perishable products and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be of so much help. Through timely delivery of his product, Luke is sure of increased profits and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future. Luke is very ambitious and he is planning that once he has accumulated more profits, he will be able to go back to school.  Through education he will be able to have a more secure future, because education is “the key to success.”

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his products.

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Manh is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Manh's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers, and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Cay

texts.en:
Cay is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Martha Yilmeri

texts.es:
En el portón de la casa de Martha, cuelga desde hace mucho tiempo un rotulo que dice “se venden frijoles cocidos, queso y crema”, este ha sido el impulso en el crecimiento económico de esta comerciante de 27 años de edad. Con esto ella pudo ir ahorrando hasta iniciar con su negocio de venta de ropa usada, convirtiéndose este último es su principal fuente de ingresos en su hogar. Ella cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien es jubilado y le ayuda con el sustento de su hijo de cinco años.
Martha ahora tiene ocho años de vender ropa de segunda mano, lo que le ha permitido ser muy reconocida en su barrio. Sin embargo, a ella le gustaría expandirse por toda la capital para tener más clientes y por ende obtener mayores ingresos. De manera que quiere invertir más, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar ropa usada en grandes cantidades y así ofrecer distintos productos de calidad. En sus planes está situar una tortillería y mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
For a long time there has been a sign hanging on Martha's front door which says "cooked beans, cheese and cream for sale". This is what has driven economic growth for this 27-year-old saleswoman. By doing this she was able to keep on saving until she could set up her business selling second-hand clothing, making this her main source of income for her household. 

She gets financial support from her husband, who is retired and helps to provide for their five-year-old son. Martha has now been selling second-hand clothing for eight years, which has resulted in her becoming very well-known in her neighbourhood.

However, she would like to expand throughout the whole capital so she can have more customers and thus make more income. To do this she wants to invest more, and so she is asking for a loan to buy second-hand clothing in large quantities so she can offer different quality products. 

She also has plans to set up a business selling tortillas and to improve the conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Chore Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Chore Poty es un grupo que se formó a partir de las buenas experiencias de los grupos vecinos que las motivaron para conformar su comité. El grupo tiene 18 integrantes, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante e ir mejorando la zona de ellos, ya que son de un lugar bastante alejado de la zona céntrica del país.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser muy emprendedora es la Sra. Cintia, es peluquera, y montó su peluquería en su propia casa, hace muy lindos trabajos y tiene muchos clientes por el buen servicio que siempre hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser tintes, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “Chore Pote” is a group that was established as a result of the good experiences of neighboring groups, which motivated these members to start their own committee. This group has 18 members. Each one has put forth her best effort so that all of them can get ahead and help improve the area where they live, a place that is located a long distance from the central part of the country.

One of the members who is known for being very enterprising is Sra. Cintia. She is a beautician and set up her salon in her home. Cintia does beautiful work and has many clients because of the good service that she always provides. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of various supplies that will enable her to continue providing good service to her clients. These items include dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other products. As a result, she can continue her work in the same manner as before.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Artesanas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que tiene muchas expectativas, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que queda unos 60 Km. De la zona central de la ciudad y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Menchi es una de las integrantes, ella trabaja en la elaboración de artesanías, que después sale a vender y que con ese ingreso que se forma ayuda a su familia, para que tengan todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales varios para hacer sus artesanías, como maderas, telas y demás. Cada una de las integrantes agradece la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The "Las Artesanas" communal bank is in their first cycle of the Woman's Committee Program. It is a new group who have great expectations. It is in the city of Curuguaty which is an area where 60 km from the center of the city you still see growth.

Menchi is one of the members. She works making handicrafts which she then takes out to sell. With the income she makes she helps her family so that have have everything that she could not have, She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of materials to make her handicrafts, like wood, fabric, etc. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy wood, fabric and others to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Albert William

texts.es:
A las 4 am, Albert se levanta de la cama para prepararse para ir a su trabajo como guarda de seguridad. A las 6 am es la hora de entrada, lo que significa que tiene que estar listo lo más pronto posible. No obstante, el baño de su casa está muy descuidado, la ducha está dañada, el inodoro no está completo y el piso está en pésimas condiciones por lo que no cuenta con azulejos, de manera que le toca más tiempo de lo normal para alistarse. 
Albert es un joven de 31 años de edad, padre de tres hijos y esposo de una mujer que siempre lo ha apoyado en lo necesario. Actualmente está estudiando en la universidad, pues sueña con algún día tener un título para poder brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. Por el momento quiere empezar con algo pequeño, de manera que solicita un préstamo para construir un nuevo baño que garantice una excelente higiene para él y para su familia. Él es un hombre trabajador, con altos deseos de superación y con el sueño de llegar a ser un profesional que aporte a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Albert gets up at 4 a.m. to get ready to go to work. He works as a security guard. He begins at 6 a.m., that means he has to be ready as soon as possible. However, the home bathroom is not in good condition, the shower is damaged, the toilet is unfinished, and the floor is in awful conditions because doesn't have the tiles. So it takes him longer to get ready.

Albert is a 31 year old young man, he is the father of 3 kids, and the husband of a woman who has always supported him. 
Currently he attends college because his dream is to have a degree to offer his family a better life.

For now, he just wants to start with something small, so he is requesting a loan to build a new bathroom so he and his family can have excellent hygiene conditions.

He is a hard-working man, he desires to improve himself, and his dream is to become a professional so he can contribute to society.

loans.use: to build a new bathroom.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is married and has two children. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. To make a living, she helps her husband operating their own farm. She has been doing this work for many years and has been able to earn good income for the family. She has joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan, which she used to purchase farm fertilizer. She hopes to have a better income from their farm. She is determined to have it maintained.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Pili operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Pili dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.  With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business.

loans.name: Carmina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ABEJITAS DE PILCOPATA,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata ,provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Carminia tiene 39 años de edad es soltera y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia siembra lo que son maíz, papa entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y bono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmina is a member of the Communal Bank “Abejitas de Pilcopata” (The Little Bees of Pilcopata), which is located in the District of Kosñipata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco. She is 39 years old, single, and has five children. Carmina divides her time between her daily activities and farming. She has been in this business for years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Carmina grows corn, potatoes, and other crops. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Carmina is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. She appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOTALA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de SALI qui est la deuxième personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente dans le restaurant : viande, poisson et haricot.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
SALI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la  restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de viandes et poissons, et 2 sacs de haricot pour son restaurant. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits alimentaires à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir le reste dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The KOTOTALA group is part of the BENKADI association of TIELE. It consists of married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 29 years of age and three children each. They practice various activities including restaurant services as offered by SALI, standing 2nd from the left in the group photo. They live in large traditional families in TIELE, sub-prefecture of BAGUINEDA (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

They have been engaged in small trade for many years and they are in high demand for their restaurant services offering meat, fish and beans.

In an effort to meet their customers’ increasing demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution 3 years ago. This is their 5th group loan cycle.  

SALI, the group’s president, is well known around TIELE and highly skilled in her restaurant activity. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of meat and fish and 2 sacks of beans for her restaurant. She buys her stock in Bamako and from local wholesalers. She retails her food products in TIELE, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.    

Sali hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her restaurant activity.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of meat and fish and 2 sacks of beans for her restaurant.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Vivian has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vivian would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal items.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as the major challenges in her business. 

Janet appreciates the support of the previous loan and she is requesting 50,000 KES to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future

loans.use: to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arles Rene

texts.es:
El éxito llega con una dosis de esmero y dedicación, razón principal por la que Arles trabaja arduamente para lograrlo. Estudió secundaria completa y un técnico en computación, pero la falta de empleo en el área de informática lo llevo a buscar otro medio donde trabajar, lleva siete años trabajando en la bodega de una empresa, realizando cuentas de los productos que entran y salen.  Tiene 32 años, está casado y tiene un hijo, quién asiste a clases, puesto que anhela que sea un profesional.

Arles desea brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, por lo tanto solicita el crédito para construir las paredes del baño de su casa.  Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que está construido a base de madera, tablas y plástico, lo que llega a convertirse en un factor riesgo ya que en estaciones de lluvia los vientos llegan a ser muy fuertes y son capaces de derribar construcciones frágiles. Su meta próxima es brindarle un hogar digno a su familia y entre sus planes futuros esta llegar a ser un trabajador independiente y lograr establecer un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Success comes with a dose of care and dedication - the main reason that Arles works hard to achieve such success. He completed high school and received a degree as a computer technician, but the lack of jobs in information technology led him to seek other work. He spent seven years working in ca company warehouse, maintaining accounts of incoming and outgoing products. He is 32 years old, married, and has a son who is in school and wants to become a professional.

Arles wants to give his family a better life, which is why he is requesting a loan to build walls for his bathroom at home. He is relying on this loan, because his home is constructed of wood, boards, and plastic, which presents a risk factor, because in rainy seasons the winds become very strong and are capable of bringing down fragile constructions. His short-term goal is to provide a decent home for his family, and his future plans include becoming an independent worker and establishing his own business.

loans.use: to build walls for the bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Servio Rodhames

texts.es: Servío, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo, y reside en el Municipio de San Pedro Zacapa con su esposa, hijo y su madre.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y pesca. Hace dos años decidió comprar y vender pescado como ser tilapia roja y negra. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Ha solicitado anteriormente dos préstamos para su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 lempiras para comprar más pescado para abastecerse y aumentar las ventas. Su plan es conseguir un puesto fijo de venta de pescado.
texts.en:
Servío is 33 years old. He and his wife are in a common-law relationship and they have one child. Servío lives in the town of San Pedro Zacapa with his wife, his son, and his mother.

He has always worked in agriculture and fishing. Two years ago, Servío decided to buy and sell fish such as red and black tilapia. His sales are conducted as a street vendor. He requested two previous loans for his business, but now he is applying for another one in the amount of 20,000 HNL. Servío will buy more fish so that he can restock his business and increase his sales. His plan is to acquire a permanent location where he can sell fish.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and purchase educational equipment for her youngest son

loans.name: Xxxxxxx

texts.en: XXXX age 23, is married with one child who is 1 year old and not yet in school. He has a retail shop and has been running his business for the past four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, soap, sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pedigree cow

loans.name: Eliabh

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Eliabh, a very hardworking and honest man who decided that he would be independent and contribute to his community by starting dairy farming in Eldoret, Kenya. Deciding what kind of farming he will do was not difficult. “I was brought up with dairy cows raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Eliabh said. “It is in my blood.” He passionately loves dairy farming and has been practicing it for the past 10 years. He has never regretted starting to farm. His primary source of income is milk, eggs, and crop farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. 

He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village.
