Profits from milk sales have enabled him to take care of his family and he has always yearned to produce more dairy milk. The major challenge he faces is feeding his cows. He is requesting a loan to buy a chaff-cutter. A chaff-cutter is a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed the cattle. Through the loan his cows will be aided in digestion and they will never reject any part of the food. Eliabh strongly believes that through proper feeding of the cows he will reap more and it will lead to increased milk production which will translate into more sales and a better income. 

Through this loan, Eliabh’s life is going to change permanently. Because of this high milk production potential, he will save more money to fully repay the loan. He believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping his dairy cows, he will have more income, which will improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a chaff-cutter.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en: Nzara thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support of the previous loan that has helped her to boost her business, and her business is going on well. She has managed to save money and she comes to you again for another loan of KES 50,000 to add to her savings and to buy another motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam has operated a shoe selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.  With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales shoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of five children, four of whom still attend school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, Mwanamisi  has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Mwanamisi is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fishing net for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy fishing nets

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Ann has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan she is requesting, Ann wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mveni

texts.en:
Mveni is a single mother of two children. She lives at a family house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food-stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a hard-working lady who is struggling to make ends meet and provide for her family. She appreciates the support from the previous loan and she comes to you again, requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy three sacks of groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of groundnuts for sale..

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 35,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition fees and purchase educational materials for her oldest son

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simon, 36, is an ambitious, hardworking smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kericho, Kenya. The climate here greatly favours high-altitude cash crops and dairy farming which he is involved in. He also keeps poultry for eggs and grows vegetables for both consumption and sales. The income he makes from farming is not sufficient to sustain his family of 3 children. This has forced Simon to look for other sources of income which include a salary-paying job and other personal business interests he has invested in. 

Simon is seeking a loan to purchase farmstead equipment. He spends most of his time doing ‘General farm work', as he put it. His biggest challenge is unfavourable tools. 

Poor farmers in Africa usually do not have the right tools for their work. This makes working on the farm increasingly longer and harder. Your loan will help to improve farm machinery hence indirectly protect the investments that farmers make in the farm. The new modern farm tools you are financing help farmers to have confidence in the quality, reliability and safety of the implements they employ. Your loan will help Simon to acquire tools that are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. You will have also helped his family's health since there are health implications of using traditional ineffective tools.

When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?” Simon replied, “Increased food security in my household.”

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Yanetha

texts.en:
Yanetha is a 52-year-old woman who is married to Adulrahim, a 61-year-old man. From their marriage they are blessed with 10 children. They are: Dewi, 32; Ronald, 30; Yani, 26 - the three of them are married; Andris, 23; Darwin, 22 - both of them are workers; Bertha, 20, a college student; Ira, 18, who has just graduated from high school; Alfia, 17, a 2nd grade vocational high school student; Lorens, 12, a junior high school student in her first year, and the last one is Vito, 11, a 5th grade elementary student. 

Yanetha used to have a business as a kerosene reseller, but the business stopped because she has to nurse her mother who is sick. Her husband is a tailor. Today, Yanetha helps her husband in running the business. They wish to produce school uniforms and offer them to the schools but they are lacking the money to do so. Therefore they proposed an individual loan from TLM of an amount of IDR 4,000,000. The loan is spent to purchase the fabrics, threads, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years old and married to Karisa.  They are blessed with seven school-going children.  Agnes has been running a beauty salon and at the same times practices crop farming for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of KES30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
Agnes has applied for her third loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to buy a blow dryer and also buy maize and beans seedlings for planting.                                                                                           

Agnes will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and seedlings

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 67 años de edad, vive al lado de su conyuge sus hijos son separados del hogar pero viven cerca al caserio, Julio vive en casa propia de material rustico, en una comunidad pequeña de 10 familias, él se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su comunidad, es natural del Caserío Viza del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo. Julio vive en la parte rural del Caserío Viza, contando con servicios de agua, dicho caserio está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza julio es la cría y comercialización de animales menores(patos, gallinas cuyes), los que cría en el corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, en el Sector la Muyuna Caserío Viza del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a esta actividad hace 50 años y hace 10 años cultiva una haz de maíz, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, sus animales los comercializa todos los jueves y domingos que es dia de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, donde se reúnen criadores, compradores de todo el distrito y sus caseríos, donde Julio oferta sus productos y animales. El destino del crédito será para compra de gallinas y patos, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 67 years old and lives with his wife. His children no longer live at home, but they reside in a village nearby. Julio owns a house made of basic materials and it is located in a small community that contains 10 families. He gets along well with all of the members of his community. Julio is a native of the Viza village in the District of Santo Tomas de Cutervo. He lives in the rural section of the Viza village, which receives running water. His village is located in the District of Santo Tomas in Cutervo Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Julio raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. He raises them in a pen that is located behind his house in the Muyuna neighborhood of the village of Viza in the District of Santo Tomas de Cutervo. He has been in this business for 50 years and for the past 10 years he has been cultivating one hectare of corn. Julio has plenty of experience in this type of work. His animals are sold every Thursday and Sunday at a plaza in the District of Santo Tomas de Cutervo. There he meets with breeders and buyers from all over the district and from several villages. These are the people to whom Julio offers his products and animals.

This loan will be used to buy chickens and ducks, which will help Julio generate more income. As a result, he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks to sell.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.en:
Florentine is aged 35. She is married with 5 children aged between 11 and one year; four of them go school. 

She sells sorghum and has been selling for the past 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and water. 

For the past three years, Jane has operated an agricultural business.  She sells her produce from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge in disease outbreaks leading to losses.  She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000 Agnes wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Scolasicah

texts.en:
Scolasicah operates a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes hard to operate her business. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With this KSH 15,000 loan, Scolasicah wants to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: service her motorcycle

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children aged between 19 and 6 years.  All of them are going to school. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past 6 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more shirts and shorts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a married mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Milly has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With this loan that she is requesting for KES 30,000 Milly wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Heladio

texts.en:
Heladio and his family arrived to their community located in Oaxaca, Mexico 6 years ago with the intention to have a better place to live.

Heladio is a man of 45 years old. He works as a mason and every day is a long day´s work.
 
His 40 year-old wife, Cirenia sells tamales every night in order to get an extra- income.  A tamal is a traditional Mexican dish made of corn masa, which is steamed in a leaf wrapper and can be filled with meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, chilies or any preparation according to taste.

This family faces many problems living in the present house:
Overcrowding conditions. Heladio and Cirenia have 2 boys and 1 girl: Ariel (24), Jonathan (15), and Berenice (13). The entire family shares the only room which functions as a bedroom and kitchen and teenagers do not have privacy. 

Regarding the infrastructure of the house, the rain affects their belongings because the roof has a lot of leaks and everything gets wet. IT doesn´t helping to keep them warm and safe.  

Ariel, the oldest son works in a company of serigraphy. In his free time he supports his dad doing construction activities. Jonathan works in a grocery store and loves playing soccer in his free time. Berenice the “baby girl” of the family goes to school; she enjoys studying a lot and helps her mother with some chores. 

A new house will mark a big difference for this family. Heladio and Celenia wish the best possible future for their kids. They want to give them all they could not have when they were children and for this reason they would like to take the opportunity that Habitat for Humanity Mexico is offering to thier family.
Heladio wants to accomplish his family´s dream: have an adequate and safer house with proper rooms for everyone.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Maa Chemedei Group

texts.en:
Kanchanbala is the leader of a group who lives in Pallaspali, Bhubaneswar in the district of Khurdha, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 39 years. She has a small family comprising of 4 members: her husband, one son aged 19 and one daughter of 14 years. The member standing 1st from right with a raised hand is Kanchanbala. 

Like most families in the village she along with her husband is doing tailoring work to earn their livelihood. They sew pants, shirts, ladies dress, blouses etc. Their monthly income is about INR 7,000 which is not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses.

Her son, who is named Sandip, is pursuing Civil Engineering in GIET, Bhubaneswar. He is a good student and wants to complete his Engineering Course but due to lack of money he is not in a position to continue his studies. So that her son can continue his studies, Kanchanbala wants a loan of INR 30,000. Your help will enable Sandip to continue his studies - he has a desire to be a good Civil Engineer.

The other 3 members of her group are  Manjulata, Sanjukta and Santilata.

loans.use: to pay the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Susant

texts.en:
Susant is a 30-year-old differently-abled man living with his parents, wife and a two-year-old child in a small village in the Ganjam district of Odisha, India. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. He is engaged in the dairy business. His father helps him in this business. Currently, he has four cows. He sells the milk to the milk vendor and earns 4,000 INR per month. Now he has a plan to purchase two more cows so that he can sell more milk.

Susant has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase two more cows for his milk business. He has a dream of making a beautiful house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase two more cows for his milk business

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Group

texts.en:
Nalini is the leader of a group that lives in Bhagabati Pada of Sagarpali village of Tarbha in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 22 years. She has a small family comprised of four members: her husband, herself, one son, and one daughter, aged 3 and 10 years respectively. The member sitting first  from left with raised hand  on the first row is Nalini. 

Like most families in the locality she and her husband are doing weaving work in their house and prepare saris and sell them in the market.  Her husband helps her in procuring thread  from the nearby market.  This  is the first loan she wants to take. 

To improve her living condition and earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. To avail the loan, she makes a group of 14 women of her locality but later on one member(sitting in the 2nd row, 1st from right wearing blue sari) did not want to avail the loan. So, rest 13 members constituted a group and avail loan.At present her monthly income is INR 2,700 from her business and INR 2,300 from daily labour which comes to INR 5,000 which is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase bulk quantity of yarn for preparation of saris.  She has a cherished dream to increase her productivity and educate her children in school.

The other 12 members are Sabitri, Jajnaseni, Banita, Kumari, Gurubari, Sunaphula, Manjulata, Jashabanti, Sandhyarani, Sebati, Ratnabati, and Sebati doing separate businesses.

loans.use: PURCHASE YEARN

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Сафарали проживает вместе с женой и детьми в городе Душанбе. У него двое сыновей и двое дочерей. В свои пятьдесят восемь лет он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Сафарали арендует место в мастерской по техническому обслуживанию автомашин. Он работоспособный, ответственный и толковый мужчина. В мастерской он работает мастером по ремонту автомашин. Работу свою Сафарали делает оперативно так как у него имеется богатый опыт в этой сфере. 
В настоящий момент Сафарали необходимо оборудование, подъемник, так как со временем техника модернизируется и без помощи компьютерной технологии не как нельзя продвинуться самому. Он берет подъемник для сына. Его сын работает в мастерской рядом с ним. У Сафарали есть деньги но их не хватает для приобретения необходимого оборудования. Сафарали хочет поддержать сына в месте с вашей поддержкой.
texts.en:
Safarali lives with his wife and children in the city of Dushanbe.  He is the father of two sons and two daughters.  At age 58, he is involved in car repair.  He rents a space in a car maintenance warehouse. He is a hardworking, responsible and intelligent man.  As a master mechanic, he works very efficiently and he has a wealth of experience in his field.

At the moment, Safarali needs to buy some equipment, such as a hoist.  Technology is changing over time, and without the help of modern computerized equipment, it has become impossible to move forward.  Safarali is requesting a hoist for his son who is also working as a master mechanic alongside him.  Safarali has some money, but not enough to buy the necessary equipment.  He is looking forward to your support, which will in turn help his son.

loans.use: to purchase some equipment, so that he and his son can continue to be involved in the activity that they love.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room for his children.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 32 years old. She is married, with four children aged between 11 and four years. Three of them go to school. 

Clementine has a shop and she has been running the business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 28 years old and married, is from the village of Mukhati. She lives with her husband and two school-aged sons. Her husband works as a rescuer and has a fixed salary of 400 GEL monthly. In spite of her high education, Irma was unavailable to start any job, so she decided to be involved in her own business and do her bit for the family's welfare. After several unsuccessful attempts, Irma applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses. So, Irma plans to purchase a stock of cosmetics at wholesale prices and sell them in her community at increased prices.
 
With the help of this business, Irma will be able to have her own money and provide financial stability for her family. She hopes that in the future, she will be capable of expanding her trading business and open her own store that will cover almost all of her customers' needs.

Irma and her family rely on the good will of lenders and will greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dormitory fees.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза в первую очередь хотела бы поблагодарить МДО Арванд и Кива кредиторам за поддержку и в исполнении заветной мечты ее сына. Дилфуза давно хотела приобрести сыну компьютер для учебы, чтобы ее сын полноценно осваивал все школьные предметы. Дилфуза сама работает в школе и знает что сегодняшнее время обучение без компьютера тяжело, многие предметы связаны с компьютером не смотря на то, что они живут в селе. Дилфуза мать двоих детей. У нее дружная семья. Муж Дилфузы Тохир работает мастером. Он ремонтирует дома, кроме этого дополнительно дома выращивает мелко рогатых скатов. Дилфуза и Тохир мечтают, чтобы их дети жили в достатке, а главное, чтобы своевременно получали образование. Ради этого они упорно трудятся, и стараются предоставить все  необходимое для получения хорошего образования.
texts.en: Dilfuza wants to first thank MDO Arvand and Kiva lenders for the support in realizing her son cherished dream. Dilfuza has been wanting to buy her son a computer for school studies for a long time, so that her son could fully understand all of school lessons. Dilfuza works at a school herself and knows that education without a computer is difficult nowadays with many lessons tied to computers, despite the fact that they live in a village. Dilfuza is a mother of two children. She has a friendly family. Dilfuza's husband, Tohit, works as a repairman. He repairs houses and, in addition, raises small livestock. Dilfuza and Tohit dream for their children to live in wealth, but primarily to get a timely education. They work hard for this and try to provide everything necessary for them to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her son

loans.name: Yessica Yesenia

texts.es: Yessica: Es una joven sociable y trabajadora, tienes 28 años de edad. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera y comprar materiales: madera cepillada, rustica y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto con las condiciones necesaria.
texts.en: Yessica is a sociable and hardworking young girl. She is 28 years old. She is requesting a loan to improve her wooden stilt house and buy materials: planed and rustic timber; and to pay for labor costs. Her dream is to build her house in concrete, with all necessary conditions.

loans.use: to improve her wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has five children. Two of her children are grown-ups, and three of them are still at school. She has been running a genge-duka business for four years, now. ["Genge" means a fruit/vegetable stand, and "duka" means a small store, in Swahili.] She works from 6:00AM to 10:00PM daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaid's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to grow her genge-duka, which is now big. She has paid back all her loans, successfully. She is happy with the loans, and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profits to pay school fees, to save in her bank account, to build her own house, and to cover household expenses. She will use this new loan to buy sacks of Irish potatoes to resell, using buckets, to low-class customers. She dreams of improving family affairs.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her borrowing group, Kulangwa, which is comprised of six members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of Irish potatoes to resell to her customers

loans.name: Sembaruthi Shg - Chinnakulam Group

texts.en:
Sembaruthi Shg (Self-Help Group) is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). This NGO helps people improve their livelihood in Tamil Nadu.     
 
Achikannu (pictured with her hand raised) is the leader of the group, which consists of 13 members. She lives in Chinnakulam village, Trichy district, in her own house with her husband and a child. Her husband is a farmer. 

Achikannu has been taking loans for the last five years and has repaid the loans on time.

Achikannu wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt., Ltd. Its cost is 1,400 INR. It is designed for daily use. The traditional stoves produce more smoke and are called kitchen killers. The smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide and prevents household risk. It also promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

Achikannu and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to give a healthier life to their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 44 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 20 and 7 years old; all of them go to school. 

He sells vegetables and has been selling as his business for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more vegetables for sale.  

The profits from the business will be used to buy goats and provide for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
Thim is living in Kampong Speu province. She is 61 years old and a mother of nine children. To support her family, she grows rice as her sole source of income and she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first time for Thim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is leading her group of three to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can improve her family's living in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Central Palestina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL PALESTINA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tomates, venta de comida, venta de ropa, tejido de chompas, costura de deportivos, tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, compra de material de reciclaje.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución que fueron a su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al apoyar a su madrina, quien tenía el mismo negocio; con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente en cercanía a su domicilio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chuño y mote por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CENTRAL PALESTINA" will begin its first cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan American Focal Center. The group consists of nine members and is headed by a board of which Leandra is President. The group members' businesses are varied, and include: selling tomatoes, selling food, selling clothes, knitting sweaters, sewing sportswear, blanket weaving, sewing jackets, and purchasing recycled materials. 

The loan the group is requesting will benefit small businesses that Leandra takes part in. She says that this is the first time they are working with Pro Mujer, having joining through the invitation of a campaign that came to the area, promoting the institution. Leandra currently has a business selling food. She learned this business several years ago by helping her godmother, who worked in the same industry. With time, she decided to open her own independent business close to home. 
 
The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy starch and boiled corn wholesale, from the wholesaler selling fairs in El Alto, which she would then sell. This work would allow her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy starch and corn wholesale.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Гавхар в возрасте 44 лет начинает новый бизнес. В течение 2 лет она работала продавщицей в магазине мужской одежды. Однако это было не ее. Ее всегда интересовала выпечка. И вот недавно она успешно окончила краткосрочные курсы по выпечке и получила сертификат. Гавхар теперь собирается заняться производством булочных изделий. Она накопила сбережение в размере около 500 долларов. Еще она просит в кредит 2000 долларов США. На свои сбережения она купит ингредиенты, а на сумму кредита большую духовку со столом. Гавхар будет заниматься выпечкой у себя дома, она уже составила свой бизнес план. Согласно ему Гавхар в день будет производить по 300 булочек и сдавать их в столовую школы своего города Худжанд для школьников. В бизнесе ей конечно будут помогать муж и единственный сын. Муж Гавхара является дехканином., а сын работает в детском развлекательном комплексе простым рабочим.
Благодаря новому прибыльному бизнесу, Гавхар принесет в семью дополнительный источник дохода, что улучшит уровень их жизни.
texts.en: Gavhar is 44 years old and starting a new business. She worked as a salesperson at a men's clothing store for 2 years, however it was not for her. She was always interested in baking. She recently successfully completed baking classes and obtained a certificate. Gavhar is now planning to get involved in preparing baked goods. She saved approximately 500 dollars. She is also requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars. She will use her savings to buy ingredients, and the loan amount to buy a large oven and a table. Gavhar will be involved in baking at home; she has already created her business plan. According to it, Gavhar will be producing 300 buns and sell them to a school cafeteria in her town of Khujand for school children. Her husband and only son will help her with the business. Gavhar's husband is a dekhan farmer, and son works at a children's entertainment center. Thanks to the new profitable business, Gavhar will bring an additional source of income for her family, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large oven and a table to start a baking business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for her water production business.

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en: Jean Nepo is 42 years old. He is married and has six children between 19 years old and 2 months old. Five of them go to school. He has a shop and has been working in this business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more products for his shop, such as sugar, salt and biscuits. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to buy food for his children.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as sugar, salt, biscuits for his shop

loans.name: Rusaaka Mirembe Group

texts.en:
Angella is a member of Rusaaka Mirembe group. She is 40 years old and married, with three children who are school-going. Angella operates a business of charcoal - both wholesale and retail - which is located in Makindye, a city surbub, and has been in business for the last two years. Her husband saved some money for her to begin a business since sitting at home would not help the family and they needed some income to supplement the salary of her husband

Angella has hopes of expanding her business such that it becomes big. She approached UGAFODE for a loan of 500,000 shillings through the group to buy more charcoal to add to her business. Angella is hard working. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Diana has been working hard to manage her poultry, which produce broilers and eggs. 

To help expand her business, Diana has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken food, and will help Diana to generate greater profits and increase monthly income. Diana hopes that, in the future, she will be able to increase the number of birds. 

Diana is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Diana who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food for her chickens

loans.name: Agustine

texts.en:
Agustine is a single man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells printing papers, flash disks, memory cards and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough products.

He will use the 99,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of flash disks, memory cards and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flash disks, memory cards and other items

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 25 years old and married with one child who is 4 years old and not yet in school. He has been running a shop for the past eight years.  With the loan, he would like to buy more cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nyirandikubwiman

texts.en:
Nyirandikubwimana is 27 years old. She is married with two children aged between 4 and 13, both of whom go to school. She has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to rearing modern cows.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for and protect her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 28 years old. He is married with 2 children, between 2 and 4 years old, who do not yet go to school. He sells clothes, and has been in a business for 16 years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freshlife toilet

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre de 34 años de edad, soltero, padre de dos hijos y su negocio es la carpintería.
Él es emprendedor, dedicado, buen padre, honesto, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Plan 3000 un sitio caracterizado por la creciente producción de manufactura en todas las áreas y también por su clima cálido y húmedo.
Alex es de tez morena estatura mediana, complexión delgada, su lengua materna es el español. Él se dedica a la fabricación de puertas y ventanas, también realiza sillas y taburetes. Su necesidad constante de la compra de madera lo ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo para comprar por mayor y ahorra en gastos de transporte y tiempo. Su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela secundaria y su sueño es tener su negocio propio donde pueda exponer a la venta todo tipo de muebles para el hogar.
Es por esos motivos que Alex solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera y con los beneficios continuar pagando los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alex is a 34 year old man, who is single and the father of two children. He works in carpentry.  

He is entrepreneurial, dedicated, a good father, honest, responsible, and hard working. He works in the Plan 3000 zone, a place characterized by its growing manufacturing and production in all areas, and also for it's hot and humid climate. 

Alex is of tan complexion, medium height, slim, and speaks Spanish. He works manufacturing doors and windows, and he also makes chairs and stools. His constant need to buy wood has brought him to ask for a loan to purchase more of it, and to thus save on transport costs and time.

He shares his life with his two children who are in secondary school, and his dream is to have his own business where he could sell all types of home furniture. 

It is for these reasons that Alex has asked for a loan to purchase wood and to continue to pay his children's expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood, and to continue paying for his children's expenses.

loans.name: Mutumia Mwireri Group

texts.en:
The person in the photo with her hand raised is Mary; a member of Mutumia Mwireri Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She is married and blessed with four children. 
Mary operates a general kiosk selling mangoes, tomatoes, bananas, onions and vegetables. She is borrowing money to expand her enterprise by adding to her stock of mangoes, tomatoes, bananas, onions and vegetables. This will enable her to meet the rising demand of her customers. She believes her income will increase and go a long way in supporting her kids' education.
Mary appreciates Kiva for the financial help.

loans.use: To buy additional mangoes, tomatoes, bananas, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 39-year-old man, married to Joyce, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Daniel has been operating a retail business shop for 10 years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Daniel is servicing his seventh loan of 67,500 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional  stock of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, detergents, rice, and sugar to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Daniel plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees to his children, and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, detergents and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sunshine Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret; a member of Sunshine Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She lives with her husband.
She earns her living by operating a green grocer kiosk where she sells tomatoes, mangoes, bananas, onions and other vegetables. She uses the skills on enterprise development trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to manage her business. She is borrowing money to expand her enterprise by buying more tomatoes, mangoes, bananas, onions and other vegetables. This is because the demand for the products is high. She believes this will give her more income which will in turn help pay her children's school fees.
Margaret is very grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more  tomatoes, mangoes, bananas,onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 8. One of them goes to school.

She has been selling sorghum for 1 year. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labour to help with her coffee crops

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Alice, a member of Emmanuel Women Group. She is 39 years old and blessed with two children. 
She does potato farming. She has benefited from training courses provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise creation and financial management. She is borrowing a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs such as certified planting seeds to boost the crop yield. This will enable her to increase her sales and earn more income. She hopes to meet her family's needs such as food and education without much struggle.
Alice is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wires, switches, cables, and a circuit breaker to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Alba Estela

texts.es: Alba de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, apoyada por su compañero de vida que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad, y en su trabajo de prestación de servicios domésticos en una empresa cercana a su domicilio. Alba se siente feliz con el trabajo con el que ahora cuenta ya que este le esta permitiendo mejorar un poco su vivienda, por lo que actualmente desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia encementando el piso de su vivienda ya que es de tierra lo que causa focos de infección y enfermedades de índole respiratorio, por lo que ella al no contar con los fondos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba is 38 years old and lives in her own humble house with her husband and family. She is a woman who strives every day to advance her family, aided by her husband, who earns his living as a security guard, and by doing domestic services for an enterprise near her domicile. 

Alba is happy with the work she currently has, since it permits her to improve her life a little. For that reason, she now wishes to better her condition of life and that of her family by building a cement floor in her house. The current floor is dirt, which creates sources of infection and illnesses of the respiratory system. 

Since she lacks the necessary funds, Alba is soliciting a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel, and to hire laborers to build a cement floor in her home.

loans.use: invest in cement, sand, gravel, and laborers to install a cement floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old and is married to Alfiah, a 58-year-old woman. They have two adopted daughters: Lis, 33 years old, and Ulfa, 29 years old. Both of their daughters are laborers. Daniel has been running the business of Ojek (motorcycle taxi driver) since early 2000. In addition, he has been working as a non-permanent employee of Kupang City Sanitation Department, since 2005. He still works as a motorcycle taxi driver after work, or in the evening, when there are customers who need his service. His wife has her own business, producing “Rempeyek.” Rempeyek is a savory, deep-fried Javanese cracker made of flour (usually rice flour) and other ingredients, coated by crispy batter or peanut brittle. The Rempeyek snack is sold to the owners of kiosks and food stalls near their residence.

Considering his wife’s business opportunity, which is quite good, Daniel wants to help his wife to be able to produce more kinds of snacks. Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital to do so. Therefore, he applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on equipment, such as a pasta machine and a mixer, and some ingredients with which to produce the snacks. He hopes that the business will run well enough to enable him and his wife to pay back the loan, and increase their income to meet their family's needs.

loans.use: to buy equipment, such as a pasta machine and a mixer, and some ingredients with which to produce more snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón por su tenacidad y el empeño que pone para sacar adelante a su familia apoyado en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual realiza desde hace tiempo en su vivienda. Isaías siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia ha iniciado con la construcción de su vivienda a base de bloques de cemento, pero el presupuesto con el que contaba, no fue suficiente por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, polines, pines y laminas para terminar de construir su vivienda y así evitar la perdida de la inversión realizada anteriormente.
texts.en:
Isaías is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their family. He is well-known in his canton for his tenacity and the effort that he puts forth to move his family forward. He owns a small general store, which he has run out of his home for a long time. 

Isaías always looks for the best for his family, so he has begun to build a new home made of cement blocks. However, the budget that he started with wasn't enough, so he has requested a loan from FUSAI. He will invest the funds in cement, sand, gravel, cords, prongs, and sheet metal to finish building his home and avoid losing his initial investment.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, cords, prongs, and sheet metal to finish building his home.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 36 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 2 and 14 years, and 5 of them go to school. 

She sells shoes and has been selling in a business for the past 7 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar apoyada en su tienda, la cual instalo en su vivienda desde hace mas de 14 años y en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad como: papel higiénico, jabón, detergente, arroz, azúcar, pan dulce, etc. La vivienda de María se encuentra a medio construir ya que el presupuesto con el que contaba no alcanzo, por lo que ella necesita terminar de construir lo antes posible, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their 17 year old son. Thanks to her efforts and tenacity, she has been able to help her husband with the household finances by working in her store. Her store has been located in her home for more than 14 years and sells many general products like toilet paper, soap, detergent, rice, sugar, baked goods, etc.

María's home is only half complete because her initial budget was not sufficient. She needs to finish construction as soon as possible, so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building her home.

loans.name: Abuzuzanya Cb Group

texts.en:
Abuzuzanya is a group led by Egidia, who is 39 years old. The group name means "who works hand in hand" in English. She has been a group leader for the past 12 years. She sells foodstuffs, and the group members sell different items. They all believe they will improve their businesses through the loan. 

With the loan, Egidia would like to buy more foodstuffs such as cassava and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business so that she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is 30 years old. He is not married. 

He sells foodstuffs and has been working in this business for the past 6 years. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more bananas and cassava for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve his business and help him to reinvest in this same business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 65 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, ya que cuenta con gran experiencia en la confección de camisas, pantalones y short. Actualmente,  José vive con su esposa la conoció hace más de treinta años y junto a ella procrearon  5 hijos, de los cuales 1 vive aun con ellos que es madre soltera. 

José se dedica a la creación de camisas, pantalones, blusas y short. Además hace los uniformes para los estudiantes de distintos  centros escolares, donde su esposa es la que le ayuda a realizar los trabajos del hogar. 

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materia prima  en la elaboración de uniformes como  lo son: Tela, botones, zipers, hilo, agujas, ya que el Gobierno le ha dado la oportunidad que siga trabajando en la realización de los uniformes escolares.

En un futuro José quiere extender un poco más su negocio, ya que el espacio es muy reducido y le es difícil trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is a very hard-working man, as he has a lot of experience making shirts, trousers and shorts. Currently he lives with his wife whom he met over 30 years ago, and together they have produced 5 children. One of the children, who is a single mother, still lives with them.

José makes a living producing shirts, trousers, blouses and shorts. He also makes uniforms for the pupils in different schools, while his wife helps out by doing the housework.

The loan will be used to buy materials for making uniforms such as fabric, buttons, zips, thread and needles, since the Government has given him the opportunity to continue his work producing school uniforms. 

In the future José wants to extend his business a bit more, since the space is very confined and it is difficult for him to work in peace.

loans.use: to buy materials for making uniforms such as fabric, buttons, zips, thread and needles.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Fareeda is a 47-year-old married mother of six children. She has been in the business of manufacturing footballs for the past 10 years. She is contributing much to the family income through her work, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. She provides her family with good quality food, education, health care and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees). The amount will be used to purchase thread, needles, rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity.  She expects a boost in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity.

loans.name: Magha Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Edith. She is a member of Magha Women Group in Limuru. She is forty-five years old, married and the mother of three children. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings which have helped her realize her strength in business. She is engaged in a full-time business of vegetable farming and distributing the produce to the nearby market.She wants a loan to buy more manure for the crops since demand for produce is now high. This will help improve their productivity; hence more supply. She believes this will increase her profits. This will help support her children’s education by paying school fees and provide better clothing for them. 

Edith is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking Mudzi District, Zimbabwe resident who has been successfully running a grocery store for the past year and a half. When Rebecca is not selling cooking oil, sugar, drinks, and salt at her store, she spends her time volunteering as a Camfed Learner at the local secondary school. With the Kiva loan, Rebecca intends to purchase more groceries to sell. With the increased profits, Rebecca will pay the school fees for her young children.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is a hardworking woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her charcoal business. 

Joweria has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of charcoal, and will help her generate greater profits and expand her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her customer base. 

Joweria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in iron bars and workers to install them in the windows of his home.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association FABOLONA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente dans le restaurant à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la deuxième personne  debout  de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA, préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente dans le restaurant : riz, viande, oignon, choux et huile. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différente sorte (viande, oignon, choux et huile) pour leur restaurant.  Elle s’approvisionne à DANGASSA et environnant auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité d’achat vente dans le restaurant.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a [borrowers’] group belonging to the Fabolona association of Dangassa. The group is composed of women who know each other as relatives or neighbors. On the average, they are 25 years old, with three children on the average. They are engaged in various business activities such as running a diner, which is the case of Fatoumata, for example. She is the second person standing from left to right in the photo. They live in traditional extended families in Dangassa in the region of Kourouba, Kati Prefecture (Koulikoro Region of Mali).

They have been working as vendors for some years and have great demand for their cooked dishes [made with] rice, meat, onions, cabbage and oil. 
With the goal of meeting growing customer demand, four years ago the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their seventh solidarity loan. Fatoumata, who is the group’s leader and well known in Dangassa, excels at selling cooked dishes. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of rice and a large quality of various food condiments (meat, onion, cabbage and oil) for her diner. She stocks up in Dangassa and nearby, with the local wholesaler, and sells her food in Dangassa, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 60,000 West African francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments.

loans.name: Hasfah Nabagulanyi's Group

texts.en:
Hasfah's Group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Hasfah is 20 years old, and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Hasfah has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Hasfah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items for the saloon, and will help Hasfah to generate greater profits and boost the business. Hasfah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a second salon. 

Hasfah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase items for the salon

loans.name: Erika Celeste

texts.es:
Erika es una joven soltera de 22 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como Auxiliar Contable en una gran empresa de su ciudad natal, Chiclayo. Su ética de trabajo comprometido es el resultado de los valores inculcados en ella por sus padres. Cada día Erika despierta con la motivación de sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza cada vez más.
Debido a los deseos que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, piensa utilizar este préstamos para poder comprar una refrigeradora para su casa, con esto sus comidas estarán en mejor estado por más tiempo. Erika está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que gracias a esta ayuda su familia vivirá mejor y sin preocupaciones ella seguirá trabajando para más adelante poder emprender un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Erika, age 22, is a single young woman who has tremendous drive to succeed. She works as an assistant bookkeeper for a large company in her hometown of Chiclayo. Her committed work ethic is a product of the values that were instilled in her by her parents. Each day Erika wakes up motivated to move forward on behalf of her family. For this reason, she is always willing to try harder.

Erika wants to improve her family’s quality of life, so she plans to use this loan in order to buy a refrigerator for her house. This will enable her to keep her food in better condition for a longer period of time. Erika is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants to thank them for helping her family live better and without any worries. Erika will continue to work so that she can start her own business sometime later.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for storing her food.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has run a retail business in the town of Tala for 6 years now. He is a 28 years old married man with 2 children who are 4 and 2 years old. 

He will use this loan to buy soft drinks, bottled water, biscuits, cakes, groundnuts, and sweets to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe siempre piensa en el futuro de su familia tratando la forma de cómo salir adelante, el se a tenido que ingeniar la formo de cómo tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia motivo por el cual el a acudido a otro préstamo para tener otro capital para seguir hacia adelante con su siembras de papas ya que dicho producto es muy rentable en su comunidad.

Con la realización de un crédito el tuvo la oportunidad  de poder emprender su siembras  lo cual le resulto benefíciale para sus ingresos y para tener la experiencia de cómo pagar un préstamo y que le resulto con beneficios para el y su familia y también para su comunidad.

La inversión que el le dará al crédito es para la compra de abono químico para su siembra de papas ya que en  su comunidad donde el vive la tierra no es tan fértil y es por esa razón que necesita de abono químico.

Gracia al crédito que se le otorgo anterior mente el pudo sostener sus cultivos e invertir en las mismas y le generaron más ganancias solo así el pudo salir adelante en conjunto con su familia.

Los sueños de Felipe hacia el futuro es la construcción de las viviendas de sus hijo para que ellos aprovechen al máximo el esfuerzo que su padre realizo y para que ellos tangan una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Felipe is always thinking about his family’s future and ways that he can get ahead. He has had to figure out how to have an income to support his family, which is why he is requesting another loan. He would like more capital to move forward with his potato crops, as this product is very profitable in his community. 

With his previous loan he was able to begin his harvest, which increased his income, and was a good learning experience for him on how to repay a loan. This was profitable for himself, his family, and his community. 

He would like the new loan to purchase chemical fertilizer for his potato crops, because in his community the land is not very fertile, necessitating chemical fertilizer.

Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to sustain and invest in his crops, and now he will generate more profits, enabling him and his family to be successful. Felipe's dreams for the future are to build homes for his children so that they fully benefit from their father’s efforts and so that they will have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 3 years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells juice, bread, sugar, salt, and posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava). 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more juice, bread, sugar, salt, and posho, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and personal development. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more juice, bread, sugar, salt, and posho

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, tiene mucha clientela porque siempre es muy amable con los clientes, Doña teresa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is 65 years old and lives in her own home along with her daughter and grandson. She has been selling tortillas for eight years. Teresa has many customers because she is always very friendly with her customers.

Doña Teresa is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) and lime powder. This will enable her to continue making tortillas since this business is her only source of income. As a result, she can generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es una joven emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, trabaja vendiendo abarrotes, huevos y especies en el mercado de su ciudad natal, San Martin. Desde muy tempranas horas Flor sale a trabajar porque quiere darle lo mejor a su familia y espera prosperar en el negocio. Es una joven muy responsable, luchadora, con la mayor motivación que tiene: su familia.
Flor está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería como huevos, condimentos, frutas, entre otros para poder implementarlo en su negocio y así mejorar sus ventas. Gracias a esto Flor mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y así seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en una próspera comerciante y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to do well in life. Her job is selling groceries, eggs and spices at the market in her home city of San Martin. Flor goes out to work from very early in the morning because she wants to give her family the best and she hopes to do well in her business. She is a very responsible and hard-working young woman and the greatest motivation she has is her family.

Flor is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have given her will enable her to buy goods such as eggs, condiments, fruit and other items to sell in her business and so improve her sales. As a result Flor will improve her family's quality of life and will be able to continue working hard in order to become a successful saleswoman and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, groceries and other items for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Jean Felix  is 30 years old. He is married and has two children, 5 and 10 years old. Both of them go to school. 

He has been selling at a shop for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt and bread for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and bread for sale.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en: Janvier is 25-years-old. He is married with 3 children aged between 6 years and 3 months. Two of the children go to school. He sells food items and has been running a business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, sorghum, and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize for his business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 28 years old and married. She runs a food stall in Nakuru and has been in this business for five years now. Her husband, Jackson, also provides additional income and, together, they have been blessed with two children. 

She will use this loan to buy more maize flour, vegetables, potatoes, bananas, milk, crates of soft drinks, and cooking oil. This will enable her to serve more customers and increase her income, which she will use to expand her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and, in the future, she hopes to buy a piece of land and do farming.

loans.use: to buy more flour, vegetables, cooking oil, and other food items to serve more customers.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 24 years old. He has been selling from a shop for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as soap, salt, and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build his house.

loans.use: To buy more items such as soap, salt, and soda for sale.

loans.name: Lazare

texts.en: Lazare is 40 years old. He is married and has five children, aged between 2 and 13. Four of them go to school. Lazaro has been selling at his shop for eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items to sell, such as shoes, slippers, basins, and biscuits. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as shoes, basins, and biscuits

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu operates a mat-weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paint for decorating the mats and also buy sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase paint and material her mat-sewing business.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 21 years old. She is married with one child who is 2 years old and does not yet go to school. She has a shop and she has been working in this business for the past 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, salt, biscuits, soaps, and saddles for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to increase her business and the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, salt, biscuits, soaps and saddles for sale.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 31 years old. She is married, she is a farmer and has been working for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy cows and goats for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Bategeye

texts.en:
Bantegeye is aged 31 years, and she is married with 6 children aged between 1 and 11 years old, of which 3 go to school.

She has been selling domestic animals such as cows for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Ngone

texts.es: NGONE est un femme qui est mariée et mère de famille, qui habite le même quartier que le guichet. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des prêts à porter. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans cette activité. Etant à son 1er crédit, elle demande ce dernier pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite ouvrir une grande boutique d'alimentation générale afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l'argent à coté. Ainsi elle pourra faire des voyages à l'extérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Ngone is a married mother. She lives in Thies, Senegal. She has been running a clothing business for 10 years now.

This is her first loan, and she is requesting it to increase her stock and diversify her clothing products. She helps her husband with the daily expenses which include their children's schooling fees.

She wishes to open a grocery store to increase her revenue, save more money and travel outside her country.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association KOTOTALA de FILABOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de SETOU qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à FILABOUGOU qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune rurale du dit lieu,  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : mil et maïs. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. 
SETOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à FILABOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de céréale. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac de mil et 2 sacs de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les villages environnant. Elle effectue ses ventes à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is part of the KOTOTALA association of FILABOUGOU. It consists of married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 38 years of age and four children each. They practice various activities including the purchase and sale of cereals through SETOU, standing 1st from the left in the group photo. They live in large traditional families in FILABOUGOU, a district of the rural commune of OUELESSEBOUGOU, prefecture of KATI (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

They have been engaged in small trade for many years and they are in high demand for their purchase and sale of cereals, namely millet and maize.

In an effort to meet their customers’ increasing demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution four years ago. This is their 8th group loan cycle.  

SETOU, the group’s president, is well known around FILABOUGOU and highly skilled at selling cereals. She plans to use her loan to buy one sack of millet and two sacks of maize. She buys her stock in OUELESSEBOUGOU and neighboring villages, and she retails her merchandise in OUELESSEBOUGOU, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.    

Setou hopes to earn a monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy millet and maize for resale.

loans.name: Rwensing Women's Group

texts.en:
Flavia is a client from Rwensinga Women's Group, which is found in rural Ibanda district. She operates a food stall in Nyarukiika trading centre. She has three children, and she is married, but the husband is not staying with her. Therefore, she struggles to take care of the kids and other family necessities, since she is alone.
