She requested UGX 500,000 to help her buy bananas and Irish potatoes to resell. She hopes she will be able to make enough money to pay rent, meet her family's basic needs, and pay tuition. She is a hard-working lady, and she will manage, if given the financial boost.

Her major challenge is having too little capital to boost her business; yet, she has to keep paying fees for the kids.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Hello lender, meet Cheruiyot. He is a hardworking mixed-farmer from Boito village deep in the South Rift region of Kenya.  On a family owned three acre piece of land, he lives together with his mother. For most of his life, he has been helping out on the farm and as a result he developed hands-on experience. He started his own farm projects five years ago and has made a living producing and selling milk and tea from the farm. He also purchased a motorcycle that he uses to offer transportation services. 

In order to make more income, to diversify the product portfolio and spread risks, Cheruiyot is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Most farmers in the rural areas keep poultry for cultural and subsistence purposes. To Cheruiyot however, poultry has the potential to be a big business. With an upsurge in the catering industry, the demand for poultry is getting bigger and bigger. 

With your loan, Cheruiyot is going to invest in a lucrative space and make more profits. The additional profits will be put to use when time will come to pay for the expensive agricultural inputs. With the expansion of his business, he is setting up a good foundation that will improve his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en:
Gulbaniz, 41, is married and the mother of three children, two daughters who are sixteen and seventeen and a fourteen-year-old son. They study at the local school and the parents have to pay for their education. Her husband is a master and he repairs utensils, but his salary is not enough to cover the family’s needs. For this reason she takes care of her children's education by herself. 

Gulbaniz is involved in animal husbandry at their home. She started to raise cows and young bulls for resale twenty years ago, an occupation taught her by her brother-in-law. According to her, what she likes most about doing this is that it provides a stable income as well as milk and dairy products. 

Gulbaniz is applying for a 1,500 AZN loan through Aqroinvest to buy a few head of young cattle in order to increase her herd. Her desire is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a few head of young cattle

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en: This is Donathille, aged 34. She is married and has two children, aged nine and five years. Both of the children go to school. She has a shop and has been running a business for the past six years. After getting a loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, biscuits, and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, biscuits, and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Pao, 45, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school, while another one is too young for school. Pao struggles to make a living through growing rice, and working for others for a fee to earn more income. She can earn about 23,300 KHR per day.

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two now, to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living standard and health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Nyame Tease Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of highly committed women who are part of the group called Nyame Tease and are from Teshie, Ghana. Their revenue-generating activities focus mainly on small-scale retail ventures. They are held together by family ties, work and neighborliness. They are into pastries, groceries, drinks, materials and secondhand clothing.

Felicia is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to three children who are 9, 12 and 21 years old. She sells pastries. She will buy flour, margarine, sugar and fragrance to prepare pastries and sell them to customers. She trades in exchange for cash at her residence. She also provides decoration services for weddings and parties.

With the profits from this venture, she is planning to assist her husband with their family's daily expenses, most importantly with paying for their children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar and fragrance to prepare pastries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Polleh

texts.en:
Polleh is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients. Hence, her goods perish and this leads to losses.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Maa Shakti Group

texts.en:
Banita, age about 33 years old, is the group leader of a 19 member group from Tikrapada of Bhawanipatna town situated in the Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of her husband and herself. The member sitting in the middle of the second row with a raised hand is Banita. 

Banita is maintaining her family by doing a milk business. She has three cows, and they are giving ten liters of milk a day, which she supplies to tea stalls. Her husband helps her by bringing fodder from the market and supplying milk to the tea stalls. She is a very active lady, who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

At present, Banita's monthly income is Rs.4,500 which is not sufficient to maintain her family. So she, along with 18 members, decided to form a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to improve their businesses. From the present loan, she will purchase three cows and supply milk to the hotels. She will earn some extra income to maintain a better life. 

The other 18 members of her group are Sucheta, Jamuna, Kasturi, Kaledri, Amrut, Drapadi, Damayanti, Dipa, Rukuni, Laxmidei, Gura, Amrut, Souri, Kumudini, Tebabati, Josoda, Dusila and Gita. They are doing different businesses in their locality.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 50-year-old, married, with three kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. 

Raya has a small plantation where she grows tomatoes and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 24 years. 

Now she needs a loan,1500 azn, to buy sprayers, fertilizer, chemicals and crops. She has been a member of Aqroinvest CU since 2014. 

Raya  will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, fertilizer, chemicals, and crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer to improve the soil's organic level.

loans.name: Ulvi

texts.en:
Ulvi is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his parents in an IDP settlement.  Ulvi has been involved in agriculture since the age of 17 when, with his brothers’ help, he planted beans and had a very successful harvest. Since then, he has devoted part of his life to this activity, which he really enjoys. 

Ulvi  is requesting a loan 1200 azn  to care for his current vegetable crops, which now include potatoes, by buying organic compost. Thanks to its natural ingredients, the compost will produce an excellent harvest. 

Ulvi's future plans are to continue growing and working hard to provide a better life for his parents.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° de educación básica, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres ya no lo apoyaron ya que consideraban que el estudio o era tan importante como lo es hoy. Está casado y tiene dos hijos de 6 años de edad y 10 años de edad, solo su esposa y sus hijo viven con él y dependen de él.

Elmer es agricultor, en estos momentos tiene establecido 18 tareas de maíz que necesita ser fertilizada y necesita el préstamo para comprar el fertilizante.

Elmer espera dar el estudio completo a sus hijos y tengan la oportunidad que él quiso y no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Elmer, 41, studied up to 9th grade. He didn’t continue his education because his parents no longer supported him, as they felt that education wasn’t as important as it is today. He is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10. Only his wife and children live with him and depend on him.
 
Elmer is a farmer; at the moment he has 18 hectares of corn that needs to be fertilized, and he needs a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Elmer hopes to give his children a complete education so that they have the opportunity that he wanted but could not have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Ruqayia

texts.en:
Ruqayia is a 48-year-old, married woman who has three children. 

She has been running a business, selling cloth, to meet her household expenses. She sells the cloth in her locality after purchasing it wholesale, at a slightly lower price. This business is the only source of income for her household. 

Ruqayia is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she shows a good repayment history. 

Now, she has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 30,000. With this loan, Ruqayia intends to purchase from the market stocks of cloth in greater variety. She hopes to get a good return from this loan with which she wants to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cloth in greater variety.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has been doing it for the past four years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a conservative lady, so she asked her partner Maha who is her husband' aunt to appear in the picture instead. Jamila is a 20 year old, married, lady living in Irbid-Jordan. Her husband works as a cleaner at a hospital. She has been helping him in trying to improve their living conditions for one year by selling traditional clothes called ‘Abayas’ that her husband brings at her house with the help of her neighbor who is appearing in the photo. 

Because this business was profitable, Jamila is seeking to open her own shop in the future. Now she wants to expand her business by bringing in more Abayas. To do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and Abayas to sell

loans.name: Bakyara Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Barbara, 26 years old, is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd's Ishaka Branch and a member of Bakyara Twetungure Group. 

She is married with four children who are 12, 8, 5 and 3 years old and all of them attend school at the moment. She also has three stepchildren who stay with her after losing their mother and all attend school. She sells fresh foods, fruits and vegetables as her main source of income and her clients are all categories of people. She does fish trading from her local area of residence in Bassajja, Ishaka, Bushenyi District. She also makes crafts for sale where she earns income to support her family. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 through the group to buy more vegetables for her business. She started her businesses eight years ago to have a steady source of income to look after her family. She is a hardworking woman giving her businesses 12 hours a day and 7 days a week, which has enabled her to grow the business from one level to another. She is, however, faced with the challenge of the limited capital but hopes to do well after getting the loan. She hopes to grow her business and become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 41 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up with his parents in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon. He currently lives with his wife and their two children. His wife is unemployed and the kids are completing their middle school studies inside the camp. 

Growing up as a Palestinian refugee in an extremely unstable political and harsh social setting, Jamil completed his studies at school while slowly learning from his father's experience until he became a contractor for interior and exterior apartments painting. He also worked on the renovation of many UNRWA schools inside the camp. Inside the camp, Jamil is known for his commitment to his job as well as his honesty with his clients. 

Jamil is asking for a 4,112,759 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to buy paint supplies and necessary tools he needs for his next project. The loan will therefore allow him to expand his business and serve new clients in the camp which will support him in generating more income and provide his children with a financially stable future.

loans.use: to buy paint and tools needed for his next project

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns 2 cows and 2 calves. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her 6th loan cycle. She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that increase in milk production will help her in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Tajina

texts.en:
Tajina is a cheerful and hardworking married woman of age 52 years,  from a small village of Dhupguri, west Bengal.  She has four sons. She raises her children together with her husband.  But due to poverty, she could not send them to school. One of them works in a grocery shop and the others are unemployed.  

Tajina is involved in a business of sewing and needlework.  She learned it from her mother.  She is the main breadwinner of the family. Currently, this knowledge helps her to give financial support to her family to cover food expenses and other household expenses.  She sews women's clothing.  She earns a good income for the family. Her neighbors are her main customers and they are satisfied with her work. They appreciate her work. Thus, she has goodwill in her neighborhood.  

Currently, she would like to purchase a more modern sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher quality clothing.  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes for a better result and she dreams of having her own tailoring shop in the future in the market where she can employ more women like her.

Tajina is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her existing tailoring business.

loans.name: Sapriyah

texts.en:
Sapriyah, 50 years old and married. She lives with her husband. She have three daughter. Her husband is a non-regular worker in the transportation department. Every day he sets the order highways and public transportation. 

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve their access to water and sanitation. 
She want to have access to safe sanitation for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve their access to water and sanitation

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and a single mother of two school going children. She operates a hardware store where she sells a variety of cements to her customers. She has been in this business for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more cement for resale.                                                                                           

 
Beatrice will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more cement for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia operated a poultry selling business,. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Julia dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business; she appreciates the support of the loans, and she thanks Kiva and Yehu for their support.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Nhung's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: José René

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, no estudio debido a la falta de interés de sus padres al estudio, ya que para ellos lo mas importante era trabajar en la agricultura y dejaban de menos el estudio, por esa razón José no tubo el privilegio de estudiar, luego formo su propia familia, la creció con sacrifico y le ayudo a que estudiaran y aprendieran lo necesario porque es de mucha ayuda en la vida.

José tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad productiva, ya que fue lo mas exigido por sus  padres. Hoy en día sabe cual es la nutrición necesaria que tiene que darle al cultivo y el manejo adecuado para su desarrollo.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, abono para su cultivo de maíz, frijol y sorgo.
José  planea cultivar la cantidad de 30 tareas de maíz y unas 20 tareas de frijol y sorgo; ya que cuenta con la experiencia necesaria y sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener unos mejores ingresos para su diario vivir.
texts.en:
José is 68 years old. He didn't go to school because of his parents' lack of interest in schooling, since for them the most important thing was to work in agriculture and they didn't bother with studying. Because of this José didn't have the benefit of going to school. He then formed his own family and brought them up with self-sacrifice, helping them to study and learn what they needed, since it is a great help in life.

José has a lot of experience in growing crops, because his parents demanded the most of him. These days he knows what nutrition he needs to give to his crops and the right way to look after them for their development.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his corn, beans and sorghum crops. José plans to grow 30 hectares of corn and 20 hectares of beans and sorghum, given that he has the necessary experience. He dreams of improving his standard of living and having a better income for his everyday life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his corn, beans and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Sinak's Group

texts.en:
Sinak, 39, is a father of two children. He lives in Kampong Speu province. To overcome the family’s hardship, he grows rice as his sole source of income. He has been involved in this business for 21 years and he can earn about 20,000 KHR per day.

For Sinak, this is not his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he fully repaid his past loans. He is the group leader of a group of six members. Sinak will spend his loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family's standard living in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana has been helping her husband work on their farm to make a living. They make a good income, and with their determination of improving their farm, they work hard on it with GDMPC as their partner. She is thankful for the trust that the cooperative has given to the small farmers who want to augment their living situation. 

She took  a new loan recently to buy fertilizer. Greener pasture is her dream in the future, to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area, and to raise her profits.  She appreciates the support of the previous loan.

For that reason, with the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, and water melons. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, and water melons.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 20-year-old young lady doing a business of cattle purchase and sale. After raising small animals such as baby goats and calves, she sells them in her locality. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing. 

She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stove, a cart and other construction materials to renovate their manioc processing unit

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children from Kampong Speu province, Tha is 32 years old. She struggles to make a living via rice cropping as her sole source of income. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the first time for Tha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine to upgrade her standard of living. She hopes that her family will be living in healthy conditions after she gets this latrine.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to upgrade her standard of living.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Jose Norlando

texts.es: Don Jose es un microempresario exitoso, emprendedor tiene 31 años de edad, soltero y su negocio gira en vender mercadería en general ubicada en su domicilio desde hace ocho meses, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ropa, zapatos, sandalias, camisas de hombre y mujer, etc. El socio lleva su segundo préstamo en la  institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose is a successful, enterprising microbusinessman. He is 31 years old, single and for eight months now, his business has revolved around selling general merchandise out of his home. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of products, such as clothing, shoes, sandals, women's and men's shirts, etc. 

This is the member's second loan with this entity and he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual in his payments.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, flip-flops, etc to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. Ederlinda has been in this business for 22 years, and also earns income from farming coconut. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Beatriz works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell food supplement products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more herbal products to sell in her buy-and-sell food supplement products business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities with her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Guluipa

texts.ru: Гулуйпа, 53 года, замужем, есть трое детей. У Гулуйпы высшее образование, работает в школе учителем младших классов. Дополнительно занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 3 коровы, 15 овец, также на 0,50 ГА собственной земельной доли, Гулуйпа выращивает ячмень, картофель и прочую сельскохозяйственную продукцию, применяя только натуральные удобрения и ручной труд. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Гулуйпы составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Гулуйпа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для благоустройства дома и постройку сарая для скота. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Гулуйпа планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Guluipa is 53, married, and has three children.  She has a university education, works as a schoolteacher, and earns money on the side as a farmer.  She has three cows, fifteen sheep, and a 0.5-hectare plot of land for growing barley, potatoes and a few other crops, using only natural fertilizers and manual labor.  Her monthly income is nearly 20,000 som.  Guluipa is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy building materials for renovating her home and building a barn for her animals.  She plans on using her future profits to further expand her business.

loans.use: make improvements to her house and build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 48 years old, separated from her husband, and is taking care of her three children. To support her family, Imelda engaged in various odd jobs and income generating activities that included selling consigned cosmetic items and clothes. From her earnings, she was able to save and set up a small store in her house.

On November 2010, Imelda was invited by a friend to join SEED where she got a loan to add up to her store's rolling capital. From this, and with the subsequent loans from SEED, Imelda was able to increase her stocks and add up new products such as eggs and frozen meat. Selling of eggs prospered and she established herself as an egg dealer in her community as well as nearby localities. 

On her 6th loan now, Imelda plans to introduce another new product where, like the eggs, she is confident of increased sales and income. On this loan Imelda would buy notebooks, papers, pens and other in-demand school supplies. Imelda knew that no other store in her community is selling these types of items. Often too, school children would have to purchase their school needs from the City Market.

In the long term, Imelda aspires to continuously increase her capital and income-base by introducing products that are not available from other competitors but needed in her community. It is her ultimate goal that through the success of her business, she will be able to support the educational needs of her children who are now going to college.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, papers, pens and other in-demand school supplies as added products in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to increase stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pursue his master's degree in Business and Sales Management.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire help to clean and plant over burnt cacao.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 55 años de edad, no estudio sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar solo trabajo,esta casada, su esposo trabaja de albañil,viven con dos nietos,  sus dos hijos ya no están con ellos y viven en casa propia.

María tiene un pequeño negocio de cafetin, fuera de su casa vende productos de primera necesidad como:papel,arroz,azúcar,aceite,gaseosas,jugos y otros productos de primera necesidad,ademas por las tardes vende pupusas; el horario es de 3:00 PM a 7:00 PM.

 El préstamo lo necesita para comprar otros artículos que no tiene ahorita en existencia como:maíz,frijoles,harina, etc. ya teniendo todos estos productos mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para su familia.

El sueño de María es que su negocio le de siempre buenos ingresos y siempre mantenerlo surtido de todos los productos que sus clientes necesitan y tener a tiempo sus cuotas.
texts.en: María is 55 years old. She did not study because her parents did not make her study. She only worked. She is married. Her husband works as a mason. They live with her two grandchildren. Their two children don't live with them anymore; they live in their own house. Maria has a small business of a café outside of her home. She sells basic staples such as: paper, rice, sugar, oil, sodas, juices and other basic goods. Also, in the afternoon she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her schedule is from 3:00 PM to 7:00 PM. She needs the loan to buy other items that she does not have now, such as: corn, beans, flour, etc.  Having these items she will improve her income and her family's quality of life. Maria's dream is that her business renders good income and to have it always well stocked with all the products her customers need, and to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, flour, etc. to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a stable job

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 41-year old wife and mother to three school-aged children. As regular employment was elusive to both Cynthia and her husband, the couple decided to set-up a small store in the early years of their marriage. To increase their income, they have also decided to acquire a motorcycle on a loan-basis from a motorcycle dealer's shop. The motorcycle was converted to become a transport tricycle with which Cynthia's husband is the one driving. 

From both businesses, Cynthia and her husband finished paying their motorcycle loan on time and has added stock to her store. In 2010, the couple thought of setting up a scrap buying and selling business, after seeing the potential of the business and the absence of any competitor in their area. At that time, Cynthia joined SEED and availed a loan to start-up their scrap business.

To date, the scrap business went well. Everyday various ambulant scrap sellers are flocking their house to sell various recyclable items such as PET bottles, scrap metal, scrap wood and paper.  Buying of scraps include inspection and weighing of the materials which she does in their front yard. Afterward, Cynthia would sort and stock these to a storage area at the back of their house. For Cynthia, in this business, she starts receiving customers as early as 6:00 a.m. until early evening.

Even as the scrap business has been earning well, Cynthia has maintained her store saying that income from this business has helped them sail through times when scraps are being bought from them by bigger shops at a lower price. With diligence and positive habits in savings, Cynthia was also able to buy a new motorcycle. To date Cynthia wants to buy a side car and use the recently bought motorcycle to transport scraps to and from her place. With this, she will be able to save money from renting vehicles when she deliver scraps to bigger shops and at the same time be able to buy from bulk scrap sellers in her neighborhood.

For Cynthia and her husband, their efforts and commitment to do business well is aligned with their dream of seeing their children finish school. The couple also hopes that they will be able to secure a house of their own in the future.

loans.use: to buy a side car for her motorcycle to be used as transport service and for additional rolling capital for her scrap buying and selling business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
At 60 years old, Helen continues to work to support her family. Originally hailing from Mindanao, Helen and her family decided to migrate in Cavite after her husband was employed as a security guard. To support the family's needs, Helen decided to sell snack items near a bus terminal from where they are living. Income from her business and earnings from her husband's work covered most of their needs and specially with some of their children already gaining financial independence from them.

However in 2003, Helen's husband lost his job and their daughter became a single parent. With only little financial support from their other children who at that time have their own families to support, Helen decided to expand her business by vending rice and viand. This was made possible after Helen joined SEED in 2005 and availed a first loan to support her eatery business. The business went well as the location is strategic in terms of potential customers to the business to include bus drivers, terminal employees and passengers. As her income became steady, Helen ensured that she is also paying back SEED and putting also a portion for savings diligently.

From these, Helen was able to improve their living conditions. She is able to support the education of her grandchild, and is able to buy appliances to include a television set and a liquefied petroleum gas stove. On top of this after the typhoon that hit Cavite in July this year, Helen was able to have their damaged roof repaired. 

Helen is also able to set up another business in the same location near a bus terminal where she sells plastic wares for kitchen, bathroom and general home use. Due to good sales and seeing further potentials in the plastic wares business, Helen trained and has already entrusted the operations of their eatery business to her daughter. 

On her 5th loan now, Helen plans to buy plastic containers to sell her customers in need of potable water storage. The opportunity to sell water containers has been high following the consecutive typhoons that hit Cavite, wherein potable water is not easily accessible and if available comes with a bigger than ordinary price. 

In the future, Helen wants to improve her business space owing to the growth of their family's businesses. As she ages, she wants to ensure that she will be able to impart business skills to her daughter with whom their business will be passed on.

loans.use: to buy plastic water containers to sell her customers in need of potable water storage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 27 year old graduate of a vocational course. He lives in Bacolod City. He belongs to a family of 5. His father works as a flower pot maker, and his mother is a housewife. Edward has 2 siblings in elementary school. Their total monthly family income is Php 10,000 ($220).
Edward is currently working as a casual employee at a bus company as a machine technician. He earns Php 5,000 ($113) per month, but this income is only enough for his personal needs. Edward would like to earn more for himself and for his family, and he believes that the training at Bagosphere might make him realize this goal. Edward’s short term goal is to become a part of BPO industry.  And long term, he plans to become financially stable and to have his own business.  Your generosity in funding Alfred's loan will greatly motivate him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job that will help him become financially stable

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 52 años de edad, soltera, madre de una niña de 12 años y otro hijo ya independiente, y su negocio es la venta de calcetines.
Ella es responsable, buena madre, optimista, fuerte, luchadora, trabajadora y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la calle Comercio que se encuentra a pocos metros de la plaza principal de la ciudad, y sólo se realiza durante la noche porque de día es paso peatonal.
Catalina es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara el cual ya no utiliza porque en el lugar de su negocio sólo se habla español y algunas lenguas extranjeras. Su negocio es la venta de calcetines, medias panty, calzas, medias de lana, etc., es una labor rentable porque por el lugar transitan muchos turistas y realizan la compra debido al clima frío del lugar. Su hija estudia por las mañanas en la escuela secundaria y la acompaña durante las noches.
El sueño de Catalina es que su hija termine la escuela secundaria y logre estudios superiores para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella necesita realizar la compra de medias por mayor para generar mejores ingresos económicos y ayudar a su hija.
Es por esos motivos que Catalina solicita un préstamo para la compra de medias por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los estudios de su hija de 12 años.
texts.en:
Catalina is a woman of 52. She is single and is the mother of a 12-year-old girl and has a son who is already independent. Her business is selling socks.

She is a good, responsible mother, optimistic, strong, striving, hard-working, and very friendly. She carries out her business on the commercial street that is a few meters from the principal square of the city, and she only does it at night, because in the day it is a pedestrian walkway.

Catalina has dark skin and long black braided hair. Her form of dress is traditional (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Aymara, which she doesn't use because in her place of business only Spanish and some foreign languages are spoken. Her business is selling socks, panty hose, stockings, wool socks, etc. It is profitable work because many tourists pass through this place and make purchases due to the cold climate of the place. Her daughter goes to secondary school in the mornings and accompanies her in the evenings.

Catalina's dream is for her daughter to finish secondary school and achieve higher level education in order to improve her quality of life. She needs to make the purchase of more socks wholesale in order to generate more economic income and help her daughter.

It is for these reasons that Catalina is applying for a loan to purchase socks wholesale and pay for her 12-year-old daughter's education with the earnings.

loans.use: to buy socks wholesale and pay for her daughter's schooling with the profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to start a beauty salon.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 41 years old, is married and has two children. With her husband, Edna owns and manages a shop that sells motorcycle parts and also provide repair services.

When Edna and her husband were starting out, Edna's husband worked in a friend's motorcycle shop as a repairman. Slowly Edna's husband learned the trade and eventually when the owner of the shop decided to sell the business for personal reasons, the couple decided to absorb the business. This was made possible with the loan Edna acquired from SEED when she joined in 2010.

From subsequent loans in SEED, Edna and her husband was able to put up a variety of other motorcycle parts for sale to complement their repair services. They were also able to buy display shelves to make their stocks organized and attractive to buyers. Apart from these, Edna and her husband is able to send all their children to school as well as finance the medical needs of her mother-in-law who is living with them.

On her 5th loan now, Edna plans to buy motorcycle replacement parts such as motorcycle wheels, led lights, side mirrors as well as rider and motorcycle accessories such as high speed sniper and leg shields to sell to their customers. The rider accessories are specially demanded following the increased awareness of motorcycle riders on road safety. With this loan, Edna is confident in the increase of her income and in her ability to finish her loan obligations in just four months.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and accessories to sell to customers of her motorcycle parts and repair shop.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Coming from a poor family which could hardly support his education, Angelo started to work as a scavenger in a dumpsite in Cavite. Back then, when dump trucks would arrive at the open landfill, Angelo with other scavengers would be searching for paper, cartons, plastics, metals and other possible recyclable items which he could sell in nearby junk shops. For years this activity has helped Angelo support his family's needs.

Due to his hard work, Angelo was eventually hired as a helper in one of the junk shops in the area. At around the same period, Angelo got married and began to build his own family. As a helper in the junk shop, Angelo was able to learn the business. In 2010, Angelo and his wife decided to put up their own junk shop from their own savings. 

The business went well and Angelo's shop became known in the area, attracting other ambulant scrap sellers from nearby communities. It was at this time that Angelo saw the necessity to have more capital which he needs to buy scraps in volume. In 2013 he joined SEED and was provided a loan to support his rolling capital requirement.

Being a responsible payer, Angelo was able to have several reloans in SEED. Also, in maximizing other services of SEED to include trainings on business management and development, Angelo was able to steadily improve his business and consequently increase his income. The living condition of their family improved as Angelo was able to have his house repaired by having sturdier roof and walls. He was also able to buy furnitures and appliances which made their day-to-day living more convenient. But more importantly, Angelo's business improved. He was able to construct a storage for the scraps he buys which enables him to stock scraps and sell them at the opportune time when prices are to his favor.

As Angelo's income grew, Angelo has also improved his savings. On his 5th loan now, Angelo plans to pool the loan amount to his savings in order for him to buy a delivery truck. Presently, Angelo is renting a van which is considerably one of his biggest expense item. With the new truck, Angelo will be able to save on transport expenses and at the same time increase the volume of scraps he deliver to his buyers.

loans.use: to buy a delivery truck for his scrap recycling business.

loans.name: Xolmirzo

texts.ru:
Холмирзо позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Холмирзо является председателем колхоза, в котором они живут. Жена Холмирзо работает учительницей в местной школе, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. 

Вместе со своей женой Холмирзо старается зарабатывать и делать всё возможное чтобы их дети жили в достатке. Для дополнительного дохода Холмирзо занимается также откормом и продажей скота, а его жена помогает ему в этом деле. Но у него есть мечта, Холмирзо хочет сделать капитальный ремонт своего дома с достройкой. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе ремонт и построение в своём доме. Поэтому Холмирзо обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта и построения дома. Холмирзо надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Xolmirzo is a positive and responsible 42-year-old man. He is married and has three children. He lives with his family in a small village. The house, where they live, is small and not well set up for comfortable living in it. Xolmirzo is a chairman of their local collective farm. Xolmirzo's wife works as a teacher at a local school. She is a very hardworking and caring mother.

Together with this wife, Xolmirzo tries to earn and do everything possible for their children to live in abundance. To provide an additional income, Xolmirzo is involved in fattening up and selling livestock, and his wife helps him with this business. But he has a dream - Xolmirzo wants to make major repairs of his house and add another wing, however, he needs money to accomplish this. What he earns is not enough to allow himself to do the repairs and construction at home. This is why Xolmirzo came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials in order to repair and add onto the house. Xolmirzo hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair and add onto his house

loans.name: Suma Pacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA PACHA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas por mayor, venta de papas fritas, venta de papa y chuño, venta de zapatos de cholitas, servicio de transporte, venta de mantas de alpaca, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de mantas a groches; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años en una institución técnica, posteriormente empezó su negocio con un poco capital y lo comercializó en las ferias cercanas a su zona. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SUMA PACHA” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Centre. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Flora is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank have are varied and include: selling jumpers wholesale, selling chips, selling potatoes and dried potato, selling traditional women's shoes, transport services, selling alpaca blankets, selling vegetables.

The loan they are going to take out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Flora is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling crocheted blankets. She says she learnt this business several years ago at a technical institute and later started her own business with a small amount of capital and sold the blankets at markets near to where she lives.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy vicuña wool wholesale, which she will buy from the wholesale vendors at the markets in the city of El Alto. After making the blankets she will sell them at her sales point. This kind of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she lives with a partner and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health care provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy jumpers wholesale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Andrea works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready-to-wear. Andrea is borrowing 24,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell for her buy and sell frozen foods business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three, Julie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns income  selling charcoal. 

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF, all of which have been repaid. She is requesting a new loan for PHP 20000 to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Julie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Santos Nazario

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, Santos de 36 años de edad casado con cinco hijos el primer hijo ya tiene familia separada, y los cuatro últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, su familia  se a vuelto el más grande reto para el ya que tiene que hacer el esfuerzo de luchar por su familia cada día para darles un buen futuro y educación a sus hijos.

La actividad principal de el es la venta de leñas en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender su propio negocio en su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 6 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la remodelación de su vivienda ya que las condiciones de su vivienda ya no son las adecuadas para vivir o tener una vida adecuada en ella y es por ello que el necesita de recursos económicos para poder arreglar su vivienda.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Santos es ver crecer a su hijo y darle educación para que lleguen a ser profesional y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Santos, 36, is helping to build a country where development is ubiquitous. He is married and has five children. The eldest child is married and lives with his/her family. The other four children study at the community school. He has to work hard and faces the great challenge of providing for his family and making sure his children can have a promising future and receive a good education.

He works selling firewood to locals. He decided to do this already when he was a child and has been doing it for six years. It has meant a lot of hard work for him, but he is proud to do it when he thinks of his family: they depend on his income to fulfill all their needs. The community also needs this kind of activity.

Santos is requesting a loan to make some home improvements, since his house is not in good shape and is unsafe. This is why he needs money to repair it. One of his biggest dreams is to see his son grow up and pay for his education. He hopes that he can become a professional and open a construction company that can help the community to develop.

loans.use: to pay for renovations of his house.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella vive en El Alto. En una casa de adobe donde paga un anticretico a la vez que hace de cuidadora de la propiedad  Julia es carnicera  y necesita un prestamo para incrementar su capital para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de res Julia sigue siendo la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Julia is married, has 4 children and she lives in El Alto. She lives in an adobe house that she leases and is also the caretaker of the property. Julia is a butcher and she needs a loan to increase her working capital to buy a larger quantity of beef. Julia is still the only source of income in her household so she needs your help.

loans.use: to increase her capital buying a large quantity of beef.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his car which is his principal mode of transportation to work.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 49-year-old hardworking mother of seven married to Thomas, who adds additional income to support their family.  Catherine has been a dairy farmer for a period of five years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 every month.

Catherine was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000 which she will use, along with her personal savings, to buy an additional dairy cow.

Catherine plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario vive en concubinato y no tiene hijos Hilario vive en la comunidad de Chauira Pampa en una casa de adobe que es de su propíedad, la vivienda tiene luz y agua y no tiene ningun defecto Hilario es agricultor y quiere un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera Hilario goza de buena salud y es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Hilario is in a common-law marriage and does not have children.  He lives in the Chauira Pampa community in an adobe house, which is his own.  The house has electricity and water, and it has no defects.

Hilario is a farmer.  He wants a loan in order to buy a dairy cow.  Hilario enjoys good health.  He is the only source of income in his household.  That is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maarina

texts.en:
Maarina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a restaurant n the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Having repaid her previous loan, Maarina  is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Maarian dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en:
Josianne is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 5 and 2 years, that do not yet go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been selling as her business for the past 5 years. After getting this loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, sweets, soap and tea bags for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, sweets, soap and tea bags for sale.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 29 years old, and he is not married. 

He distributes Tigo products and has been running a business for the past 2 years. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more voucher cards and telephones for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve his business and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more voucher cards and telephones for sale.

loans.name: Vital

texts.en: Vital is a father of two children. He is requesting a loan to pay for the tuition fees for his school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for his school.

loans.name: Lettina

texts.en:
Lettina is an 18-year-old married mother of one child. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe where she rents a small shop at the local business center. 

Lettina started her business two months ago selling small products such as sugar, salt, rice, sweets, powdered milk and drinks. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with her local school teaching children life skills. 

With this Kiva loan, Lettina will buy products in bulk and employ one helper to assist her. She hopes to open a bigger shop one day. She wishes to continue with her education with the profits she receives.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, rice, sweets, powdered milk and drinks.

loans.name: Mirian Yamileth

texts.es: Mirian, tiene 31 años de edad, está soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en un sector de cofradía  municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene una pulpería como su propio negocio de generación de ingresos, desde hace 1 año. Ofrece productos de la canasta basica como ser, carne, pollo, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, lácteos, productos de aseo, harina, sal, manteca etc. antes se dedicaba a la agricultura de plátano pero necesitaba de ingresos fijos.  Esta solicitando 15,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, productos de aseo, harina, manteca, huevos, lácteos y refrescos y poder incrementar su inventario y sus ventas. Su sueño es llegar a convertir su negocio en una abarrotería fuerte.
texts.en:
Mirian, age 31, is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in an area in the Cofradía municipality in San Pedro Sula.  She has a grocery store.  She has had her own business as her source of income for one year.  She sells basic needs products like meat, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, dairy products, hygiene products, flour, salt, and shortening, etc.  

She used to grow bananas, but she needed fixed income.

She is requesting 15,000 lempiras to buy basic grains, sugar, hygiene products, flour, shortening, eggs, dairy products, and soft drinks.  She will do this in order to be able to increase her inventory and her sales.

Her dream is to covert her business into a strong grocery business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nyame Nti Ayeyie Group

texts.en:
Edward, a 70-year-old man, lives in the Kadadwen community of Assin Fosu district in the Central Region of Ghana. Edward is married and has seven children, and all of them are in school. Edward has been a cocoa farmer for the past 9 years. He earns his living from the proceeds of the sale of cocoa beans each year. Edward is the representative of Nyame Nti Ayeyie Group. All the group members live in the same community. 

Edward and his group members were among the people who received community exposure education on climate change, protecting the forest and clean cooking from the field partner. Edward and his group members decided to use Elsa Clean Cookstoves to improve their lives. They need microfinance assistance to be able to purchase the stoves. The Elsa Clean Cookstove was developed through the research work of the African Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Science and Technology Programme and co-financed by the European Union to reduce deforestation and indoor and outdoor air pollution. The stove uses virgin pellet, which is abundant in their community.

Edward is requesting 300 GHS to enable him to purchase an Elsa Clean Cookstove to save him from smoke exposure. Edward and his group members are thankful to all their microlenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cookstove

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina esta casad desde hace 6 años y tiene dos hijos Justina vive en Tipampa en una casa de adobe que es propia y solo tiene luz, la vivienda no tiene ningun defecto Justina es agricultora y quiere un credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su produccion El marido trabaja como panadero pero los gastos de la casa y familia son demasiados y sus sueldos no alcanzan por eso Justina quiere un prestamo de Kiva Ela goza de buena salud y su evaluacion de credito es buena
texts.en:
Justina has been married for six years, and she has two children.  Justina lives in an adobe house, which is her own, in Tipampa.  The house only has electricity, but it has no defects.

Justina is a farmer, and she wants a loan to buy a dairy cow.  This will allow her to increase her production.

Her husband workers as a baker, but the expenses for the house and the family are too great, and their salaries do not cover them.  That is why Justina wants a Kiva loan.  She is in good health, and her credit evaluation is good.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
Comfort is the group leader of Freedom Group, from Kwadadwe in the Assin Fosu district of the Central Region of Ghana. Comfort is 55 years old. She is married with nine children; the eldest is 26 years old and the youngest 12 years old. All the children are in school. Comfort has been a cocoa farmer for the past 10 years and also sells kenkey to supplement the income from the cocoa farm to support her family.

Comfort and her group members have resolved to use Elsa clean cookstoves to replace their three-stone stoves, which use firewood and emit a lot of smoke in their kitchens. Elsa clean cookstoves uses virgin pellet (palm kennel shell), which is very common in their community. Comfort needs a microloan of 300 GHS to enable her to acquire an Elsa clean cookstove to save her family from indoor air pollution and facilitate her cooking. Your microloan will assist Comfort and her group members to improve the health of their families and save the forest within their community. Comfort and her group members are grateful to all their microlenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, tea, stationery, salt, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristobal es jubilado pero sigue trabajando como albañil, vive en la ciudad de El Alto necesita crédito para comprar material para refaccion como estuco, cemento y otros para refaccionar su casa pues su casa tiene muchas carencias Cristobal es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Cristobal is retired but continues to work as a mason.  He lives in the city of El Alto.  He is in need of a loan to purchase renovation materials such as stucco, cement and other supplies to refurbish his home because it has many issues.  Cristobal is the sole breadwinner in his household, which is why he is in need of help.

loans.use: purchase material renovation materials such as stucco, cement and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase stucco, cement and other materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Claudia Angelica

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven soltera de 18 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como Cajera en una chifa de su ciudad natal, San Vicente. Tiene un buen desempeño en su trabajo gracias a la educación de calidad que recibió por parte de sus padres desde pequeña, es una persona honesta, responsable y tiene muchos deseos de superación.
Claudia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar algunos muebles y enseres para su casa como nuevas ollas y vajilla, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y así seguirá luchando porque más adelante quiere tener su propio negocio para dar apoyo a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a single 18 year old with a strong desire to get ahead.  She works as a cashier in a Chinese restaurant in her hometown of San Vicente.  She has a good performance record thanks to the quality education that she received from a young age.  She is an honest and responsible person with many dreams of succeeding.  

Claudia is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given her, she will be able to purchase furniture and other wares for her home such as new pots and dishes.  This way, she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue to strive so that in the future, she will be able to start her own business and support her family.

loans.use: purchase items and a set of furniture for her home.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old woman married to Joseph, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Jane has been operating a clothing sales business for ten years, earning an income of 5,000 KES at the end of every month.

Jane is now taking out her first loan of 20,000 KES and intends to use this amount to buy additional dresses, shirts, blouses and trousers to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a succeessful life.

loans.use: To buy additional dresses, shirts, blouses and trousers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 38-year-old woman married to Isaack who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with three children. Janet has been operating a tailoring business for a period of six years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Janet is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy materials, zippers, threads and needles to add to her current stock which seems to be running out.

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to pay for school fees and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy materials, zippers, threads and needles to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a hardworking businessman from Rwebishuuri, Mbarara district. He is 28 years and is not yet married. He completed his studies to be a grade five primary teacher. He got a job, which was short lived, as he was dropped because of his inadequate level of education. His family members were unable to help because they lacked the money needed to further his education to the required level to retain his job. 

This gentleman, defeated and disappointed, decided to engage in the business of selling matooke (cooking bananas). At first he would buy just a bunch, sell it, and then buy another and sell it. He made profits, expanded his business and even managed to buy a plot of land, which he is developing.
On top this, he also pays school fees for his young sister, who is in the secondary level of her education. He wishes her not to suffer the way he suffered.

Because of this situation, Augustine has approached UGAFODE for financial assistance. He wishes to invest more in his business so as to compete favorably. In the future he also wishes to have his own family but only after establishing himself. We recommend him for any assistance and we highly appreciate any efforts to help such loved ones.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Jenansio

texts.en:
Jenansio is a hardworking client from Rwebikona Mbarara district. He is 47 years and is happily married with five children, all in school. He is not employed and his wife is also not employed, and as a result they find it quite challenging to pay school fees for the children and also sustain the family.
To boost the family income, he and his wife decided to start a small business, operating a small restaurant. The wife cooks, the husband washes the utensils and they serve the clients jointly, depending on the nature of the clients, to ensure quality customer service.

This business has been yielding results, as they are earning a living and school fees. However, there is high competition in the market and there is a need for better services of good quality. 

Jenansio has already accessed loans from UGAFODE, which he repaid very well, and he is once again approaching us for a loan of 1,400,000 UGX to buy a laptop for his son to help him in his studies, as it is a must to have one at his level of education. We, as usual, appreciate any assistance rendered to help him.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Gvantsa

texts.en:
Gvantsa, who is 29-year-old married woman, lives in a small village named Mashavera. She has a pensioner grandmother and husband, who is temporarily unemployed. The family earns a living by renting flats to the capital of Georgia. They generate approximately 400 GEL monthly, that is hardly enough to cover even their basic needs. 

In order to increase her family's living conditions, Gvantsa wants to expand her agribusiness. She requested a loan and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, called start-up program that gives a chance to poor people to start or re-start businesses. With the requested loan, Gvantsa will purchase 2 additional milk cows, she has already owns one, and will also purchase pigs and develop the agribusiness, which is a profitable activity in this kind of area. 

The loan will greatly assist Gvantsa and her husband, as they will get an additional source of income and increase productivity.  She awaits your support and kindness and will be thankful for the help.

loans.use: To purchase 2 milk cows and pigs

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne, 54-years-old, is married with 5 children between the ages of 18 and 29, two of them go to school. She has been selling shoes for 16 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sale.  The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sale.

loans.name: Deyvi Jesus

texts.es:
Deyvi Jesús tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Deyvi se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, brinda el servicio en el mismo distrito y alrededores, él solicita préstamo para arreglos de su vivienda, pues Deyvi desea construir una habitación como almacen para poder guardar sus herramientas de trabajo; dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas; con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Deyvi Jesús is 23, single, and has no children. He lives with his family in a rural part of Oyotún District, in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the Lambayeque Region along Peru's northern coast.  

Deyvi has been a laborer for over five years, working in the community where he lives and in nearby towns in Oyotún. Deyvi uses his own tools and equipment when he works, and is applying for a loan to pay for repairs to his family's home. He stores his tools and equipment there, and needs to ensure better storage conditions for these items, which are crucial to his work. Deyvi wants to boost his productivity so that he can better meet the needs of the customers who hire him.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs that will allow him to store his tools and equipment in better conditions.

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia, toda su vida ha vivido en el campo y ayudó a sus padres con los cultivos de las chacras, gracias a todos esos conocimientos adquiridos ahora que tiene su propia familia se le hace más fácil el trabajo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha podido cultivar caco y maíz en sus terrenos y cree que le está yendo bien gracias a su ardua labor diaria.
Amador quiere mejorar su producción para esta cosecha es por ello que utilizará el préstamo para poder realizar el mantenimiento total así como la limpieza de sus terrenos. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad y quiere que ellos sepan que esto lo ayudará enormemente a tener una mejor producción y a seguir disfrutando de su familia de manera tranquila.
texts.en:
Amador is a very hard-working man, who has always fought to take his family forward. All his life he has lived in the country, and he helped his parents with the farm’s crops. Thanks to all of this knowledge he has acquired and now that he has his own family, he finds the work easier. With a lot of effort, he has been able to grow cocoa and corn on his land, and he believes that it is going well thanks to his hard work everyday.

Amador wants to improve his production for this harvest, so he will use the loan to perform complete maintenance, including cleaning his land. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their generosity, and he wants them to know that this loan will help his enormously to have a better harvest and to continue enjoying time his family in a peaceful way.

loans.use: to maintain his farm for his cocoa and corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Las Cuatas Group

texts.es:
Las Cuatas es un grupo ubicado en parte de la sierra donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de caña, hule, nanche de los cuales obtienen ganancias para cubrir los gatos de su hogar.

El nombre del grupo se debe a que dos de las integrantes son cuatas. Comentan que cuando las bautizaron, al momento en que el sacerdote preguntó por el nombre de las pequeñas y cómo identificarlas, la madre de las muchachas mencionó que en los ojos estaba la diferencia: una de ellas tiene un ojo color café y el otro verde.

El grupo está integrado por 5 personas muy trabajadoras, alegres, atentas, hospitalarias y cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica:

Yennsy-Venta De Bisutería
Deissy -Venta De Lencería
Victoria-Venta De Postres
Josué Aldair-Venta De Hortalizas
Gloria - Tienda de Abarrotes

Doña Gloria tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene un hijo  que aún depende económicamente de ella, desde hace ya 20 años puso en casa una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual fue creciendo poco a poco. Durante este tiempo, Gloria ha invertido sus ganancias para cubrir los gastos de la casa y de la educación de su hijo, principalmente. También ha aportado para la remodelación de su casa y la ampliación de su tienda. 

Doña Gloria comenta que la buena atención es lo que ha hecho que el número de clientes aumenta y en segundo lugar, el amplio surtido de mercancía. Es por esto que quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, maíz, sopa, atún, galletas, café, leche, harina, chiles enlatados, para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.

El grupo agradece a Kiva y a VisionFund México por la gran oportunidad que les ha brindado al otorgarles un préstamo para invertirlo en sus respectivos negocios y de esta manera crecer con su negocio.

*En la imagen: Gloria viste de color naranja.
texts.en:
Las Cuatas (The Twins) is a group based in part of the sierra where most of the inhabitants works growing sugarcane, rubber and nanches, which allows them to provide for their households.

The group named itself as such because two of the members are twins.  They mention that when they were baptized, the priest asked for their names and who to tell them apart, and their mother told him that the difference was in their eyes.  One of them has a brown eye and a green eye.

The group is made up of five hardworking members who are happy, attentive and friendly, and all have a business :

Yennsy- jewelry sales
Deissy -underwear sales
Victoria-pastry sales
Josué Aldair-vegetable sales
Gloria - grocery store

Gloria is 42 years old, married and has a son who still depends on her financially.  Twenty years ago, she started a grocery store in her home, which has grown little by little.  During this time, Gloria has used her earnings to cover her household expenses and her son's education.  She has also been able to pay to remodel her home and expand her store.

Gloria comments that her good service as well as her large array of merchandise are what have allowed her to increase her customer base.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, corn, soup, tuna, cookies, coffee, milk, flour, and canned peppers to meet the needs of her customers.

The group thanks Kiva and VisionFund Mexico for the great opportunity that they have given them by providing them with a loan to invest in their respective businesses so that they can continue to grow their businesses.

Gloria is wearing orange in the picture.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, corn, soup, tuna, cookies, coffee, milk, flour, and canned peppers.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Мансур жизнерадостный молодой парень в возрасте 25 лет. Он женат и пока имеет одного ребёнка.  Мансур со своей женой живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своего ребёнка в любви и достатке. Мансур не имеет высшего образования, так как не смог поступить в Университет по финансовым трудностям в семье. 

Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Мансур занимается своим любимым делом. Мансур вот уже как несколько лет работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственный автомобиль.
