Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Этот бизнес приносит Мансуру хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание. А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства. Поэтому Мансур обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mansur is a happy young man, who is 25 years old. He is married and has one child for now. Mansur and his wife live happily and try to raise their child with love and abundance. Mansur does not have a higher education because he could not go to a university due to financial difficulties in his family. 

Mansur is involved in his favorite business to earn an income for living. Mansur has been working as a taxi driver for several years. He has his own car, but it has been serving him for a long time and had to be repaired many times. This is why he is currently planning to purchase a new and improved car in order to run and expand his business. This business yields Mansur a good income, but it is only enough for living expenses, and he needs money to buy a new car. This is why Mansur came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy a car in order to run his business. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to run his business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a permanent resident of Rugaaga, a village in Isingiro District, and he is 32 years old. He is married and does agriculture as a source of income. He practices agriculture, which lately has been hit by poor weather and the prevalence of pestilences, in particular “banana bacterial wilt (todula)”.  

He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 from Ugafode to help him improve the banana plantation which is at the brink of shrinking because of the disease. He hopes that if given the loan he will be able to save the plantation by uprooting the affected plants and pruning and mulching the good ones. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To hire labor and buy mulch.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is aged 35 years, and he is married with 2 children between the ages of 2 and 6. One of them goes to school. He has been selling from his shop for 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build and deploy 20 more electricity kiosks

loans.name: Msangi Group

texts.en:
Hamisi is a father of three children who are in school. He is in his mid-thirties and married. He has been running a shop selling dry food of different types: rice, beans, sugar, maize, baking flour, salt, cooking oil, etc. He has been running his business for fifteen years now and is able to realize a fair monthly profit. Hamisi works 6am to 11pm daily.

He is requesting his first loan via Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among MSANGI, his five member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Hamisi will invest his portion of the loan to buy food inventories to resell from his shop. His desire is to grow his business and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy food inventories to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 36 years old. She lives in the Zugdidi district with her two children. Her husband lives in Moscow. He works there and sends some money to his family. Marina owns a plot of agricultural land, where she grows nut trees and sells the harvest locally. 

Marina wants to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,500 to start a new business. She will open a small shop where she will sell home products and get additional and stable income. With increased income she will improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to open a shop and sell home products.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette is 26 years old. She has been selling in a shop for three years. 

With the loan, Marie Gorette would like to buy more rice, salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more rice, salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 27 years old and she is married with 1 child who does not yet go to school. She has been selling from a bar for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Damien

texts.en: Damien is 26 years old and he has been operating a bar for 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old. She is married, with four children, aged between one and 12. Three of them go to school. 

Nadia has been selling meat for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат в свои 38 лет разведена и живет с дочерью и двумя сыновьями в районе Дж.Расулова города Худжанд. Она способная деятельная женщина. На протяжении 10 лет Малохат предоставляет услуги швеи. Она по жизни храбрый человек и перед трудностями жизни не боится. Сейчас Малохат одна обеспечивает семью. Ее доход от деятельности является единственным источником дохода семьи, поэтому старшая дочь, которой уже 18 лет, активно помогает матери с заказами платьев. Они берут заказ на пошив женских таджикских платьев. Малохат хочет приобрести еще одну швейную машинку для расширения своего швейного дела. За счет суммы кредита она планирует купить новую модернизированную машинку, а на оставшуюся сумму сделать ремонт в одной части дома. Малохат верит и надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: Malohat is 38 and divorced and lives with her daughter and two sons in the city of Khujand in the J. Rasulova region. She is a capable businesswoman who has been offering her services as a seamstress for the past 10 years. She is a courageous person who is not afraid of challenges. Malohat takes care of her family by herself; revenue from her business is her family's only source of income, which is why her 18-year-old daughter helps her mother with dress orders. They take orders sewing traditional Tajik dresses. Malohat wants to buy another sewing machine to expand her business. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a new, modern sewing machine as well as to contribute to renovation costs for one part of her house. Malohat believes and hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to cover partial home renovation costs

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 33 years old and she is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 13. All of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ana Beatríz

texts.es:
Ana de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, la falta de recursos económicos la desmotivo a poder continuar estudiando. Está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen un hijo de 4 años, aun no asiste a la escuela, donde viven también viven los papá de Ana.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas (jocote, sandia, mango, melón etc.), cuenta con 5 años de realizar las ventas, la necesidad de tener ingresos y aportar al hogar la llevo a tomar las medidas que estaban a su alcance. 

También es ama de casa, se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y esposo. La forma de vender es de casa en casa, también los días domingos sale a las canchas de futbol a vender cuando hay partido, vende tres días a la semana, recorre una distancia aproximada de tres km en su ruta de venta, nadie más se involucra en el negocio, el horario de trabajo que tiene es por horas de la tarde.

El crédito lo invertirá en la construcción de una champa(galera) a la orilla de calle para poder realizar sus ventas, que donde está pensando construir es un punto de mucho movimiento de personas, por lo que se espera que le dé resultado. La necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener acceso a realizar su proyecto. 

Espera que su iniciativa le dé resultado, con lo que podrá apoyar mas a su familia, espera que su hijo tenga diferentes oportunidades a las que tubo ella, las ganancias del negocio la invertirá en tener para invertirle al negocio y cubrir el pago de la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old. She has studied through seventh group, since the lack of financial resources did not allower her to continue studying. She is married, and her partner works in agriculture. They have a 4-year-old son, who still doesn’t attend school. Ana’s parents also live with them.

She sells fruit (jocote, watermelon, mango, melon, etc.). She has spent 5 years selling. The need for income and to support the household pushed her to take the steps that were in her reach. She is also a housewife, and she takes care of her son and husband. She sells from door to door; on Sundays, she also goes to the soccer field to sell during games. She sells three days per week, covering a distance of about 3 km over the route. No one else is involved in the business. She works during the afternoon.

The loan will be invested in the construction of a gallery on the side of the street, in which she can make her sales. The place where she is considering building is in an area where many people travel, so she hopes that it goes well. The need will be satisfied when she is able to have the ability to complete her project.

She hopes that her initiative will give results, so that she will be able to support her family better. She hopes that her son has different opportunities than she had. The earnings from the business will be investing in the business and will cover the loan repayments.

loans.use: to build a gallery on the side of the street, in which she can make her sales.

loans.name: Deliphine

texts.en: Delphine is 39 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 7 and 17, and all of them go to school. She has been selling from a shop for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anthere

texts.en:
Anthere is 29 years old. He is in his first year with a vision of becoming a business manager after his graduation.

He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old. She is married, with five children, aged between four and 14, and all of them go to school. 

Alice has been selling foodstuffs for 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Las Artesanas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 30 años de edad residente en Sololá, casada con un hijo de 11 años que se dedica a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven cursando cuarto primaria,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia, (Juana es la que se encuentra en medio del grupo en la fotografía)

El actividad que realiza Juana es la fabricación de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas y los pone a la venta en la comunidad donde ella vive ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de refacciones, ella siempre trata la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que Juana le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Juana y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con alcanzar sus sueños en la vida que es llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Juana is shown in the middle of the group of the photo above. She is an entrepreneurial woman of 30 years of age. Juana lives in Sololá with her husband and her 11-year-old son. Her son is in the 4th grade of a local elementary school. Juana works very hard to support her family and improve their financial situation.  

Juana makes a living producing güipiles (traditional tops), skirts, and fajas típicas (traditional belts) and selling them in her community. She also has a secondary business making deserts. Juana is always trying to generate extra income so that she can provide her son with an education, which he deserves. She hopes that one day he will become a professional.

Juana will use this loan to buy thread she needs to make items of clothing to sell to her neighbors. This will help her to generate more income for herself and her family.

Juana and this group of women aspire to reach their dreams in life of succeeding. They hope that other will see that they need them to succeed.

One of Juana's goals for the future is to buy a small storefront in her community so that she can sell her merchandise and watch her son grow in school and become a professional so that he has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 23 years old. She is single .She resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. 

Veronica is a Cama member and she has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide. She teaches life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Veronica rents a table at the local market where she sells products such as bread, cooking oil and milk. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

She is applying for a loan to boost her business since there are few shops and people walk long distances searching for their basic needs. With the Kiva loan, Veronica will purchase bread, cooking oil and milk to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Transport costs are very high and people are suffering from lack of money since it is wasted in transport. 

With the profits she says she will help people in her community to support school children with materials like books, pencils, pens and sewing their uniforms. Her desire is to be a social philanthropist.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Anyidado Group

texts.en:
Paulina is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Kwadadwe in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. Paulina has 2 children (twins) who are two years old. She is a cocoa farmer and also a seamstress. She earns her living from the sale of her cocoa beans during both the major and the minor seasons, and supplements her income with seamstress services for her customers. 

Paulina is the leader of Anyidado Group. Paulina and her group members, after Community Education on Deforestation, Clean Cooking and Climate Change, have resolved to use an Elsa Clean Cook Stove to save them from the smoke of their 3 stoves that use firewood in an open fire. 

The Elsa Clean Cook Stove was developed under the research support of the ACP Science and Technology Programme, co-funded by the European Union under the BeBi Project to improve indoor/outdoor air quality, improve the health of women and children and to reduce deforestation. Paulina cannot afford to pay for an Elsa Clean Cook stove all at once, nor can she easily make monthly installment payments from her total household income. 

She needs a micro-loan of GHS 300 to enable her to pay for the stove. The provision of the loan will help Paulina buy an Elsa Clean Cook Stove to save her family from exposure to smoke from the kitchen. Funding her loan means improving the health of her family and no more cutting of the trees from the forest within her community to use as firewood for cooking. Paulina and her young twins are very grateful to you for your kind support.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove.

loans.name: Dani Maricruz

texts.es:
Dani es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de cinco años y una hija de cuatro años, su negocio es una tienda de ferretería.
Ella es comprensiva, paciente, constante, emprendedora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio se encuentra en la zona de Cruce Villa Adela, un sitio caracterizado por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas y las bajas temperaturas.
Dani es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su forma de vestir es a la moda pero se viste de forma típica (manta, pollera y sombrero)para las fiestas del lugar, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es una ferretería con artículos de construcción, como; tubos para agua y para conexión eléctrica, desagües, pintura, cemento, lijas para pared y madera, etc. Ella comenzó su actividad gracias a su padre, que conociendo la construcción en obra gruesa le enseñó los materiales más comunes para ese tipo de negocio, su vida la comparte con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes ya asisten a la escuela básica. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y generar mejores ingresos económicos para beneficio de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Dani solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la venta en su ferretería.
texts.en:
Dani is a 36-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, and she has a five-year-old son and a four-year-old daughter. Her business is a hardware store. She is understanding, patient, persevering, enterprising, a good mother, responsible, and hard working. Her business is located in the area of Cruce Villa Adela, a place characterized by increasing commerce in all areas and by lower temperatures.

Dani has brown skin, average height, and long black hair. Her manner of dress is in fashion, but she wears traditional clothing (blanket, full skirt, and hat) for celebrations in the area. Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she uses Spanish for her business. Her business is a hardware store with items for construction, including water pipes, electrical wires, drains, paint, cement, sandpaper for walls, wood, etc. She began this activity thanks to her father, who knew construction through rough work and who taught her the most common materials for this type of business. She shares her life with her husband and with her two children, who attend primary school. She dreams of growing her business and of earning a better income for the well-being of her family.

For these reasons, Dani requests a loan to buy construction materials to sell in her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell in her hardware store, with the goal of helping her family.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre, aged 47, is married with five children between 17 and 4 years old, all of whom go to school. He has a shop and has been working in a business for the past 12 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cooking oil, lotion, soap and ropes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, lotion, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Moliwe

texts.en:
Moliwe is a 41-year-old resident of Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches young students how to improve their well being, and she is also married and has four children.

For the past year and a half, Moliwe has been operating a business that sells kapenta (dried sardines), and she is hoping to give her business a boost. Moliwe is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can make bulk purchases of kapenta. This will enable her to sell more kapenta and earn more money that can help her support her family.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of kapenta.

loans.name: Gregore

texts.en: Gregore is 57 years old. He is a father of four children. He would like to request a loan for his tuition fees to pay his children's school fees. His children all have qualified to attend universities.

loans.use: to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is from Oaxaca, Mexico. She is a 47 year- old single mom of 2 boys: Raúl (17) and Sebastian (7). We live in a small community located in Oaxaca, Mexico.  She works doing cleaning activities in a local hospital and represents the only provider for her family. Her dream is to have a better house where they can live in peace.
She said they suffer a lot living in the actual house because the construction materials make the house extreme and unsafe. The house is extreme due to the excessive heat during the spring or summer and it is very cold at night. The house is unsafe because Hermelinda always ask support of her neighbors in the rainy or windy season. It seems like the roof is going to collapse and when this happens, their boys help her but the youngest is afraid of losing the house and begins to cry. Raúl and Sebastián are good boys and they help their mother in everything they can.
Raúl goes to high school and he is a good reader. His favorite book is Ventajas de Ser Invisible by Stephen Chbosky. In his free time he loves play soccer but he does not play too often because he has a disease and gets tired very soon. Due his condition he is not able to do hard work. 
Sebastián goes to the elementary school. He enjoys playing with the friends and neighbors. 
For Hermelinda, being a single mom is difficult because she wants to give her children the best.  She wants to provide them a real house in which they can play, do their homework and sleep well. “ I want to make them happier. I pray asking God the opportunity to earn a better salary or something that provides me a way to build a house with good material. I hope Habitat Mexico helps me to make my dream come true”.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Adwenpa Ye Group

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and is the group leader of Adwenpa Pa Ye group. Daniel is married with two children who are four and two years old respectively. One of his children is attending school. Daniel and his family live in Kadadwe in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. He is a cassava and plantain farmer. Daniel earns his living from his farming work. He is also a cocoa buyer during fruiting season as a way to diversify the sources of his income.

Daniel and his colleague group members were part of the people within their community who participated in a community education on clean cooking, indoor/outdoor air pollution, reducing deforestation and climate change.

Daniel and his group members decided to buy Elsa Clean Cook stoves to facilitate their cooking and save them from excessive heat and smoke from their kitchen. The Elsa Clean Cook Stove uses virgin pellets as fuel; hence they will no longer cut wood from the forest as either firewood or for charcoal. A micro loan of GHS 300 each will enable each group member including Daniel to acquire an Elsa Clean Cook Stove to improve the health of their families and save the forest within their community. Daniel, on behalf of his group members, thanks all their micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cook stove.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio arrived to his community looking for a better place for him, his son and his son´s family. He is 71 years old and he is a person in retirement but he considers himself as a very active man. The members of his community look for him when they need someone to assist any injured neighbor because Gregorio does first aid and he has been doing massage for 25 years.
They have been living in the community since 2005. His son is Filemón (32) and he works hard because he contributes significantly to the household income to support the family. Filemón works in the administrative area of a public medical clinic and he does not need to support his father because thanks to Gregorio´s pension he is able to cover his basic needs.
Gregorio´s grandchildren are Cherlyn (6) and Osmar (5); they are wonderful kids. He loves them very much and he wants the best for them. They enjoy going to the school and learn new things. When they return to home they share with Gregorio all what they´ve learnt.  For Cherlyn and Osmar it is very exciting to discover new things at their school. 
In her free time, Cherlyn loves playing with dolls and Osmar enjoys playing soccer. Their mom is Martha. She is a 26 –year- old housewife and she takes care of the kids, help them to do homework and play with them. 
Gregorio and family live in Oaxaca, Mexico. Their community is small but everyone knows everyone. They are good and united people.
Gregorio´s house is in bad conditions and they face different problems during the rainy season and winter making the house uncomfortable. For this reason, one of Gregorio´s dreams is to own a house made of good materials. “I want the best for my family and I want an adequate house for me and for them”. 
He hopes Habitat Mexico helps him to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Lata

texts.en:
Lata is a 34-year-old lady. She is married and the mother of four children (two sons and two daughters).  Her children are attending school and are in different grades.  They live in the village of West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal.  
 
Lata is a homemaker, and her husband is a farmer. He works on his farmland to bear the expenses of his family. He mainly grows paddy rice. The village has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers, making paddy cultivation possible. Thus, most of the farmers of this village are engaged in cultivating paddy. Moreover, as it is the staple food for the villagers of the region, as well as for the people of West Bengal, the product has a good demand and is profitable, too. Lata also helps her husband in his work while managing her household work.

Lata is very energetic, enthusiastic and determined to make her future through hard work and cooperation. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cultivate more paddies on their farmland. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase seeds, manure, and other things. She hopes the loan will help her to raise her standard of living and to provide higher education to her children.

She is thankful to the generous investors (BJS and Kiva) who stand for her in her odd days.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as paddy seeds, fertilizer, manure, etc. for cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Sarbina

texts.en:
Sarbina is from Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is a young housewife of 20 years old. She has one toddler baby. She lives in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud, and bamboo) with her husband and son. She attended school up to grade 9 and could not study further due to the poor economic resources of her parents. Now she is a housewife. Her husband Bulbul, aged 21, is a farmer by profession.  

Sarbina's husband mainly grows rice in his field. Sarbina and her husband have been involved in this activity for many years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation. Sarbina plans to improve her business by growing more paddy rice. She wants to boost her agricultural business.

So, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, manure, and other things. With this loan, she hopes she will grow better-quality paddy and sell it in the market.  She dreams of giving a decent lifestyle to her family and constructing a better and decent house (made of concrete and mortar).

Her earnest and heartiest thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es  madre soltera, tiene una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 6 años, los dos están estudiando, Lucia vive con sus padres y sus hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales, Lucia va a invertir el crédito en la comprar de terneros para criarlos y luego venderlos obteniendo algo de ganancia, Lucia aspira seguir trabajando, mejorar su negocio y también comprar una vaca lechera para ayudarse con los gastos de educación, alimento, salud de sus hijos ya que ella es padre  y madre de ellos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a single mother, she has a 13 year-old daughter and a 6 year-old son, and both of them are studying in school.  She lives with her parents and her children. She works at day labor and animal breeding.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of calves to breed them and sell them and from this she hopes to obtain some income.  Lucia aspires to continue working, improve her business, and also to purchase a milking cow to help with her children's education costs, food, and health, since she is both mother and father to them.

loans.use: to purchase calves to breed and sell them to her customers.
